story:
This book, The Gift of Memoir, is the culmination of many years experience in memoir writing. Working on it has been a passion for me, and an enormous amount of fun. In over ten years of teaching memoir writing, as well as creating oral histories and ghost writing, I have seen that everyone has interesting stories to tell, to write down, to save.

My interest in memoir started by hearing my students' stories while teaching French and English as a Second Language in Ontario and Florida. It continued as I travelled the Caribbean aboard a 46'sailboat as chef and crew and heard many fascinating stories there. The memoir that I wrote about the sailing years is called The Perfect Galley Book: Yarns, Tips and Recipes from the Heart of the Ship (Toronto: New Trend).

 I believe those who write memoirs are offering a valuable gift to family and/or the world. Those  who read them are enlightened by another's truths. This book is my gift to those who need help writing their stories. It will help them leave legacies for children and grandchildren and even generations as yet unborn.

Contributors to this project will make the world a better place by helping people write the stories of their lives. Personal stories enable readers to enter another's world and this increases understanding and empathy. Memoirs can give a sense of belonging, of history, of shelter. To write about your life is to immerse yourself in love. Love for life, love for even the losses, love for language and love for the literary form that makes sense of it all. And because love is healing, memoirs can be healing.

This project will cost approximately $4,930, but I am asking for $3000. The Canadian publisher requires $4500 for editing, proofing, printing, layout, design and cover. The e-book is extra.  Indiegogo fees, if I do raise the full sum, are about $125 (double that if I don't). There will be possibly 50 contributor copies ($250) of the book. Then, there will be postage to mail the cards (about $25), and envelopes to buy (about $30) for mailing the books.

Please see the specifics of perks below. There are grateful email thank you notes, gorgeous art cards, signed copies of the book, lunch on me in Grafton, delicious recipe booklets, one of my published memoir stories with every perk, your name in the acknowledgement section of The Gift of Memoir, editing  and party for all contributors at my place - date TBA..

If I don't raise the full amount, I will still send thanks and the promised books, cards, recipes and articles to those who contribute. And to anyone who contributes to the editing perks, I will still offer editing. All funds raised over the full goal I will donate to Save the Children.

What is the last memoir you read? How did it change you? The Gift of Memoir has a bibliography of over 50 memoirs that I refer to in examples. It will give you a few years' worth of memorable reading.

Story by story, memoirs change people, change the world.

story:
Hi there!  

I'm Shannon Elhart - a mom of two wonderful kids and a believer in creating more good in the world!  

I am a certified life coach with a Masters degree in counseling and psychology.  Since 2007 I've been working with clients who want to live happier lives.   I LOVE my work!

A BIG part of happiness and inner peace is GRATITUDE, so  I wrote a book Year of Gratitude.  There is no other book like it in the world!  It takes readers on a year long journey exploring gratitude in some unique and powerful ways!  

I'm raising money to get Year of Gratitude published in a book format.  Until now, it's been an e.book that is sent a little each week - and printed at home with journal pages.  But readers have said it would be pretty great if they could have it complete and resting on their nightstand.

When you contribute to this fund, you help raise the money needed to get Year of Gratitude published and in the hands of more people!  And that's really fabulous because the more people who are living a grateful, happy, peaceful life - the closer we are to having a happier world!  Let's do it!!!  Woo.Hoo!!

I need another $2,200 to get it published.  I have the rest saved, but as a single mom, saving is a little tough right now. 

Within that amount - my book will be printed complete with: a designed front- and back-cover as well as the interior design with journal pages & special colors/fonts,  its own ISBN and Library of Congress Control Number, formatting and distribution, selling in national book markets, a personalized bookstore page, U.S. Copyright registration, a 'see inside the book' feature, marketing and promotional materials to get it into the world, and much more to help the book be a success!

I've created some fabulous perks to say 'Thank you' for helping me get published!  There is plenty to choose from: autographed and personalized copies of Year of Gratitude, having your name in the book, baseball caps with my logo, and even a  membership into my program Happiness of You (worth $398).  

I deeply appreciate your support, and I want to show you my gratitude by sending you some wonderful gifts!

If I don't reach my goal, the funds will go to a special account I already have set up.  This account is my savings for publishing… you see, Year of Gratitude is my first book.  It's a tough market to break into, but once you have one book (self)published, you start getting taken a bit more seriously.   

This account is set up to help me with two other books I am currently writing.  Although I hope these two books will be published traditionally (rather than self.published), I am saving and saving and saving just in case I need to self.pub those too.  

A Happier World :)

You might wonder… is this book really necessary in our world?  

Yes!

Anything that helps people live happier, more peaceful lives is a perk to our world!  Let's face it - there are many reasons to feel sad or scared or angry - just turn on the news, and you'll see reasons.  BUT we need more reasons to celebrate the good stuff in life and in the world!   Year of Gratitude does that!  It lifts people's hearts, it helps them appreciate more, it provides them reminders of why to be happy, it teaches them how to find gratitude in some different places!

Reading Year of Gratitude will improve your life.  

Having many people read Year of Gratitude will improve the world!

Why I am trustworthy

I know I am asking you to donate to my book - which is also my dream and passion.  You might wonder… can I trust Shannon?

Yes you can.

If you know me at all - you'll know the love I have for helping people and for being a source of hope in our world.  You'll also know how hard I have worked as a single mom (at times holding three jobs) to take care of my kids without losing time with them and to be independent.  

I have also made choices - selling/giving things I don't need to get a little extra money, and choosing to forego unnecessary perks of a mid.west American woman  (new clothes and fancy hair for example) - so I could use my money on what matters more to me (yes, many of my clothes were given to me for free, and yes, you will have seen me with faaaar too much gray hair for a single lady of my age :) ). 


Are there any risks?

There are NO challenges with this project.  The book is written and edited.  It is ready for submission, AND I have been working with a lovely lady, Virginia, at a self.publishing house.  All I need is the money to get it in print!

Oh, and I must mention… I have worked hard at growing a platform (a following of sorts - on social media and via my website - over 5,000 people).  I'm also doing more and more public speaking, so I  know I can get this book into the hands of many people!


If you are unable to contribute with money, you can still help me :)

Please share this with your friends and family!  There are handy Indiegogo share tools so you can post it to social media and send an email.

I GREATLY appreciate all the help I can get to raise this money!!  Thank you thank you thank you!!!


With MUCH GRATITUDE  to you!

~Shannon Elhart

P.S. If you want to learn more about me - please check out my website!

story: While my friends were playing school, doctor or hosting tea parties I was cutting, pasting and writing my own newspaper. After many years working for newspapers in Iowa and Missouri, having a successful career as Niche Publications Editor for the Newton Daily News in Newton, Iowa, and winning numerous awards for my writing at the state and national levels, Iâ€™m finally going after my own dream of publishing a magazine â€” everyday IOWA. While I could have easily chosen to cover any number of topics I decided to spotlight the communities that helped make me who I am today. Ask anyone who knows me and they will share with you my love of journalism and of Iowa. Iowa, especially Southeast Iowa has largely been overlooked by the media. I believe itâ€™s because they donâ€™t truly know or appreciate all that Southeast Iowa has to offer. I want to see that change. Everyone should know of the farmers who wave when they pass by, the tiny restaurant that serves the best pies, the little shop I go to every Christmas for that perfect gift, the community theatre group that takes the stage, the Underground Railroad path that lead men and women to freedom and so much more. The stories are numerous, the people are amazing and thatâ€™s what makes Iowa a great place to visit, work, play and live each and every day. If you share my passion for telling and learning great stories, please consider providing financial support to help cover printing costs, promotion of the magazine and further web site development of www.everydayiowa.com ... and perhaps, if big dreams come true, covering all of Iowa! Thank you, Jessica E. Lowe Publisher/Editor of everyday IOWA

story:
Our Story

I make my living writing and selling short stories/books. Until now, I've written everything on an old mac that more closely resembles an old typewriter than an actual computer. I'd like to raise enough funds to purchase a slightly newer computer so that I can continue working as a writer and put out my next novel unhindered.


The Impact

Without your assistance and kindness, I'll be unable to continue working. Please consider helping any way you can.


What We Need & What You Get

The Macbook Pro I'm hoping to purchase is going to cost me $600 dollars. Unfortunately, I'm moving across the country to Portland, Oregon to pursue ministry and work on my next novel. Obviously, this is an expensive endeavor and any money I'm able to save is put toward that expense. I've decided to reprint a collection of Travel Journals I kept while I was living homeless in New York CIty, Paris, Tennessee and Nassau, Bahamas. Those of you who are following my work know that I am working on a novel called Forest Life. Much of the inspiration behind Forest Life can be found in these Travel Logs. So, in exhange for your donation you'll receive a copy of Travel Logs and my most sincere thanks

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider donating, and keep me in your prayers as I continue writing in the manner I feel God has called me. Please share my fundraising goal with your friends and contact me if you have any questions.

I love you.

Shane

story:
Who Is Lauren Yates?

Hi, everyone. My name is Lauren Yates, and I'm the poet behind this operation. I've been writing poetry regularly since I was twelve years old. I continued writing throughout middle school and high school, and regularly contibuted to my high school's literary magazine.

I did not start performing my poetry until Fall 2009, when I joined The Excelano Project--the premier spoken word collective at the University of Pennsylvania. After performing non-competitively for 3 years, I started slamming this past September.

For those who don't know, a poetry slam is a competition in which poets perform original material and receive scores for their writing and performance abilities. For me, slamming isn't about winning; it's about the opportunity to share my work and hear other people's voices.

What Is WOWps?

The Women of the World Poetry Slam (WOWps) is an annual event sponsored by Poetry Slam, Inc. that allows poets who live as woman an exclusive space in which to slam. The event began in 2008 as an offset of the National Poetry Slam and the Individual World Poetry Slam. WOWps 2013 will take place in Minneapolis from March 6-9, 2013.

Where Will This Money Go?

This money will go exclusively toward my plane ticket to Minneapolis.

What's In It for You?

By helping send me to WOWps, you are also helping to diversify Philadelphia's representation in the spoken word scene. Until this year, Philadelphia only had one PSI-certified venue: The FUZE. However, just last month The Pigeon became certified, and I will be their first ever representative at a PSI event.

Helping me get to this competition will pave the way for The Pigeon to send representatives to the National Poetry Slam and the Individual World Poetry Slam later this year.

story:
Summary of Intentions

Writing is my passion and what I want to make of my future. Amber and I, in conjunction with Tire Swing Comics, are in the process of working out an agreement where creative projects could be what my time is entirely dedicated to.

Currently I have a day job and would love to leave it to pursue a career of stories and comics. But a variety of mistakes with credit cards in my past means I have a lot of debt, and a creative-only pursuit is not affordable right now. This means I have to keep my day job, which means I don't have the time to dedicate to the stories and comics.

This fundraiser is not intended to retire the entirety of my debt, but to help with the immediately-resolvable so that the rest can be better managed. I haven't used a credit card in five years, but what I am able to pay each month doesn't make much headway versus interest earned.

With your help I can retire the small debt cards and shift the money I'd been putting towards those towards the big ones. Once those are done your long-term benefit, if you are a fan of my work, is my ability to leave my day job and switch to working on stories and comics which will be made available to everyone.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the plan:*

  • Everyone, regardless of donation amount, will get something from my planned project dS: reduX. These are poems and some of my original CG illustrated one-offs redone by talented artist erosarts. You'll get at least one piece of art with the related poem/caption. 
  • Those who donate at the $100 Perk level get a 10,000 minimum word commission on the topic of their choosing.
  • Those who donate at the $200 Perk level get a 10,000 minimum word commission on the topic of their choosing and an illustration done by one of the artists I work closely with.
*my work contains adult situations and no one under 18 or anyone living with laws that ban portrayals/description of romantic/adult situations should donate. While I do write about some surreal situations, I do not write about situations involving non-consent, age-inappropriate participants, or generally any act that is illegal under U.S. law.

Stretch Goals

I'm starting small. $500 will kill what I call the "Red Star" Credit Card. But if we can go further that would be fantastic. Here are the levels I've come up with;
$500 - Red Star Card - All Perks as described.
$1500 - Concentric Circles Card - I can pretty much kill off two cards. All donors get at least two dS: reduX pieces, and all commission donors get another 1,000 words added to their minimum.
$3500 - Perk Sell-Out - The Green Card gets a significant chunk taken out of it, In addition to the other two cards. All donors get at least three dS: reduX pieces, and all commission donors get another 2,000 words added to their minimum. You'll all also get PDF copies of any eBooks I've published between now and when the fundraiser ends.
$5000 - Green Closer - I can retire three cards! All donors get at least four dS: reduX pieces, and all commission donors get another 5,000 words added to their minimum.
$???? - The Unknown - I doubt we'll reach the Green Closer level, but if that happens more Stretch Goals will be added.

The Impact

Your donations will go towards fixing a mistake that I am personally ashamed of. This is entirely my own fault, and I have made great strides to stem the personal shortcomings that lead me to this position. By helping me resolve this I will be able to rededicate my time to projects that will be made available to all my fans - and sleep better at night.

I want to be clear - successful funding of this fundraiser will still leave me with some debt to resolve before I can completely give up my day job. My fans and readers should not expect to see significant changes to my available creative time until sometime in 2015.

However, if this is successful I will carve out as much time as I can to showing my appreciation.

    Risks, Challenges, and Guidelines

    dS: reduX images are already in production, so I am not concerned about that artwork. I expect I will be able to email that out within a week after funding closes and processes.

    Managing time for the story commissions is the biggest challenge here. I have done commissions like this previously on limited-release purchases, and I am not aware of a commissioner who has been left unsatisfied. They typically take three weeks per 10,000 words to complete, which is why I have limited each Perk level to a maximum of 10 commissions. It breaks down like this;

    1st Week - Donor is contacted via email, ideas are exchanged, donor approves an outline I create based on their requested idea/topic with the goal of finishing at 10,000 words minimum - I will not bring a story to a screeching halt once 10,000 words is met but I won't drag out the tale's resolution unnecessarily beyond that.

    2nd Week - I complete a rough copy and send it to the donor for review and any notes.

    3rd Week - I finish editing the story based on notes and create a final PDF copy for the donor.

    I will work on commissions in the order in which they were purchased. Illustrations will take more time and will have input from the donor, but the majority of the creative control will be left with the artist. My artists are usually able to deliver an illustration within a month.

    I will only write about original characters created by the donor or by me. I retain ownership rights to all original work created by me. The story will remain exclusive to the donor's personal reading for at least one year, after which I reserve the right to edit and republish.

    Regarding content, I will right all-ages story or adult-themed stories. I do not write about situations involving non-consent, age-inappropriate participants, or generally any act that is illegal under U.S. law. If you've read my personal blog you have an idea of what I do, but I'm willing to write pretty much any genre or story - but if you insist on a topic or situation that I do not find appropriate I will refund the donation.

    If there is a question or quandary that I have not satisfied, please let me know!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      • You can get the word out to people who are interested in work like mine but may not frequent my website.
      • Just keeping reading and leaving your feedback - knowing I bring people happiness with my work makes the struggle worth it!
story_txt:
Summary of Intentions Writing is my passion and what I want to make of my future. Amber and I, in conjunction with Tire Swing Comics, are in the process of working out an agreement where creative projects could be what my time is entirely dedicated to.
Currently I have a day job and would love to leave it to pursue a career of stories and comics. But a variety of mistakes with credit cards in my past means I have a lot of debt, and a creative-only pursuit is not affordable right now. This means I have to keep my day job, which means I don't have the time to dedicate to the stories and comics.
This fundraiser is not intended to retire the entirety of my debt, but to help with the immediately-resolvable so that the rest can be better managed. I haven't used a credit card in five years, but what I am able to pay each month doesn't make much headway versus interest earned.
With your help I can retire the small debt cards and shift the money I'd been putting towards those towards the big ones. Once those are done your long-term benefit, if you are a fan of my work, is my ability to leave my day job and switch to working on stories and comics which will be made available to everyone.
What We Need & What You Get
 Here's the plan:* 
Everyone, regardless of donation amount, will get something from my planned project dS: reduX. These are poems and some of my original CG illustrated one-offs redone by talented artist erosarts. You'll get at least one piece of art with the related poem/caption. 
Those who donate at the $100 Perk level get a 10,000 minimum word commission on the topic of their choosing.
Those who donate at the $200 Perk level get a 10,000 minimum word commission on the topic of their choosing and an illustration done by one of the artists I work closely with. 

*my work contains adult situations and no one under 18 or anyone living with laws that ban portrayals/description of romantic/adult situations should donate. While I do write about some surreal situations, I do not write about situations involving non-consent, age-inappropriate participants, or generally any act that is illegal under U.S. law.

  Stretch Goals
I'm starting small. $500 will kill what I call the "Red Star" Credit Card. But if we can go further that would be fantastic. Here are the levels I've come up with;

$500 - Red Star Card - All Perks as described.

$1500 - Concentric Circles Card - I can pretty much kill off two cards. All donors get at least two dS: reduX pieces, and all commission donors get another 1,000 words added to their minimum.

$3500 - Perk Sell-Out - The Green Card gets a significant chunk taken out of it, In addition to the other two cards. All donors get at least three dS: reduX pieces, and all commission donors get another 2,000 words added to their minimum. You'll all also get PDF copies of any eBooks I've published between now and when the fundraiser ends.

$5000 - Green Closer - I can retire three cards! All donors get at least four dS: reduX pieces, and all commission donors get another 5,000 words added to their minimum.

$???? - The Unknown - I doubt we'll reach the Green Closer level, but if that happens more Stretch Goals will be added.


The Impact
 Your donations will go towards fixing a mistake that I am personally ashamed of. This is entirely my own fault, and I have made great strides to stem the personal shortcomings that lead me to this position. By helping me resolve this I will be able to rededicate my time to projects that will be made available to all my fans - and sleep better at night.
I want to be clear - successful funding of this fundraiser will still leave me with some debt to resolve before I can completely give up my day job. My fans and readers should not expect to see significant changes to my available creative time until sometime in 2015.
However, if this is successful I will carve out as much time as I can to showing my appreciation.

  Risks, Challenges, and Guidelines dS: reduX images are already in production, so I am not concerned about that artwork. I expect I will be able to email that out within a week after funding closes and processes.
Managing time for the story commissions is the biggest challenge here. I have done commissions like this previously on limited-release purchases, and I am not aware of a commissioner who has been left unsatisfied. They typically take three weeks per 10,000 words to complete, which is why I have limited each Perk level to a maximum of 10 commissions. It breaks down like this;
1st Week - Donor is contacted via email, ideas are exchanged, donor approves an outline I create based on their requested idea/topic with the goal of finishing at 10,000 words minimum - I will not bring a story to a screeching halt once 10,000 words is met but I won't drag out the tale's resolution unnecessarily beyond that.
2nd Week - I complete a rough copy and send it to the donor for review and any notes.
3rd Week - I finish editing the story based on notes and create a final PDF copy for the donor.

Just keeping reading and leaving your feedback - knowing I bring people happiness with my work makes the struggle worth it!

story:
Green Writers Press

Giving Voice to Writers and Artists Who Will Make the World a Better Place

Thanks for visiting our fundraising page! We are a new Vermont-based, global publisher that seeks to change the way books are printed by using only post-consumer waste paper and not virgin timber. All the books published by Green Writers Press will be printed in Vermont by a family-owned business. The term 'localvore' applies to the publisher's mission, which is also to publish books, eBooks, and audio books that will spread a message of hope and renewal. We strive to build awareness to stop global warming.

It is our mission, at Green Writers Press, to spread a message of environmental activism through the words and images we will publish. We also plan to publish books that segue with our mission that also include other subjects that speak to Pquality of life and the beauty of nature. Printing on demand (POD), and using only “tree-free” papers printed at our Vermont printer, Springfield Printing Corporation, we will adhere to GWP’s commitment to preserving and protecting the natural resources of the earth. To that end, a percentage of our proceeds will be donated to the environmental activist group, 350.org. We will also give a percentage of our profits directly to Vermont-based environmental organizations and other groups.

Our vision is that, collectively, our printed and eBooks will become a chorus of voices of writers and readers, artists and photographers, who care about the fate of the earth and want to do something about it. Though we believe our books will be interesting to Vermont residents, Green Writers Press has national distribution and we hope to have a broad reach and impact. Our voices need to be heard, which is why we refer to our press as a global press. We are—we all are connected on this planet we love. 

The money raised will go a long way…

Our books will be printed with soy-based inks on paper made from pulp that comes from post-consumer waste paper in a family-owned, FSC-certified printer, located in Vermont utilizing responsible environmental, social, and economic practices; made with a chlorine-free process. Environmentally-responsible and sustainable practices are embraced within this, our mission statement. We are exploring printing on other materials as well, such as organic hemp from Canada, kenaf, and arundo donax (similar to bamboo). Our goal is to never use virgin timber fiber for our paper used to print our books. To summarize:

  • The amount is what we have budgeted for our first season of printing the books.
  • Our books are printed on recycled paper IN VERMONT! 
  • Our funds will go to help offset our first printing bills, and be applied there first.

The Impact

Your support will help us with our start-up expenses: Advertising, purchasing book identifier numbers, and printing costs—which are the main expenses. 

  • We are just beginning the process of publishing our own authors! It is an exciting time, and we welcome your support and help to spread the word.
  • Check out this sweet video of one of our new fans, Stella, at the Burlington Book Festival where our first published book was a smash hit : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l35YFRcBAKs
  • In today’s world of social media and online transactions, here are GWP, we remember that your head and your heart need nourishment from the natural world. With that as our credo, we embark on a journey to bring the beauty of the published book as a tactile object, into the homes and hands of our readers, and we also embrace the technology of tablet and eBook publishing.
  • We will encourage our buyers to shop LOCAL first, and use this link to find their local bookstore. 
  • Collectively, our voices can be heard—the earth is silent and awaits our action.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please welcome our first titles, and we have a few more coming along to join us! If you’d like to pre-order a copy of the books listed here, as print-on-demand, or eBook, just contact your local, independent bookstore with the information found here at our national book distributor—KNOW YOUR SUPPORT WILL MAKE A HUGE DIFFERENCE! 

Once the books are available—beginning in October, 2013—they are yours to receive and ours to share. We are very excited, and welcome your thoughts and ideas and suggestions. 

Make an investment today, and share this message with all of your friends who love great literature and care about the fate of the earth. 

Thanks! —Dede, Robin, Alexandra, and the many authors and artists: Brian, Holiday, Greg, John E., Howard, Leland, Patti, Jade, Alok, Hollie, Claire, Steve, Willow, Zachary, John W., printer—Mark, Mary Anne, Jim, etc.—and the rest of our fabulous team.

“…Critically important in the struggle
to keep good and important literature
and ideas alive and well.” 

—Howard Frank Mosher, author of A Stranger in the Kingdom

story:
Momentum Publishing House began as a way to bring publishing back to the community; to involve young people in something be proud of.

Momentum Publishing is a community lead project, run entirely by volunteers. We started with a one off magazine and have progressed to a regularly updated website with reviews and news articles relating to 16-25's.

Now we'd like to publish our first book; we'll provide the patform for young talent in publishing that we believe isn’t otherwise there – a sort of half way house between self publishing and a large publishing house.

What We Need

The book will be an anthology of short stories, we'll do a short 100 book print run. Copies of which we'll sell online, try our luck with local bookshops and also supply the book as an ebook to be available on kindle, app book store and other leading ebook sellers. The profits will be split 50/50 with the writers, half goes to them, half goes towards printing the next book & marketing.

In order to do this we need start up funds for:

  • ISBN's & registering as an official publishing house. We'll be bulk buying a pack of 10, so we don't have to fundraise for the next 9 books
  • The short print run. Here at Momentum Publishing, we believe in the beauty of books, so we think it's worth spending the money on some gorgeous prints.
  • Our cover designer- we're currently running a competition for the cover design, with a cash prize of £50. If we get this funding we'll be able to pay the winning designer more, which would be fantastic. 

 

The Impact

Publishing is currently an incredibly difficult industry to break into, especially for new writers fresh out of school/college/university. These are also people unlikely to have novels ready and written, so Momentum wants to work with young writers to help develop both their skills and confidence - also a great thing for them to have on their CV. Our days would absolutely be made if one of the writers that started off with us got their very own publishing contract with a large company one day, because we helped them at the start.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us with a donation right now, thats ok. But we would love it if you could help spread the word to your social network  - one of your friends might be able to! 

 

We are currently running the cover art as a competition, for more info see our website: http://momentumpublishing.co.uk/?p=308

story:
This campaign has ended. Thank you to everyone for your donations!

If you would like to purchase a book, please go to our website! www.thesleepyanimals.com/

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter!

 

The Story

Have you ever taken a child to the zoo and had to explain why the animals were not as active as they expected? That's what happened to Renee's father when he took his daughter to New Orleans' Audubon Zoo.

"The lions were lazy.
The snakes just snored.
The dolphins were drowsy.
The boars were... a bore."

To satisfy her curiosity about what makes the animals so sleepy, Renee's father makes up an elaborate story about all the music and festivities that keep the animals up all night. He tells her all about how...

"The hippos hip hop.
The flamingos flamenco.
The rhinos rock out.
The tarantulas tango."

In the end, Renee calls her dad's bluff... or could he be right?

The Project

Four friends game together to create a children's book that captures what they love about their city.

The story and the illustrations show the laid-back, fun-loving spirit of New Orleans, and the project exemplifies the creative, collaborative energy that is at the heart of the rebirth of New Orleans.

Reasons to Donate

  • The book has been awarded "Best New Orleans Children's Book" by NOLA.com.
  • A portion of proceeds will be donated to the Audubon Zoo to help build a new elephant sanctuary.
  • Supporting creative and entrepreneurial projects in New Orleans makes our city a better place to live.
  • Through rhyme and alliteration, the book builds phonemic awareness in children. Phonemic awareness, a pre-reading skill, is understanding that words are made up of discrete sounds.
  • Through repetition of concepts using several different words, the book builds vocabulary.

 

  ***Please help us spread the word. Post this video to your facebook, and tell your friends about the book.***

story:
Our Story

Hola Amigos..my name is Luis,  I'm Honduran and for many years the idea of walking the Camino de Santiago its been on my head, I'll be 32 soon, so I planned with a couple of crazy friends, Max and Rolando (Not in shape at all) and with few sins to expiate,  to walk 800 kilometers trail on northern Spain, it will be about 25km a day, we are full inmersed and convinced in this Don Quijote style journey, with reflexions, maybe find ourselves,  maybe lose ourselves ( hopefully), documenting everything through the lens of our cameras and writing on our journals the details of our experience during the way.


St. James Way or Camino de Santiago de Compostela its being a pilgrimage place for more than thousand year and Unesco world heritage since 1987.


''A thousand mile trip begins with a simple step''.


The Impact

Print in images and words the Way to Santiago is our main goal but also: The sharing, search for enlightment,  spiritual purification, healing the tormented souls, physical challenge, find our own way, it will be an important component our our trip, is like the very life, some people run and go too fast without enjoying the simple things and moments, others walk slowly till they get there little by little and some even never leave, with your help we'll become pilgrims belivers or not we are in our way to Compostela, let us be part of something bigger and with lot of meaning, the way change you, dont know how, can't wait to walk it.


What We Need & What You Get

Certainly we need to get in shape, get prepare for the exhausting challenge and lose weight, also the cost is high, I wont take vacations for 2 years in order to get  plenty of time to do the walk, it needs as you might imagine lot of planning, walk about 25 km a day, a place to sleep, document the highlights of the trail, writing, airfare, gear, extipend, meals, it will take about 33 days to do the whole trip on northern Spain, we calculate conservative US$3000.00 to cover the main things even knowing we still got to put a considerable amount from from our pocket.



Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with your friends, family and contacts, I'll appreciate.

story:
Short Summary

For nearly two decades now I've been making my living solely through the creative word. I am a poet, small press publisher, oral memoirist and encourager who resides with his family in the hills of upstate NY. From our 50 acre homestead I go out into the world as a poet, giving readings and conducting workshops. A year ago we had a tragic house fire in which all of our personal possessions and publishing equipment, supplies and archives were lost. It has been a long haul rebuilding, but through the amazing support of so many people, near at hand and far away, we have a new house and have been moving forward, resuming the publishing work and my own work on the road as a poet. An Indiegogo Campaign was instrumental in making that happen.

I have had in mind a 48 State poetry tour for a number of years. Now that we have stabilized our life after the fire, I felt it was time to make the dream real. I turned 62 in November. How much time ahead is there? We never know. If I don't do this tour now, will I have a chance in the future? I have taken many cross-country poetic journeys but never one of this length in miles or time. I'll be away from home on this solo journey for 14 weeks.

The Poems Across America Tour will feature 48 readings in 48 states. I have nearly half of them confirmed and will be working on finishing the booking over the next few weeks. Currently I have readings booked in small towns and large cities, at libraries, book stores, an adult learning center, colleges and even someone's house. This will be an eclectic mix of venues and geographic settings. Much like other poetic journeys I have taken, only this one is much more comprehensive.

Over the years that I've gone on the road as a poet, encouraging others in their own creativity, I've learned to not be amazed at the wonderful poets who can be found anywhere and everywhere. I encourage others to express themselves at whatever level of competency they are at. We were all beginners once. Partly because of my encouragement there are scores of writers groups meeting regularly, sharing in the joy of the written word.

The Poems Across America Tour is the most extensive tour I've undertaken, twice as long as any other tour. When on the road I live simply, camping, bartering books for motels and couches, preparing my own food as much as possible. There are times when motels are the best alternative. And one cannot barter for gasoline. Living on the edge (a kid who grew up in the 60s and has held onto a lot of those values, and the poetry/poverty dynamic) there are always financial concerns in any undertaking. To have the travel expenses taken care of before departure would be a huge blessing.

What We Need & What You Get

I've estimated that the mileage for the tour will be somewhere between 15,000 and 20,000 miles. At about fifteen cents a mile for gas (forget the 56.5/mi federal mileage allowance, I drive old cars - this journey with a 1983 Honda Accord) I estimate a gas cost at about $2,700. Obviously that's not all the travel expenses involved, but I plan on keeping the other expenses to a minimum by bartering, camping and even sleeping in the car if need be. I have learned to live frugally. It's a virtue.

As far as perks, you'll receive an original haiku on a postcard from the state of your choosing. There are various levels of donations, relating to how many states you'll receive postcards from. I will write an original haiku from each state that will be the haiku on the postcard. This haiku will not be used anywhere else other than on the postcard. So, in a sense, one of a kind, even though anyone else wanting a postcard from that state will receive the same haiku. The postcards will be ones I purchase in the state and the haiku will be hand written, signed and dated.

If I don't reach the goal the journey will still happen, with a little bit more apprehension involved. That's not always a bad thing.

The Impact

Often, over the years I have been just pursuing the poetic path, I've had people refer to me as Michael Poetseed. They see me as spreading poetry seeds around the country and sometime later the seeds germinate and there's more poetry growing, blooming throughout the land. I have had many experiences that validate that image and are part of my oral memoirs. I feel blessed to be able to walk this path, yet, it always comes with a compromise. Poetry/poverty again. My life has been one of poverty in terms of $$$, but rich in other more important ways. I feel this tour will help me reach out to others in a much wider way than ever before. As Lew Welch wrote in "This Book Is For Magda" - "and now and then, a son, a daughter hears it./ Now and then, a son, a daughter,/ gets away."

If you can help in any way to fund the travel expenses of this tour it would be very much appreciated. If you are not in a position to donate, please consider helping by getting the word out to others that you know. Indiegogo works by spreading the word out as much as possible. We learned that from the amazingly successful Indiegogo campaign to help us get a new house after the fire. This is obviously not on the same level as that, but this journey means a lot to me and any support that comes my way toward the travel expenses would be greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
Short Summary
For nearly two decades now I've been making my living solely through the creative word. I am a poet, small press publisher, oral memoirist and encourager who resides with his family in the hills of upstate NY. From our 50 acre homestead I go out into the world as a poet, giving readings and conducting workshops. A year ago we had a tragic house fire in which all of our personal possessions and publishing equipment, supplies and archives were lost. It has been a long haul rebuilding, but through the amazing support of so many people, near at hand and far away, we have a new house and have been moving forward, resuming the publishing work and my own work on the road as a poet. An Indiegogo Campaign was instrumental in making that happen.
I have had in mind a 48 State poetry tour for a number of years. Now that we have stabilized our life after the fire, I felt it was time to make the dream real. I turned 62 in November. How much time ahead is there? We never know. If I don't do this tour now, will I have a chance in the future? I have taken many cross-country poetic journeys but never one of this length in miles or time. I'll be away from home on this solo journey for 14 weeks.
The Poems Across America Tour will feature 48 readings in 48 states. I have nearly half of them confirmed and will be working on finishing the booking over the next few weeks. Currently I have readings booked in small towns and large cities, at libraries, book stores, an adult learning center, colleges and even someone's house. This will be an eclectic mix of venues and geographic settings. Much like other poetic journeys I have taken, only this one is much more comprehensive.
Over the years that I've gone on the road as a poet, encouraging others in their own creativity, I've learned to not be amazed at the wonderful poets who can be found anywhere and everywhere. I encourage others to express themselves at whatever level of competency they are at. We were all beginners once. Partly because of my encouragement there are scores of writers groups meeting regularly, sharing in the joy of the written word.
The Poems Across America Tour is the most extensive tour I've undertaken, twice as long as any other tour. When on the road I live simply, camping, bartering books for motels and couches, preparing my own food as much as possible. There are times when motels are the best alternative. And one cannot barter for gasoline. Living on the edge (a kid who grew up in the 60s and has held onto a lot of those values, and the poetry/poverty dynamic) there are always financial concerns in any undertaking. To have the travel expenses taken care of before departure would be a huge blessing.
What We Need & What You Get
I've estimated that the mileage for the tour will be somewhere between 15,000 and 20,000 miles. At about fifteen cents a mile for gas (forget the 56.5/mi federal mileage allowance, I drive old cars - this journey with a 1983 Honda Accord) I estimate a gas cost at about $2,700. Obviously that's not all the travel expenses involved, but I plan on keeping the other expenses to a minimum by bartering, camping and even sleeping in the car if need be. I have learned to live frugally. It's a virtue.

story:
Help us Fight Against Houseless Authors!!

Yes, you read that right.  Not homeless, houseless.  Sadly there are many fabulous authors with quality, finished works and careers on the rise who are set back when their publishing house closes.  We have found many authors in this situation, and have built a publishing house dedicated to not only making sure that these works remain available and promoted as they should be, but also to finding and publishing new works. Currently, we have ten titles ready for release, and many other opportunities available.   Represented authors  Marian Allen, K.A. DaVur, T Lee Harris, Etta Jean.

The purpose of the funding is twofold.  First, it is imperative that the authors - and their fans- are still able to access their books during this transitional period.  Therefore, a portion of the funding will be used to purchase an adequate number of books as they are currently printed, to be sure that there is no gap in availability.  Secondly, funds will be used in the startup costs of the new house.  Such costs include buying a domain, purchasing ISBNs, creating and printing catalogs for wholesale purchases, paying for new cover art, purchasing marketing materials, and obtaining booth space at high-visibility events.  

To ensure our success, we have developed a plan for measured growth.  We want to make sure that we have enough titles to make our press a viable, strong force, but are careful to make sure that we don't overextend ourselves financially or sacrifice quality for quantity.  We have been lucky enough to have a professional project manager and chief financial officer donate their time and services to help us grow at an exciting but sustainable rate.  We also have developed an amazing three-pronged marketing plan.  As our house currently publishes speculative fiction works, it is important that we take advantage of the fans and niche market that can be found at science fiction and fantasy conventions.  To that end, we have plans to attend PopCon, Emerald City Comi-Con, North Carolina Comi-Con, Conglomeration, Magna-Cum-Murder, and more.  The second prong involves taking advantage of local interest.  Our experience has shown that local festivals often have significantly lower booth fees and generate a great deal of interest and sales. Therefore, we will work with our authors to find and obtain space at small local festivals.  Finally, for greater success it will be important to move beyond the world of conventions and into the mainstream.  We have already secured space at the Savannah Children's Book Fair and the American Library Association's yearly conference.  We will continue to look for book and literature fairs opportunities, and are researching the Espresso Printing Machines as a way to build excitement and reduce stock costs.  

We want you to be as excited about this opportunity as we are!  Therefore, we have put together a series of perks to show you just how amazing these books are!  Also, donate in the first FIFTEEN days of the event and you get double the perks!

If you don't feel that you can contribute to this campaign at this time, please promote and share our information with your friends!

story:
Short Summary

The Keystone XL is one of many "hot button" issues that we face as a nation. With elements involving political, economic, social, health and environmental consequences, the pipeline has become a polarized topic for many.

Over the weekend of March 1-2, 2014, concerned citizens will gather in Washington D.C. for an act of civil disobedience at the White House. I will be there to report.

Who am I and why do I care?

In May 2013 I earned my degree in journalism from Florida Gulf Coast University (Dunk City to all of you college hoops fans). FGCU has a proud history of promoting sustainability and community involvement. As a student, I wrote many articles for Eagle News--many of which involved issues of sustainability. That experience led to internships in radio and local print news along with a Florida Associated Press Broadcasters award and a Region 3 Society of Professional Journalists Mark of Excellence award.

Since graduating from FGCU, I have been taking graduate courses at Antioch University New England in Keene, NH. As a member of the Environmental Studies department, I've completed courses such as Organizing for Social Change, Leadership for Change, and I am currently taking Political Economy and Sustainability.

This project combines my current and past studies with my experience as a writer and my passion for leaving the world a better place.

What I Need & What You Get

Anticipated Expenses (approximate):

  • Lodging for two nights in D.C. (including parking) = $260.00
  • Fuel costs = $100-$120
  • Highway Tolls = $40-$45 (The George Washington bridge & NJ Turnpike sure are expensive!)
  • Sustenance = $50-$70 for 2 days plus 14 hours of round trip driving (avg $5-$7 a meal for 10 meals)
  • Indiegogo fees = Only 4% if I reach my goal! (9% if I fall short...)

What You Get in Return:

  • My eternal gratitude.
  • Knowledge that you helped fund grassroots freelance reporting.
  • Access to information from the scene at the White House as it unfolds on Saturday, March 2, 2014.
  • A unique look at why youth are willing to risk arrest to stop the Keystone XL.
  • A fresh perspective on an important political, economic and environmental matter.
  • A full-scale multimedia reporting package

$750+ Stretch Goal: I will expand on my reporting by purchasing and creating a centralized website to host photos, video, audio, print and social media reporting of this event.

Why You Should Care

You live on this planet. You breathe the air and drink the water. You rely on undamaged soil to grow the food that you eat. Whether you want to be or not, you are involved in a vast economy that too often prioritizes corporate interests over human ones. Just as we cannot and should not blindly shut down the economy we should not allow short-sighted solutions that offer temporary profit to a select few damage the long-term viability of our world and its inhabitants.

Not everyone has the ability to raise their voice and make it heard. Those going to Washington D.C. represent countless silent voices. Many of the participants are willing to be arrested--some may see it as "in protest of" the pipeline, others might see it as "for the protection of" the environment and well-being of life.

My goal is to let them tell their stories...and you can help me make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm not asking for much, just some help covering the actual expenses involved in putting this multimedia report together. If you are able and willing to contribute, thank you so very much! If not, I would still greatly appreciate it if you are able to share the link to my campaign.

Much <3

FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT XL DISSENT: xldissent.org

story:
Short Summary

This is a straightforward proposition: Your money will fund the creation of one single illustration to be incorporated in an existing children’s ebook. The generic version of this charming pet-adoption tale at the center of this micro-funding campaign is already published within Amazon Kindle ecosystem. The personalizable version is available on our website. Based on the magnitude of your support, you are entitled to some nice perks, listed on the right.

The writer and the illustrator, who up to now have worked with no retribution, will create new situation-illustrations, based on suggestions from the readers. Both creators have committed themselves to this paradigm-shifting form of storytelling and user-generated content. My pitch to you is on their behalf. They will bring to life the wishes of many parents and grandparents who would like to add specific illustrations to this story. 

 

Long summary:-) 

Hi, my name is Andrei Kelner, and I am Bookata’s publisher. We’ve developed an innovative way of personalized storytelling through collaborative iBooks.  Our tales are centered on challenges our kids encounter and the ways that we as adults can deal with those challenges, using their own stories and the way that they tell them with their feelings and words. Bookata has a story to tell, and that story is yours! For Bookata, the reader IS the story.

The narrators have imagined dramatic, yet funny potential situations created by the adoption of a pet. Your book can be personalized by changing the main character, the family members, the children, the parents, their names, race, and gender. Your Bookata story will feel unique because it is unique.

Based on feedback and suggestions from readers, we decided to add a new illustration-situation, reproducing one of the most popular pet mischiefs: mayhem provoked by a pet when it penetrates forbidden territory, the bathroom... more precisely, the mess with the toilet paper roll.

A while ago, I read and fell in love with a short fable, A Story for Demented Children, by John H. Carroll. From Denver, where he lives surrounded by family and pets, he accepted the request to write for Bookata this lovely tale of personalized adoption. We were also incredibly lucky to find a most remarkable illustrator for this project. Living in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Claudia Mendoza is not only a cat lover, but a dancer and a writer.

They accepted to work initially for free, intrigued by the new publishing paradigm proposed and excited to create "live" when the readers start asking for personal changes to the story.

In its generic version, their final product was ranked number one on the Amazon Kindle store in the Children's Fiction/Animals category. That’s right, Bookata's tale topped out Jungle Book and other major classic-free titles!

Here is the book on Amazon: (http://www.amazon.com/A-New-Pet-Family-ebook/dp... 1363092193&sr=1-1&keywords=bookata).

 

And here are links to the URLs of our very talented narrators:

https://www.facebook.com/John.H.Carroll.Author

http://www.claudiamendoza.blogspot.ca/

And here, of course, is where you can get to personalize the tale and make it your story:

http://www.bookata.com

 

 

What We Need and What You Get

Our campaign is simple and extremely focused: we need a total of $500.

Our project is about ONE single situation to be added to a single story, ONE short text and ONE illustration with three embodiments representing three kinds of pets.

Once the text and illustration are conceived and incorporated, we will make them available to ALL readers/users. That’s correct; everybody will have the opportunity to enjoy this new situation-illustration. And if our crowdfunding experiment proves to be a success, we hope to have many more to come.

You may be asking, “Why should I advance the funds when everybody else will get it for free afterwards?”

  • Because is the right thing to do, AND you get recognition for it (see perks).
  • Because if you need something to be done, just do it instead of waiting for somebody else to do it.
  • Because you will allow children to have their own particular story told their way, in their words, complemented by meaningful illustrations.

 

On our side, we have a couple of commitments, also:

  • We are committed to paying our artists a full, fair price for their efforts. Don’t let a flexible campaign status inhibit this chance to show your utmost appreciation and respect for their talent.
  • We are committed to this daring experiment of "live" collaboration between readers and creators.
  • We are committed to putting all the money raised above $500 towards the payment for a new illustration, also decided by readers.

Somehow, I feel there is too much experimentation for such a small proposal. Will the people find all this too much? We will see in a very short period of time. Stay tuned and thank you for your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not willing to pay but with great ideas for improving our site, our concept, our execution? Having a mentor or a door-opener is as good as cash. Let's have a talk.

There are other ways you can show your support, like sending this proposition to all your favorite animal lovers’ social media partners and friends or by spreading the world about this project! Tell your friends about what's happening. Help us, them and you create a space where we can all care and enjoy our pets and extended families built around them.

Don’t forget to use IndieGoGo's sharing tools to keep track of our campaign.

story:
Isabelle's Story

When Isabelle was born she was diagnosed with Glioblastoma multiforme (malignant brain cancer) and given less than a year to live. She fought extremely hard, even through 3 other brain tumors and by her third birthday she was cancer free. However, the numerous surgeries she underwent left her with a left sided disability, a mild left leg limp, limited use of her left hand in addition to grand-mal, petit-mal, partial complex, and tonic seizures that throw her to the ground without warning almost daily.

Isabelle is now 19 and has watched her siblings and friends grow up and move on to college and careers. There are so many things that she would like to do with her life, but because of her seizures, she can no longer leave the house alone. Her anxiety about having a seizure while out alone or with friends encourages her to seize. She is desperately seeking a more independent life, but the seizures are preventing that from happening. Bob Taylor, a premier trainer of service dogs for the disabled and founder of Dog Wish will be able to train a dog to detect seizure activity in her brain up to 8 hours in advance of the event and to interrupt the activity so that she doesn't end up seizing. This would afford Isabelle the peace of mind to not have to worry continuously about the possibility of a seizure while out on her own. She has been isolated for so many years, she is a beautiful, smart, funny and big-hearted young woman that deserves the chance at a more normal life. 

What She Needs

Isabelle is in desperate need of $20,000 to pay for the cost of her male purebred working line German Shepherd and for the months of extensive training as well as travel and accommodation costs during that time. Any contribution of any size to help Isabelle's dream become a reality would be so greatly appreciated.

Every dollar over our $20k goal will go to the Isabelle's Dog Wish Foundation, a Non-Profit that we have founded in order to give others like Isabelle the same chance to lead a more normal, independent life!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Isabelle would also take the gracious donation of a male purebred working line German Shepherd. It would take care of a good chunk of the cost! 

If you would like to discuss this possibility with her and her family, please reach out to them by email at isabellesdogwish@gmail.com

Please share this campaign with your friends and family on Facebook and Twitter. If 20,000 people saw this campaign and donated just a dollar, her dream would become a reality. Your support for her and others like her is greatly appreciated!

Her anxiety about having a seizure while out alone or with friends encourages her to seize. She is desperately seeking a more independent life, but the seizures are preventing that from happening. Bob Taylor, a premier trainer of service dogs for the disabled and founder of Dog Wish will be able to train a dog to detect seizure activity in her brain up to 8 hours in advance of the event and to interrupt the activity so that she doesn't end up seizing. This would afford Isabelle the peace of mind to not have to worry continuously about the possibility of a seizure while out on her own. She has been isolated for so many years, she is a beautiful, smart, funny and big-hearted young woman that deserves the chance at a more normal life. 


What She Needs
Isabelle is in desperate need of $20,000 to pay for the cost of her male purebred working line German Shepherd and for the months of extensive training as well as travel and accommodation costs during that time. Any contribution of any size to help Isabelle's dream become a reality would be so greatly appreciated.
Every dollar over our $20k goal will go to the Isabelle's Dog Wish Foundation, a Non-Profit that we have founded in order to give others like Isabelle the same chance to lead a more normal, independent life!


 
Other Ways You Can Help


Isabelle would also take the gracious donation of a male purebred working line German Shepherd. It would take care of a good chunk of the cost! 
If you would like to discuss this possibility with her and her family, please reach out to them by email at isabellesdogwish@gmail.com
Please share this campaign with your friends and family on Facebook and Twitter. If 20,000 people saw this campaign and donated just a dollar, her dream would become a reality. Your support for her and others like her is greatly appreciated!

story:
My story:

My name is Rosalind Dawson. I am 56 years old. I was born and raised in the inner city of Milwaukee, WI -- a child prodigy, or so the folks at our local music conservatory said. I started playing the piano at 2-years-old. I could hear any song live or on the radio and sit down at our old piano and play it. It’s called perfect pitch I found out later and few people worldwide have it. That should have made me feel special as a kid, but it didn’t.

You see, things were happening to me that trumped all the good God had blessed me with; things that no child should have done to them. By the time I was a teenager I was having disassociative episodes amd ideations of suicide. I called helplines constantly searching for anyone who could help me understand. God bless my grammar school teachers who took an interest in the kid hiding in the back of the classroom. Without them, I wouldn’t be here today.

My childhood tragedies turned into adult ones. Untreated, I was left to fend for myself. My psyche was splintered, my family was splintered. I went through life feeling hunted. Everyone was out to get me and the world was a horrifically scary place.

Being abandoned when I was 2 months pregnant by my daughter’s father, my fiancé at the time, brought back all the memories of my earlier abuses. Penniless, I didn't know where to turn. My mother, ashamed of me, forbade me to live at home. So I had to move into a home for unwed mothers and work multiple jobs to pay the rent.

Having my daughter, Sarah is the hardest thing I’ve ever done. How was I going to be anyone’s parent when I, myself, was so messed up inside? There were many times during her childhood when I knew I was losing my sanity. I now understand that a power greater than myself was keeping tabs on me. I was hanging on by fingertips. But something inside me, something mad as hell, wouldn't give up. I was determined to be the best parent I could be.

In 2010, after my many years of working odd jobs to help Sarah through undergrad and grad school, I watched her receive her PhD in Archaeology and M.A. in Classics from Brown University. I was proud - for both of us. Now it’s my turn.

My imagination holds me in the music I continue to write and the stories I tell. Creating, I have discovered, is my life’s work. All of my experiences have culminated in this awareness. It's time to rise.

**Please check out samples of my literary/musical compositions by clicking on the "Gallery" tab located under my campaign's title. I hope you enjoy!

What I need:

  1. A piano with a midi interface
  2. A computer that can handle the demands of music notation, editing and mixing software
  3. Music notation, editing and mixing software
  4. Transportation and expenses to research sites
  5. Time and an open space in which to work.

What I will give in return:

My heartfelt gratitude. A dedication in my first published novel.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I apologize for our english viewers. This ebook is only in French. But don't worry! An english version is in an early stage. Signup at http://gurl.im/a9803dC for updates!

Her you will found an automatic traduction for this text : http://translate.google.fr/

King Regards,

The Author

Le plus vieux language de l'homme

Et sans doute l'une des langues les moins comprises à l'aube du XXIème siècle. L'homme moderne et - encore plus "l'homo electronicus" - a perdu le sens de ce language pourtant universel.

Dans la lignée de nos autres manuels, ici pas de "théorie" fumeuse sur les mouvements oculaires. Et encore moins d'empirisme attribuant à chaque geste une signification précise et unique!

En 10 ans, la science du non-verbal a fait des progrès considérables suite à des investissements financiers importants liés aux besoins d'améliorer la sécurité. Il est temps de proposer une première grammaire de ses grands principes.

SCAN101 en quelques lignes ?

SCAN est d'abord :

  • Une méthode qui repose sur une acquisition rapide des indicateurs nécessaires à l'établissement d'un profil.
  • D'une intégration dans l'environnement de l'individu. On ne peut lire tout le monde à n'importe quel moment ! Sans objectif précis, il est parfaitement inutile de SCANner quelqu'un.
  • Une grammaire des grands principes du non-verbal. Documentée scientifiquement, cette approche permet d'éviter le catalogue gestuel imbitable.
  • Une application discrète ne bloquant pas vos activités quotidiennes. Après tout, vous n'êtes pas un spécialiste du comportement...
  • Une grille qui s'adapte à vos propres compétences pour enrichir vos intuitions et non les remplacer. 

ET le secret :  chacun des principes a été analysé/validé/confirmé au travers d'études dédiées ET sous EEG portatifs. Une première mondiale, l'exploitation des EEG portatifs a permis de tester les principes lors d'interactions réelles dans le monde réel. 

Pourquoi du crowdfounding ?

Parce que savoir lire me non-verbal de manière efficace est un véritable plus dans votre vie de tous les jours. Il est donc logique que chacun d'entre nous puissent participer en fonction de ses envies à ce programme.

Ensuite le crowdfounding permet une interaction active entre le lecteur et l'auteur ce qui permet de faire évoluer plus rapidement la pensée de l'un et de l'autre.

Votre impact

  • Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières et les études sont coûteuses. Faire avancer ces sujets passionnants font partie des objectifs de l'auteur, et je l'espère des vôtres.
  • Ceux qui ont eu l'occasion de me côtoyer lors de formations savent que ce sujet est un de mes aiguillons personnels. Ils savent aussi je l'espère que j'aime partager le fond d'un sujet car la connaissance s'enrichie de cet échange.
  • Le manuel SCAN101 est un premier pas vers l'exploitation des avancées des recherches dans le non-verbal. 

Pourquoi pré-vendre cet ouvrage ?

Plusieurs raisons m'ont poussé vers cette solution :

  • Un manuel sur ce sujet ne peut être définitif. Le faire évoluer au fil du temps est donc une nécessité. Ce qui exclu tout intermédiaire classique de l'édition.
  • Le monde est dynamique, j'espère que nos manuels le seront aussi! La prévente permet de vous proposer beaucoup plus d'options qu'un manuel habituel. Regardez plus bas pour vous en convaincre.
  • Je désirais introduire deux interactions spécifiques dans cet ouvrage. La première : la participation active de "beta-testeurs" pour améliorer le manuel en lui-même. La seconde permettre aux personnes intéressées de participer à un échange direct de questions/réponses, d'éclaircissements, d'approfondissement, etc.
  • Ces deux cas et les autres options ne peuvent exister que si l'intérêt est suffisant, et que le calendrier maitrisé compte tenu de nos activités professionnelles.
  • La prévente est le modèle idéal pour cela.
  • Si les préventes n'atteignent pas la somme minimale fixée, je compléterais le  delta pour lancer néanmoins les projets prévus. ET certains seront - je      l'espère - privilégiés de pouvoir accéder à ces approches modernes de      persuasion.
  • Si les préventes dépassent le seuil fixé. Tant mieux! Cela fera plus de      recherches lancées.

"Je veux bien participer. Mais, quel est l'intérêt pour moi ?"

Plusieurs niveaux de contributions cohabitent. Vous pouvez choisir votre degré d'implication mais aussi d'intégration de SCAN101. 

Chacune de ces contributions a un coût différent évidemment compte tenu de son impact sur nos activités.

 

J'aime l'idée de SCAN101 même si je ne veux pas participer à son financement

Je le comprend parfaitement! Merci de nous soutenir cependant sous deux angles :

  • Faites de la publicité à SCAN101! Parlez de notre ouvrage. Diffusez cette      page, mais aussi celle-ci http://gurl.im/ab003dE . Bref, aidez-nous à rendre plus visible notre action.
  • Indiegogo met à disposition différents outils de sharing. Cela serait dommage de ne pas en profiter!

A tous, merci par avance pour vos actions ! Elles sont appréciées à leur juste valeur.

Bien cordialement,

L'auteur

L'auteur

story:
About the Perks: Whether we reach my funding goal or not, you will receive your perks. As for the copy of my book: If we do not reach my funding goal, you will receive a PDF version in either German or English, depending on the translation costs. I tried to edit the perk descriptions, but the system won't allow any changes.

As true as it gets

Since January 2012, I have written countless pages of notes about my life and the things that happened to me and the people around me until now. It has been a year of extremes in every possible sense of the term, so unreal that I feel like it is in fact a story worth telling, and a story worth reading. It's the kind of year that changes your life in a sense that it redefines everything you thought you knew.

I am a 32 year old graphic designer and writer, and 2012 was a rollercoaster for me. It started off with a seemingly broken beyond repair heart, no job, no perspective and the certainty that I had nothing left in this world. I was looking back at about a decade of failures, regrets and dispointments.

And then, life happened in the form of my soulmate. I met her in the most unusual of places, and she felt the same way about me almost instantly. It was unexpected, mutual and utterly overwhelming. It was the "where were you all my life?" type of bond that nothing could scratch. It was the purest and most genuine form of happiness I had ever experienced. She saved my life.

Our love was however put to the test. Unprecedented tragedy struck, but we made it through everything life threw at us. It was a connection that transcends proximity, consciousness and choice. It was there, it couldn't be denied, and we know it will never fade.

And then, death happened. Not even ten days ago, devastating tragedy struck again, and the relationship took a hit we thought it couldn't take. My soulmate had to re-arrange her life, take on new responsibilities and priorities.

Rebecca is the journey that will soon take me across the ocean in an ultimate attempt at finding the love of my life.

It's a story about despair, love, happiness and tragedy. It's a story about distance and soulmates. It's a story about patience, hope and dreams and the attempt to make them come true. It's about a once in a lifetime shot at happiness. It's our story, and it is yet to be concluded.

Rebecca has no idea about this trip.

What We Need & What You Get

If, with your help, I eventually reach my funding goal, I will self-publish my story. It will be in German, but I will have it translated professionally into English. Here's how I plan on distributing the funds:

• My journey to the United States to conclude my story: ca. $1.500,-
• Self-publishing costs: ca. $ 10.000,- depending on the number of copies
• Professional translation into English: ca. $ 2.500,-
• Marketing: ca. $ 1.000,- thanks to connections and networking

If I don't reach my funding goal, I will finish my story anyway, I'm just going to have to find ways of publishing it via PDF or Kindle instead of hard copies. If there is money left, I will have it translated, too.
I plan on finishing my book in 2013.

Perks

As a graphic designer, I will design for you. Please have a look at the perks. I have designed web sites, logos, magazines and all sorts of other things over the past 12 years.

Please feel free to browse a tiny percentage of the work I have done over the years:
Logofolio #1
Logofolio #2

Make or Break

2012 marks the breaking point in my life. It has been as intense as I have never experienced it before, as I am wrting these words I still cannot believe the pain and the happiness I went through in the past ten months. For the most part, it seemed that my complete faith in finding "the one" was rewarded, yet recently clouds of doubt have appeared across the horizon. Small clouds, but still. In my attempt to uncover the truth to blow them away, I feel like this year could be "my year".
I will not sugar coat anything that has happened to me. I am devoted to honesty, and you as future readers will experience that devotion first hand. I will however change the names of the people involved.

My goal is not to get rich by publishing this story. I just want to tell it.

Honesty

This isn't some elaborate con to promote myself as a graphic designer. This is for real, and I hope it is believable enough for all of you to contribute.

If you have questions, feel free to ask here or on facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/stellerich

story:
Hey there!  This “Baby Boomer” Grandmother with no retirement provision (recently laid off from a church office secretarial & editorial position, no unemployment benefits) needs your help to apply her BA degree in English, summa cum laude and secure the financial means for fulfilling a lifelong ambition of writing her first children’s  book: The Tiniest Bird & Biggest Best Birdhouse in the West and author the first of an already researched series of children’s bird books that will be based on the multi-level Montessori educational model; over a century ago Dr. Maria Montessori theorized then proved: “the brain is hand-made”. From their earliest years, children instinctively begin giving expression to what they tangibly experience with every one of their five senses ~ and a sixth ~ wonder~ that adults usually lose sight of in their scramble to survive in today’s world.  Sadly, children are also increasingly deprived of this naturally enjoyable birthright! At each sensitive stage of a child’s human development there must be many absorbing activities for their:

  • hands’ construction
  • eyes’ curiosity
  • mind’s imagination
  • ears’ attunement
  • body’s movement
  • heart’s song  

My book will stimulate development of these senses which together foster advancement of early literacy skills, pro-social skills, and abstract thinking/problem solving skills, fine arts and music appreciation.  The very root of storytelling springs from the universal need for companionship and consolation.  Many respected sociologists researching the origin of life have placed the need to tell and hear stories second in necessity only to physical hunger!  Storytelling ~ if made FUN for all concerned ~ is one of the most powerful motivations for children to read!

The first book (title above) in my intended series will provide an interactive, unique format that will happily engage the child multi-generationally with siblings, parents and caretakers ~ each and all of whom will be gauging the youngster’s comprehension by what the child is challenged TO DO WITH THEM in response to what has been related on each page via the narrative words, interspersed with song, illustration, and poetry!

 

My book project goal: $9,500.
Estimated time is 6 months after end of fundraising campaign to write and self-publish this first book.

EASY CALCULATION OF FUNDING GOAL:
