Rewards/Perks:
Donors of up to $25.00 or more will be acknowledged with one of my handmade photo cards to thank you. 

Donors of $50.00 or more will get a thank you note and my choice of 2 children’s & young adults’ books from our on-line bookstore: www.booksetsforteachersandkids.com
Donors of $100.00 or more will get their names printed on the Acknowledgments pg. and receive an autographed copy of this self-printed bird book.

Donors of $1,000 will get a Sand Hill Cranes print by my artist husband, Steve Larson; see more at www.paintedhorsegallery.com

 

How this project evolved: I’ve daily cohabited in all seasons with a variety of beautiful birds and more formidable wildlife such as bear and cougar having lived ‘green’ or off-the-grid with my artist husband for over 15 years on a remote alpine meadow nestled between the San Isabel Natl. Forest to the East and the Sangre de Cristo Mts. to the West. The birds’ beauty and behavior has been my favorite subject of observation, research, photography, and journaling. My  bird-characters of various species will work out with quirky humor, goofs, guidance, adventures, and growing self-esteem ‘the real stuff’ of their individuality and inter-connected, earth- existence in ways children can discover, identify, and do something with ~ pleasurably, creatively, constructively ~  interacting with their peers and parents. I’m convinced that the emergent 21st generation of children is largely not hearing the good news that each of them is a unique marvel capable of creating, instead of destroying, life on this planet; they’re bombarded daily by multi-media bad news and violence. Pablo Casals famously said forty years ago: “There is not another child exactly like you.  Look at your body~ what a wonder it is! …You have the capacity for anything.  Yes, you are a marvel.  And when you grow up, can you then harm another, who is like you, a unique marvel?” This present book project has become more personally compelling in the wake of the recent, ghastly Newtown tragedy that took place in my native state, CT. 

My observations and motivations for launching this book project can also be traced to a block of undergraduate studies on early childhood education, subsequent Montessori teacher training and classroom experience, writing/ directing a community after-school program in dramatic arts, and presenting a bevy of original workshops over the years.   

Summary:  Your help funding this author is about more than just another children’s book or this specific project. Funding will enable this 66 year old grandmother to live and write/work from home in a remote mountain location where there are virtually ‘no jobs’ in this small town and a round-trip commute is 3 hrs.to the nearest city with a descent of several thousand feet along a dangerous mountain pass. Since the housing market crash in 2008, nearly every other local property is ‘for sale’ and a typical house can take up to a decade to sell. Self-employment in our hand-crafted off-the-grid home is my only option for a productive future.

I’ll be forever grateful for all contributions and if you can’t contribute money, please ask a couple of your friends it they can help out.
story_txt:
Hey there!  This “Baby Boomer” Grandmother with no retirement provision (recently laid off from a church office secretarial & editorial position, no unemployment benefits) needs your help to apply her BA degree in English, summa cum laude and secure the financial means for fulfilling a lifelong ambition of writing her first children’s  book: The Tiniest Bird & Biggest Best Birdhouse in the West and author the first of an already researched series of children’s bird books that will be based on the multi-level Montessori educational model; over a century ago Dr. Maria Montessori theorized then proved: “the brain is hand-made”. From their earliest years, children instinctively begin giving expression to what they tangibly experience with every one of their five senses ~ and a sixth ~ wonder~ that adults usually lose sight of in their scramble to survive in today’s world.  Sadly, children are also increasingly deprived of this naturally enjoyable birthright! At each sensitive stage of a child’s human development there must be many absorbing activities for their:

hands’ construction
eyes’ curiosity
mind’s imagination
ears’ attunement
body’s movement
heart’s song  

My book will stimulate development of these senses which together foster advancement of early literacy skills, pro-social skills, and abstract thinking/problem solving skills, fine arts and music appreciation.  The very root of storytelling springs from the universal need for companionship and consolation.  Many respected sociologists researching the origin of life have placed the need to tell and hear stories second in necessity only to physical hunger!  Storytelling ~ if made FUN for all concerned ~ is one of the most powerful motivations for children to read!
The first book (title above) in my intended series will provide an interactive, unique format that will happily engage the child multi-generationally with siblings, parents and caretakers ~ each and all of whom will be gauging the youngster’s comprehension by what the child is challenged TO DO WITH THEM in response to what has been related on each page via the narrative words, interspersed with song, illustration, and poetry!
 
My book project goal: $9,500.Estimated time is 6 months after end of fundraising campaign to write and self-publish this first book.

story:
Mi nombre es Roberto Retana y soy el creador de Pizza Oliva. Pizza Oliva nació en Costa Rica con una inversión muy pequeña y mucho trabajo. 

Comencé el negocio con exactamente 1200 dólares y una tarjeta de crédito. Como tuve la oportunidad de estudiar administración de negocios, pude utilizar esos conocimientos para gestionar correctamente mi emprendimiento y lograr que esta creciera aunque fuese lentamente.

Pizza Oliva ha crecido y actualmente da trabajo a 5 personas incluyéndome. Pasamos de tener una sola pizzeria a tener dos. Esta vez, nuestro objetivo es llegar a abrir una pizzería estilo Napolitano que requiere equipos especializados, ingredientes importados y mucha disciplina para hacer las cosas siguiendo la tradición Napolitana.  Nuestro objetivo es poder ofrecer más productos que los que actualmente se ofrecemos y dar una experiencia completamente diferente. Adicionalmente queremos desarrollar e implementar una oferta de gelato Italiano, lo cuál requiere de equipo especial.

Aún falta mucho para llegar a lograrlo pero abrir un restaurante en vez de una ventanita de productos para llevar, es un paso en la dirección correcta. Desde que abrimos nuestro concepto ha sido el de ofrecer pizza express o para llevar. Actualmente este proyecto lo estamos realizando con el dinero que hemos podido capitalizar durante todo este tiempo. Sin embargo, estamos requiriendo un poco más para poder llevar a cabo la visión exacta de lo que queremos hacer.

Hemos logrado formar un equipo de personas dedicadas que me acompañan en esto y a quienes hemos podido dar la oportunidad de tener un trabajo.

Nuestro nuevo restaurante se encuentra en San José en el barrio La California frente al Parque Nacional, flanqueado por la estación de trenes al Atlantico y la asamblea legislativa.

El nuevo local representa la oportunidad de ampliar la gama de productos que podemos ofrecer y adicionalmente crear más puestos de trabajo a tiempo completo. Tenemos ya 2 personas que han luchado duro y con pasión para salir adelante. Gente con pasión es lo que necesitamos. En ambos casos son jóvenes y con deseos de estudiar y trabajar. 

La zona de San José donde se encontrará el restaurante contará con una nueva opción gastronómica y con nuestra inversión contribuiremos a la rehabilitación del centro de San José. El restaurante ofrecerá la posibilidad de poder realizar actividades culturales como exposiciones artísticas o la presentación de músicos solistas.

Financiamiento

En este momento solo estamos necesitando 6000 dólares USD los cuales serán destinados a la compra de los equipos necesarios para ampliar la nueva oferta de productos la cuál incluye gelato o helado estilo italiano y bases de pizza las cuales podremos ofrecer a otros negocios con los cuales queremos crear nuevos encadenamientos.

Actualmente tenemos en espera 3 clientes. Con su donación o ayuda al compartir por las redes sociales nuestra campaña, nosotros podremos acercarnos a nuestro objetivo. 

A todas aquellas personas que apoyen nuestra causa, les estaremos dando a cambio distintos productos conmemorativos. Entre ellos están tazas de café conmemorativas, camisetas conmemorativas, tarjetas VIP de descuento que le otorgarán un 25% de sus compras durante un año o incluso, la posibilidad de dejar una huella en nuestro restaurante al tener su nombre en alguna de nuestras mesas como tributo a su ayuda y con ello ser parte de nuestra historia.

Impacto

Con su ayuda podremos crear nuevos puestos de trabajo para personas que desean  desempeñarse en area de la gastronomía. Eventualmente el número de empleos directos e indirectos puede incrementar y por lo tanto, su donación ayudará a crear empleo. 

Actualmente Pizza Oliva es un lugar de encuentro de amigos y nosotros podemos decir que tenemos un impacto sobre la comunidad en los lugares donde operamos ya que las personas interactúan y se encuentran, se conocen, comparten lo cual termina reforzando los valores comunitarios.

El area de San José donde se encuentra nuestro futuro restaurante, ya cuenta con la propuesta gastronómica de otros negocios como Café Miel, Maza Bistró, Manos en la Masa, Sana Sana, Yummy Lab y la Ventanita Meraki. Creemos firmemente que con la apertura de nuestro negocio, estaremos ayudando a crear toda una nueva zona de importancia económica y gastronómica e incluso fortalecerla.

Finalmente, a raíz de mi emprendimiento me ví expuesto a muchas personas que me buscaban para pedirme ayuda y consejo de como comenzar un negocio. Durante estos años me he formado como consultor y coach para emprendedores. El restaurante se estará acondicionando adicionalmente para poder realizar talleres y capacitaciones para personas que deseen emprender y así tener las herramientas necesarias para hacerlo con éxito. Al alcanzar el objetivo podremos llevar a cabo todo esto y contamos realizar estos talleres en coordinación con distintas organizaciones que buscan promover el emprendimiento exitoso, sobre todo en familias de escasos recursos y así ayudar a disminuir el subempleo y empleo informal. 

 Riesgos y retos

Los retos son muchos, pero como lo hemos hecho otras veces, hemos logrado salir adelante creando empleo y productos que nuestros clientes disfrutan. 

En los riesgos no pensamos mucho ya que estos siempre existen naturalmente en cualquier negocio. Y la verdad, somos positivos así que sabemos desde ya, que esto va funcionar. Ahora, el financiamiento aportado por todos los que nos apoyen, ayudarán a reducir justamente, los riesgos que implica el financiarse mediante créditos los cuales a veces no están disponibles para las PYMES ni tampoco se adaptan a sus necesidades debido a las requisitos que requieren y la tasa de interés.

Nuestra experiencia previa de 5 años en este negocio y el hecho de que trabajamos ordenadamente, llevando libros contables, nos ha permitido simular, formular y evaluar nuestro modelo de negocio, permitiéndonos entender cuales son las areas clave de desempeño que tenemos que alcanzar para poder tener éxito. 

Finalmente, usted puede apoyar nuestra campaña compartiéndola con sus amigos y familiares. Estamos seguros que alguno de ellos ya nos conoce y estará muy feliz de saber cuales son los nuevos retos que estamos asumiendo y la nueva aventura que esto representa. 

Muchas gracias por su tiempo visitando nuestra campaña. Nos vemos el día de la inauguración.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Melissa Nelson Lowe and I'm the daughter and co-author of the Sugar Alpha series. I am a professional skydiver with  11,000+ skydives and 18 world records. This book is about the incredible stories of my late father, Roger Nelson, a skydiving pioneer, and  a well-known drug smuggler. 

The completion of this campaign signifies the completion of the Sugar Alpha series. Taking on this project has been emotionally trying as I figured out many mysteries of my childhood. Finishing this project would be a huge emotional relief, and my contribution to my family, preserving OUR history, and essentially - a piece of skydiving history!

Although Volume 2 doesn't end with my dad's last breath, it is the last part of his life he wrote about. Your support will help me complete the journey publishing my dad's story.

What We Need & What You Get

I have spent just under a decade working on this project out of my own pocket, and my own time. The monies raised will be for the final publication stages and to pay back the already-incurred expenses shown below.

The baseline goal is $10,000. However the campaign allows for more contributions. Any additional funds will be used towards creating audio books and continue to work on making this series a movie! 

 

The campaign will be an inclusive journey in the publishing process and more personal than just buying the book on Amazon. Each supporter will be asked to participate in voting for the official title of Volume 2, approve author images, and vote on the cover artwork, and other things along the way! 

I also believe in giving back to supporters in contributing to the campaign! Therefore, I've created a BONUS BOOK "Volume 3" dust jacket comprised of a few of my dad's original handwritten memoirs, dozens of photos, newspaper articles, indictment statements and more! This bonus book is EXCLUSIVE to the campaign supporters and WILL NOT be for sale to the general public. The only exception is for me selling any remaining copies during the physical launch in Chicago.

I have a hunch that we'll reach the goal of $10,000, however if we do not, the funds will still go into the final phases of book publication. 

The Impact

Sugar Alpha is a great piece of the often unspoken parts of skydiving history. Sugar Alpha Volume 1 sold over 3,000 copies in its first week and made it to Amazon's Top 10 Best Seller's list of new arrivals. Finally, it is preserving my family's history, and a tiny snippet of skydiving history. 

The Process

PHASE 1 - Write the book Done!

PHASE 2 - Edit the book  Editing last chapter as I write this!

PHASE 3 - Digitized documents & photos completed. Beginning to start assembling Volume 3 into book form.

PHASE 4 - Design mock cover artwork Done!

PHASE 5 - Launch Indiegogo Boom! Here it is!

PHASE 6 - Final publication process for Volume 2 & 3 Waiting on completion of Phase 2 & 3, then off to publishers!

The official physical launch is scheduled for Summerfest at Skydive Chicago on August 3rd, 2017! 

International Supporters 

Accepted International Shipping in this campaign:  Canada 

Other international orders may be considered depending on the demand, and cost for shipping. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to the campaign, you can still help out by spreading the word! Indiegogo makes it easy with their sharing tools :) 

Shout Outs

Lastly, I just want to give a heartfelt thank you to all those that have helped make this a reality so far:

My editor, Robin Heid for tirelessly investigating the facts, pointing out shitty parts, and able to fill in many pieces of dialog with actual conversations with my dad; and his advice to me as a parent as I struggled through some tough moments being a mother.

My husband. For encouraging me, keeping me accountable, inspiring me, and poking me to finish these books - from the first one to now. 

My family. For recalling some deep dark moments of our life to bring alive the truth about my dad's character, and filling in missing pieces.

The Freak Brothers. Many Freak Brothers dusted the cobwebs of their memories to help recall many missing Convention years, share their logbook entries, and fondly remembering that time of their lives. Thank you for taking the time! 

YOU - Thank YOU for supporting me, and this campaign!

story:
Greetings , my name is Marquis H.K.   I've been involved in the Australian underground hardcore punk and metal scene for over thirty years . My journey has been an interesting one to say the least so I decided to document it into a compelling autobiographical account titled Thirty Years Of Anger .  By contributing to this campaign you will help in getting this important piece of Australian history out to the world . 

What We Need And What You Get

My target is to raise $5.000 AUD  . This will cover the cost of the publishing and the book which will sell for $29.95 AUD  and also shipping both national and international . If the desired target is not reached all funds will go towards the publishing of the book and you in turn as a contributor will still receive a signed copy . The rest of the target will be reached by other means . 

Impact 

This is by no means a pretty story it covers all the violence, police harassment, life in the Queensland Police State of the 80's, drugs, deaths and politics. So it is in parts brutal and in your face however there are also humorous elements in it. But above all it is honest and for real. This is my first book but I have previously published an underground magazine called The Sentinel and a risqué comic book titled Slices Of Sin. 

Risks and Challenges

This is a story coming from someone who's lived this lifestyle firsthand so everything in this book is a hundred percent accurate . It also features interviews with numerous band members , promoters , record label owners , club owners and independent store owners who were all part of the Australian underground scene . There will also be an extensive marketing campaign both from the Brisbane based publisher Boolarong Press and Myself . This will include a website , media coverage , social media , punk and heavy metal magazines and websites . 

Other Ways You Can Help 

Spread the word ! Let everyone know there is a book out on this important piece of Australian history !

story:
The RozzyPie Story

Hi! My name is Rosalyn. My closest friends call me RozzyPie. 

The RozzyPie story begins with me growing up as a young girl in the Philippines. My favourite childhood memory was going to the markets with my mother and then cooking up a storm in the kitchen. (The picture above shows me and my mom visiting one of these markets 25 years later.) I would marvel at the abundant feast we have created. Sharing food with my family at dinner was a time when I felt all was well and life was good and abundant.

When I was 12 years old, my family immigrated to Canada. Overnight, my life completely changed. Suddenly there were no more markets. Instead it was replaced by Safeway. Suddenly there was no more cooking up a storm in the kitchen. Instead it was replaced by my sister and I fumbling our way around the kitchen. My mom still cooked some traditional foods but increasingly, our diet Westernized, and the gap between me and my culture of origin grew larger.

While I felt disconnected from my culture of origin, I embraced my new journey of self-discovery and carving my own path. I made life and career choices that my parents did not understand, and it led to massive conflict between us. After graduating from university, I left my parents' home to take a job in a different city. 

Shortly after, I developed food allergies. The stress of a new city, a new job, and my parents’ disapproval had affected my most vital organs – my digestion. I had to completely alter how I ate. A naturopath advised that I adopt a gluten-free and dairy-free diet. In order to give my tummy time to heal, I had to be very gentle and eat foods that won’t irritate my delicate digestive tract.

About a year after I became gluten-free and dairy-free, I met one of my best foodie friends, Samantha. When we met at a dinner party, one of our first topics of our conversation was about food.

I learned she was Jewish-American born and raised in Southern California. I was Filipino-born Chinese Canadian and we had more in common in our culinary tastes and stories than anyone else in our entire life. Right then and there, a special bond was born. We called each other “food soul mates”.

Samantha’s mom was equally passionate about food, and before I knew it, I was spending two to three nights a week making and having dinner in their home .

Since I didn’t have family close by, they adopted me into their family. They had an extended family of siblings, children and grandchildren, and aunts and uncles. They called me RozzyPie. I called them my Island family, as this was in the city of Victoria off the coast of British Columbia. I had found home again, at least what felt something like home.

During these dinners we exchanged stories and recipes from our childhood, and it warmed my heart to have found beauty and kinship in our shared transcultural heritage.

While cooking miso-crusted salmon, or black beans with turkey sausage over brown rice, or enjoying the most delicious rack of lamb for Seder, we formed a bond that reminded me of those childhood days shopping at the wet markets and cooking with my mother.

Six years is a long time to have very little meaningful contact with my mother. In 2011, I decided to return to Vancouver to become an entrepreneur. There were better business opportunities here, and I missed my mom. I wanted to reconnect with her and heal the pain surrounding our estrangement.

It took me a year after returning to Vancouver to actually see my mom for the first time in almost 7 years.

I began visiting her every other weekend, and each time I would ask her to cook a dish that I craved from my childhood. She would do so every single time. And I was pleasantly surprised to discover that she had adopted healthier eating habits as well. In between pork bone and lotus root soups and chicken congee, she would also serve me chia seeds on gluten-free cereal.

The first time I tasted a home-cooked meal she made, my body cried and sang at the same time. It was as though I had satiated a hunger that I didn’t know existed. It wasn’t just about the food. It was about the memories, it was about the mother-daughter connection, lost and found, and it was about finally understanding my mother’s language of love.

Food is love.

Two years passed since I returned to Vancouver, and I missed my best friend, my food soul mate, and my Island family.

Somewhere deep inside me, I had a desire to write about my culinary experiences and share them with my food soul mate. I started my blog rozzypie.com in January 2014 simply as a way to share my favourite foodie adventures with her. I missed our food soul mate connection, so I decided that I would create this kind of bond with my foodie friends in Vancouver. 

In February 2014, I started the Food Soul Mate Club inside Facebook as a place where my foodie friends can unite and share and organize foodie adventures. 

In September 2014, I decided to create RozzyPie to be a thought leadership and lifestyle brand with a vision to inspire transformation through the journey of self-discovery and authentic expression. The deeper meaning of RozzyPie is about embracing yourself and everything that is uniquely YOU, following your heart and living life to the fullest. My message is captured in the tagline, "Life is yummy. Eat it up!™" Our mission at RozzyPie is to serve thought, inspiration and experiences for a full-flavoured life.

Since I was 10 years old, I've had a dream to write books. One of the books I wanted to write was a food-inspired manifesto on my philosophy on food and life, weaving in my personal story growing up in the Philippines nurturing my love of food from my mother, then immigrating to Canada, the loss of connection to my culture of origin, finding my own way, then coming back full circle integrating where I have come from and who I have become. 

Your contribution will give me time to write and complete my book, as well as create events and experiences that empower people (especially girls and women) to love themselves and make their dreams come true.

Timeline

Fundraising, speaking engagements and media appearances sharing my story, writing the book, creating food-inspired empowerment and coaching/mentoring programs 

March - June 2015

Editing, complete book + brand design, publishing the book

My Why & My Professional Background

The journey of self-discovery and authentic expression is a beautiful, sometimes heart-wrenching, and an ever-evolving process. 

RozzyPie's core message is about inspiring people to embrace themselves, follow their heart and live life to the fullest. Living this way takes courage. It has not always been easy for me, but it's the only way I know how to live. 

As a young girl growing up in a traditional and conservative culture, I had a sense that success looked a certain way on the outside. 

I dreamed of a different version of success, one that made my heart sing and my soul rejoice. I have successfully created that life for myself, and my journey continues. 

Fourteen years ago, when I was a young woman of colour just starting university, I became passionate about empowering visible minorities, especially young girls and women. 

I wanted them to discover the beauty in embracing their identity (however conflicted at first), own their stories, find their purpose and carve out a place for their dreams. I wanted to teach them that self-love is a powerful thing, that success comes the moment they choose to walk with love in this world.

This led me to begin a career as an activist for diversity and peace education, starting with the university, where I empowered students at UBC with physical, mental, language, or cultural barriers to success. I was also involved in spearheading the Initiative for Student Teaching and Research in Chinese Canadian Studies in 2005.
In 2008, I co-developed and launched a media-based social marketing campaign for Canada’s first Multicultural Environmental Education Program for new immigrants, pioneering a model now adopted by agencies across North America. During this time I also served as President of antidote: Multiracial and Indigenous Girls and Women’s Network for three years. It received the BC Representative for Children & Youth Award of Excellence in the Cultural Heritage & Diversity Category in 2009.
A change maker with an entrepreneurial spirit, my first business was helping immigrant professionals succeed in business. Then, I spent two years growing an international trade agency which became a leading seven-figure and award-winning export agency in North America. I also served as Founding Leader and Director of Operations for One Asian Education Inc., a pioneering company that helps women of Asian heritage achieve more success and more joy through the power of solidarity and sisterhood.

Today, as a business and organizational development consultant, I support leaders in fast-growth companies by building systems and structures as well as developing people and culture. I invest in pioneering projects and ventures with a social change mission. 
I've spent the last 12 years starting and growing pioneering projects and ventures that leave a lasting legacy. Whether it’s a business venture, an education initiative, a public service project, or a grassroots non-profit, I catalyze growth and transformation in people and organizations.
My goal is to impact the lives of 1 million girls and women by sharing the RozzyPie message through books, media products, coaching and mentoring programs, and yummy inspirational events. 
And it starts with the book! It is my priority to self-publish my first book in 2015. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share with your circles of friends who resonate with my story and my message
  • Share with women in your life who would benefit from my message and mentoring/coaching
  • A recommendation to various professionals who can assist me in publishing would be much appreciated! I need a rockstar editor, for example.
  • I'd love to speak to a videographer who "gets" what I'm trying to do and who would be willing sponsor a video for my campaign.
  • I want to create The RozzyPie Show. A recommendation to a media producer would be amazing!
  • I want to meet Oprah and share my vision with her. If you can make it happen for me, you will have my undying gratitude!

THANK YOU!

story:
How it Works

I will be writing two pages every day for 6 months starting in August. These pages will become an adult Science Fiction novel. I decided to give you a chance to read the novel as it's being written. If you choose to kick-start my novel and select the $45 reward, then you will receive 14 pages a week through the mail for 6 months. Because I don't want to add to cutting down more trees, the paper, envelopes, and post cards you receive will be made from 100% recycled paper. With the first envelope there will be a short introduction so that you know what kind of world you are about to enter. There will also be a thank you letter from me for backing my project. 

If you become one of the people receiving the pages through the mail, then you will also get access to a private blog where you can share your opinions about the novel as you read it. I might even incorporate some of your suggestions into the final edited version of the book! 

If you decide that reading 14 pages a week isn't for you, then you might want to pre order the book instead. By the time you get your copy it will be the final edited version. 

You can also support my project and get rewarded with a postcard with the cover art on the front. Maybe you or someone you know lives in Boston and will enjoy my version of the sign. 

The front of the post card on 100% Recycled paper. Back is blank.

The Story

It is the year 2035 and the world has drastically changed since the Apocalypse of  2018. An unknown virus that spread rapidly killed more than half of the world's human population and 100% of all animals. This virus made all of the animal products that were left completely inedible causing some to turn to eating bugs or... cannibalism. In order to maintain some type of stable society, the brilliant but twisted scientist Dr. Samson developed a way to quickly grow human clones to be used as a source of meat. With the president on his side, they created a strict way of life where you are either with them or you will be banished or killed instantly. Not everyone agreed with this way of life. Some saw the eating of clones as no different than eating the originals so they fled from the cities to live their lives as fugitives. It's a hard way of surviving, which puts them in the same land as brutally violent rogues and cannibalistic psychopaths. 

Sadie, the daughter of the world's most famous scientist Dr. Samson and the Governor of Massachusetts Jaden Samson, was raised in the glamorous world of the clone eaters not knowing of a different way of life. Join her as she discovers the dark side of her family's business and makes choices that will change her life forever.

 

Why Back This Project

This novel has been in my head for the past 7 years and I'd like to finally make it happen. Nothing will inspire me more to start and finish this novel than an audience - people who are willing to take a chance and read the novel as it's being made, or pre order the finished product. The money made from pre orders will go toward me getting the novel edited by a professional and self publishing it. Luckily I have a lot of experience with making book covers for others and as you can see I've already made one that I like. 

I hope that this book makes people think more about what they eat and where their food comes from. I can't wait to see how it turns out and I hope to see it become a movie someday! 

Copyrighted material ISBN-13: 978-1477670941

Thank you to all who back my project. I hope you enjoy what you read and I know I'll enjoy writing it. 

Have an awesome day and 2012! 

Thanks, Chelsi

Video Credits: 

Video created by Chelsi Roberts.

Music by Dexter Britain "The Time To Run"

story:
Hello, my name is J.W. Glaze auther of Warstorms "Emergence".

The first in a series of novels of sci-fi, fantasy, adventures that transverses time, space, & looks at the scope of the multi-verse in a way that stimulates the imagination.

Based on an innocent man from a distant world of primordial energies is accused of heresy, subject to witness as all he has worked for and loved is destroyed by his own people. Convicted and imprisoned he is forever banished from his beloved home world of Pasteil to wander about the cosmos in hopes of finding his place among the stars. With these events in motion the known universe will find itself in grave peril.

Now with that said this novel has been self published & is available online at such places as amazon, Barn & nobles, kindle, & various other online book stores.

So you may ask yourself why am i here today?

I am here today to ask for your help, though i have been able to self publish my novel i have not been able, financially, market this property properly.

The cost of travel, advertisments, ad campains, book fairs, book conventions, & all the additional unforseen cost are overwhelming.

 And this is where your help come in, to the right of this video is the base amount i need to begin marketing Warstorms "Emergence" & the perks i am offering for your participation.

In short i am asking you to please help me make my dreams of bringing the Warstorms saga to the masses.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

J.W. Glaze was born on March 21, 1970 in east Texas. During his younger years he traveled across the country with his family, visiting and even living in many states across America, with his parents and younger sister; he now resides in Texas with his wife and children. Home schooled by his parents most of his life, he often wrote short stories and accompanied by his own art work he attempted to put his thoughts into words.

During his youth he made frequent trips to the Theater and Library. Some of his favorite works are J.R.R. Tolkien’s "The Hobbit" and "Lord of the Rings", Frank Herbert’s "Dune", George Lucas’ "Star Wars", C.H. Lewis’ "Chronicals of Narnia", the various works of Tamora Pierce and Gene Roddenberry to name a few, and assorted graphic novels written by Marvel, D.C., and various independents.

Growing up in the eighties he listened to a variety of music, but composed music ignited his imagination and helped him to focus on his writing. He often listened to the various works of John Williams and Danny Elfman while writing Warstorms "Emergence". The final battle of Warstorms "Emergence" was written while listening to "The Brazilian", by Genesis.

The story of Warstorms began as the daydreams of a young man. The love of mystic tales and technological advances led him to craft a novel that he would enjoy reading. The project began as a hobby; he never intended to be published. He took a month to plot out the beginning saga, then sat at his desk and began writing in a notebook.

When he reached the end, he transferred the work to his computer, where most of Warstorms "Emergence" was written, although he sometimes found that the story flowed better when he wrote by hand.

All the characters in Warstorms "Emergence" are from J.W. Glaze’s imagination and are loosely based on family, friends, and people he met throughout his travels. It took him three months to write the first draft of Warstorms "Emergence" and two and a half years to revise it before giving it to his family and friends to read.

He decided to self-publish the book and so a third year was spent with another round of edits. While this was being done he began to design a cover, typeset the manuscript, and create marketing materials. During this time he also drew the map for Warstorms "Emergence".

Finally, the manuscript was sent to press, and the first books arrived.

PROLOGUE

“Between the light and shadow”

In the beginning there was only empty space and darkness. Within the darkness life evolved. It was life at its most primal. Survival was its only concern, the stronger feeding on the weaker.

Then from an unexplainable arcane source, light appeared. Darkness was shattered. Those creatures of the dark cursed the light and the new wisdom and understanding it brought.

The light exposed the distinctions between void and existence, shadows and luminosity, anonymity and revelation, ignorance and enlightenment. Wherever the light glowed thoughts formed and from these thoughts philosophies were born. Endless possibilities were envisioned. The methods to bring these visions into being were created and from these creations a multi-verse of realities was born.

The creatures of the dark recoiled into the nether reaches of the universe, as far from the light as they could hide. This region became known as the abyss. Those who made it their dwelling warred against one another struggling for dominance over the darkness. Thousands of years pass as their epic battles raged throughout the abyss until finally one group emerges victorious, the Yar’goth. These powerful, mystical creatures dripped with the primordial energies that saturated everything within and beyond this universe. They absorbed into themselves all those that opposed them until none but the Yar’goth remained.

Once their control of the abyss was secured they turned their attentions to those outside their domain. Pouring from this void like spilt ink flows across a blank page they consumed all in their path. Entire cultures, civilizations and star systems were completely absorbed or annihilated by the Yar’goth. Those allowed to live are forced to do the bidding of these dark masters.

The Yar’goth grew arrogant, coming to believe that they were unstoppable. By the time they had conquered over three quarters of the universe they even dared to call themselves gods.

Then they appeared, defenders of the light’s path. They were called the Eldicron, a race who had arisen on the far side of the universe furthest away from the grasp of the dark creatures. At first they had embraced the mystical ways of the universe. Dissatisfied with the inability to predict the precise outcomes of their mysticism they found a different means to advance their species. They called it science.

Armed with this knowledge they created massive war machines and weapons that were equal in capabilities to any mystical powers. As their technology increased so did their ability to leave their world. They were driven by their desire to convert the entire universe to their own form of honor, absolute justice and technical skills.

As the two opposing forces spread throughout the cosmos it was inevitable that an encounter would ensue. The Yar’goth and the Eldicron begin to rival for the center of the universe.

Each recognizes the true nature of their opponent; the Yar’goth being creatures of the dark, cold and self-absorbed while the Eldicron are creatures of enlightenment, believing that they are honor bound to bring absolute justice and technology to the entire universe.

Thus an intergalactic war of epic proportions is sparked as the two titanic races engage in wave after wave of bloody battles. Equally matched in strength neither is able to maintain the upper hand for long periods of time.

Their war would possibly still be raging even to this day if not for the internal deterioration of the Yar’goth Empire. With all their forces concentrating on the front lines the races on their outer borders begin to cast off the shackles of the Yar’goth’s oppression. The Yar’goth found it necessary to deploy forces to put down the insurrection thus weakening their position against the Eldicron.

The Yar’goth retreated to an uncharted sector of the universe to regroup and wait for stability to be restored within their realms. As they linger in this region they plan their next strategic move, a surprise attack on the Eldicron home world.

But before reinforcements could arrive their enemy discovered them. Knowing that a battle in space would only weaken their position the Yar’goth place their vulnerable troops upon a small green world in hopes of making a stand against the Eldicron until replacements arrive.

The Eldicron pursued the Yar’goth to the planet’s surface with assault troops, massive weapons and war machines. The din of the battle attracts the attention of the inhabitants of this planet, a world known to its people as Pasteil.

Watching in fascination two clans of Pasteilians gathered on cliffs overlooking the conflict between the two factions. Observing the conflict on the Yar’goth’s side of the battlefield is the clan house of Phe. As Phe and his people observe and mimic the strange mystical techniques wielded by the Yar’goth the clan house of Zenta, on the opposite side of the battlefield, are

observing the Eldicron and their scientific actions, measures and countermeasures.

When the war finally comes to an end, with the Eldicron emerging victorious, the Yar’goth are eliminated to the last entity. The Eldicron forces leave Pasteil, never to return.

On the world of Pasteil the two clan houses, using what they have learned, quickly become the two most dominate houses of their world. Within a single century both lay claim to their own half of Pasteil. The two houses live in relative peace for over a hundred generations.

At the end of this peaceful time the house of Zenta makes an announcement of catastrophic proportion. They claim to have uncovered the source of the great and powerful mystical forces that flow throughout the universe. Not only do they claim to know the origin but also they allege to have found a way to direct or even halt its ebb and flow thus giving them absolute control over the mystical forces of the multi-verse.

Enraged the mystical leaders of the house of Phe launched a sneak attack against the house of Zenta decimating them in a single strike. Some that survived went into hiding but most struck back. Their attempts were futile and all were imprisoned, slain or, the worse possible retribution, banishment. Any who dared to study science and technology are branded as heretics and banished into the void of space.

With science and technology destroyed on Pasteil the elders of the house of Phe’ decide the time has come to move out into the universe so that their powers and influence could grow. This endeavor will also give them an opportunity to find and subdue anyone from the house of Zenta’ that might have escaped. No one must be allowed to discover the secrets of the Zenta house.

Five-millennium pass and the Pasteilians influence stretches over all but the most remote parts of the universe. A small exploration ship discovers the home world of the Eldicron. They report that the Eldicron glory is now but a shadow of its former self. They observe from space that this once powerful empire has been reduced to two warring factions.

The planet surface itself is scorched black from constant war and conflict. It was covered with vast volcanic regions caused by unimaginable weapons of mass destruction. It was barely able to sustain life. The planet’s two moons had become large space

fortresses; one housing the skelicron lead by Tai’gi, eldest son of Zarakhan, the other is home to the Licron lead by Kyo’kuji, younger son of Zarakhan.

When the expedition returns and reports its findings fear is struck in the minds of the Pasteilians leaders known as the Alkar. Their leader, Lord Phe’eh’shi’wa, decides that the threat of either faction gaining control and thus repeating their pattern of universal domination is too great to be allowed.

The leaders knew that if they attacked the Eldicron home world head on that the two factions could decide to unite to fight a common enemy. Therefore they devise a plan whereby they remove the Eldicron as a threat without fear of reprisal. It was decided that Lord Phe’eh’shi’wa himself should execute the plan.

Lord Phe’eh’shi’wa’s ship arrived on the outer regions of the planetary system. From this position his ship launched millions of tiny crystals throughout the system. Each crystal was encrusted with a single rune.

While Lord Phe’eh’shi’wa enumerated hundreds of incantations these crystals begin to orbit the star system. As Phe’eh’shi’wa increased the strength of his spells the crystals above the planet and its two moons began to glow with power.

“Through the ebb and flow of the great mystic stream, between the Abyss and the light that forges us all, I command you, depart never to return!”

With this final command the light of the crystal enveloped the planet and surrounding area. A brilliant flash explodes in an implosion wave and all are gone.

Upon Lord Phe’eh’shi’wa’s return to Pasteil all herald him as a hero and a legend. Parades, monuments and houses of learning were erected in his honor. After centuries of service to the Pasteilians people Lord Phe’eh’shi’wa retired to fade into obscurity. From that day forward he could be found at the Pasteilian academy teaching future generations

story:
Believe Again, The North Pole Chronicles begins in the late 1700's when Kris Kringle is suddenly visited by a strange delegation that offers him a chance to distribute his gifts on a global basis. He and his wife Annie are inclined to disbelieve the boastings of this group but learn as they travel to the top of the world that miracles do take place every day. Together with their new elven friends, they change the course of history forever. Traditions will begin for this book, as they already have for Faith, Hope & Reindeer, as families gather round to hear the story of the North Pole and its residents.

Now Santa Claus needs to make sure these books get into the hands of the general public. And what better place to start than with avid book readers and buyers? Attending numerous book festivals and shows across the U.S. will put Santa and his books before tens of thousands of people. The book fair in Decatur Georgia alone draws a quarter million people over three days - all book readers.

A book's first year is critical. As a publisher you may submit a book for awards in its first year of publication. This also is part of the project. Many of these award programs require application fees, copies of the book, marketing materials, etc. 2013 will be the only year Believe Again will be eligible for submission, and we have included that as part of the project cost.

So what should you do next?

1. Watch the Video Above ↑

2. Choose a Perk from Santa's Bag →

3. Pledge your support $$$

4. Spread the word to friends and family ♥

Then stay up with our adventures as we visit cities and states around the US. We will post updates and pictures of the places we go and the successes that you, as our supporters, will share with us.

Faith, Hope & Reindeer has received 10 Five-Star reviews on Amazon and the comments have been glowing. This book just needs an additional push to truly be successful. As the funding grows, so too will our list of festivals, award programs and shows. Once the initial level is achieved we will post updates on which show will be our next target and how much is needed to accomplish that.

Help us fill the map in 2013!

story:
¿Qué?

El mar es nuestro nos sumerge en un océano lleno de mareas que rinde homenaje a todos esos abuelos luchadores que, con su trabajo y esfuerzo, lograron que sus hijos y nietos no vivieran las miserias que ellos padecieron.

A finales del siglo XIX, en plena guerra contra EEUU, tres jóvenes forjan una amistad que perdurará toda su vida. Andres, Joaquín e Imanol se conocen en medio de la batalla de la bahía de San Juan donde pone fin la guerra Hispanoamericana en Cuba. Pero a su regreso lucharán por una causa bastante diferente, sacar a sus familias adelante.

A su vuelta Andrés y Joaquín, que viven en la Villa de Cangas, se casan con Josefa y Avelina. Esta última sumida por los celos conspira con el fin de que sus negocios prosperen junto a Velasco, un viejo compañero de su esposo. Nada ni nadie podrá parar sus objetivos y no dudará en acabar con la vida de quién se le ponga en su camino.

Junto a su hijo, darán rienda suelta a sus instintos más primitivos en busca de su particular venganza y ansia de poder, que se prolongará durante generaciones. Sus miedos y sus odios serán mucho más peligrosos que la propia guerra.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Óscar Sánchez Fernández.

Formado en Químicas por la Universidad de Vigo, se ha dedicado desde siempre a la docencia; en la actualidad es dueño desde hace más de una década del Centro de Estudios Academia Brétema de la ciudad olívica. Compagina su trabajo con sus otras pasiones, el fútbol y la lectura. Tras su primera novela de éxito Códex Gigas, de género policial, ahora se sumerge en esta nueva aventura de novela histórica.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Andrés salió aquella noche con el corazón desolado por todo lo que le había contado su superior. Aquella desolación pronto se convirtió en indignación por haberse dejado engañar para acudir a aquella guerra. Sus ideas poco a poco fueron cambiando y entró en un modo de supervivencia; lo que más le dolía, era que su madre tenía razón sobre las exaltaciones de la prensa, pero en el fondo se había presentado voluntario por el dinero que le iban a pagar y que le permitiría ayudar a la mujer que con tanto cariño le había criado. Durante el día siguiente su mente no pudo despejarse por completo, y solo pensaba en hacer lo que le había dicho su madre: volver con los suyos.
          Joaquín experimentó en su persona todo lo que había pasado Andrés el día anterior. En un principio quiso negar todo lo que le relataba pero poco a poco se dio cuenta de que aquello tenía sentido. En varias de las cartas de su padre notó que algo no iba como tenía pensado, pero en ninguna de ellas le hablaba abiertamente de los posibles problemas, sino que más bien le daba ánimos para superar una guerra que debía estar ya finalizada.
          ―¿Alguien más sabe esto? ―preguntó Joaquín a sus dos nuevos amigos.
          ―Nadie, y pienso que así debería seguir siendo ―contestó Imanol.
          ―Pues que así sea, pero debemos estar preparados si queremos regresar a casa.
          ―Y unidos ―dijo emotivamente Andrés.
          ―Hagamos un pacto, señores ―propuso Imanol a la vez que sus dedos volvían a liar otro cigarrillo―, o regresamos los tres juntos o ninguno.
          ―¿No crees que es demasiado pedir? ¿Estás diciendo que si te enamoras en esa maldita isla, tendremos que quedarnos contigo? ―dijo Joaquín.
          ―No te preocupes que con esa nariz no lo va a querer ni la más ciega de la isla.
          Los tres amigos rieron a más no poder en una muestra de camaradería a la cual Joaquín no estaba acostumbrado; se sentía partícipe de algo, y por primera vez en mucho tiempo se podía mostrar como él mismo sin estar bajo el yugo de su madre o las atentas miradas de aquellos que no se acercaban por el mero hecho de ser hijo de alguien adinerado».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 980€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Óscar Sánchez Fernández vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad
story_txt:
¿Qué?
El mar es nuestro nos sumerge en un océano lleno de mareas que rinde homenaje a todos esos abuelos luchadores que, con su trabajo y esfuerzo, lograron que sus hijos y nietos no vivieran las miserias que ellos padecieron.
A finales del siglo XIX, en plena guerra contra EEUU, tres jóvenes forjan una amistad que perdurará toda su vida. Andres, Joaquín e Imanol se conocen en medio de la batalla de la bahía de San Juan donde pone fin la guerra Hispanoamericana en Cuba. Pero a su regreso lucharán por una causa bastante diferente, sacar a sus familias adelante.
A su vuelta Andrés y Joaquín, que viven en la Villa de Cangas, se casan con Josefa y Avelina. Esta última sumida por los celos conspira con el fin de que sus negocios prosperen junto a Velasco, un viejo compañero de su esposo. Nada ni nadie podrá parar sus objetivos y no dudará en acabar con la vida de quién se le ponga en su camino.
Junto a su hijo, darán rienda suelta a sus instintos más primitivos en busca de su particular venganza y ansia de poder, que se prolongará durante generaciones. Sus miedos y sus odios serán mucho más peligrosos que la propia guerra.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Óscar Sánchez Fernández.
Formado en Químicas por la Universidad de Vigo, se ha dedicado desde siempre a la docencia; en la actualidad es dueño desde hace más de una década del Centro de Estudios Academia Brétema de la ciudad olívica. Compagina su trabajo con sus otras pasiones, el fútbol y la lectura. Tras su primera novela de éxito Códex Gigas, de género policial, ahora se sumerge en esta nueva aventura de novela histórica.
¿Por qué?
Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:
«Andrés salió aquella noche con el corazón desolado por todo lo que le había contado su superior. Aquella desolación pronto se convirtió en indignación por haberse dejado engañar para acudir a aquella guerra. Sus ideas poco a poco fueron cambiando y entró en un modo de supervivencia; lo que más le dolía, era que su madre tenía razón sobre las exaltaciones de la prensa, pero en el fondo se había presentado voluntario por el dinero que le iban a pagar y que le permitiría ayudar a la mujer que con tanto cariño le había criado. Durante el día siguiente su mente no pudo despejarse por completo, y solo pensaba en hacer lo que le había dicho su madre: volver con los suyos.          Joaquín experimentó en su persona todo lo que había pasado Andrés el día anterior. En un principio quiso negar todo lo que le relataba pero poco a poco se dio cuenta de que aquello tenía sentido. En varias de las cartas de su padre notó que algo no iba como tenía pensado, pero en ninguna de ellas le hablaba abiertamente de los posibles problemas, sino que más bien le daba ánimos para superar una guerra que debía estar ya finalizada.          ―¿Alguien más sabe esto? ―preguntó Joaquín a sus dos nuevos amigos.          ―Nadie, y pienso que así debería seguir siendo ―contestó Imanol.          ―Pues que así sea, pero debemos estar preparados si queremos regresar a casa.          ―Y unidos ―dijo emotivamente Andrés.          ―Hagamos un pacto, señores ―propuso Imanol a la vez que sus dedos volvían a liar otro cigarrillo―, o regresamos los tres juntos o ninguno.          ―¿No crees que es demasiado pedir? ¿Estás diciendo que si te enamoras en esa maldita isla, tendremos que quedarnos contigo? ―dijo Joaquín.          ―No te preocupes que con esa nariz no lo va a querer ni la más ciega de la isla.          Los tres amigos rieron a más no poder en una muestra de camaradería a la cual Joaquín no estaba acostumbrado; se sentía partícipe de algo, y por primera vez en mucho tiempo se podía mostrar como él mismo sin estar bajo el yugo de su madre o las atentas miradas de aquellos que no se acercaban por el mero hecho de ser hijo de alguien adinerado».

story:
Story of My Book

Wedding Z: How to Reimagine Weddings for the Next Generation.
Generation Z, the generation after millennials, is going to shake up the wedding industry. With Gen Z’s unique approach to culture, technology, sustainability, and more, cutting-edge leaders in the wedding industry are reimagining their products and services to appeal to this generation.

My name is Breanna Decker and I am the author of Wedding Z. I wrote this book because I could see that my generation, Generation Z, was starting to make big changes in the wedding industry and I wanted to learn more.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how Gen Z’s influence is impacting all consumer sectors and be inspired by the entrepreneurial spirit of those in the wedding industry. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for weddings in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you plan your wedding differently.

In this book, you'll learn about the ins-and-outs of Generation Z's consumer habits and how the wedding industry is approaching things differently from a creative perspective.

 

  • Marketing Generation Z is going to be different and challenging. Wedding vendors need to sell themselves, their background, their expertise, and their experience to Gen Z, who demand authenticity, customization, and more.
  • Learning the values of Generation Z and understanding how they influence their consumer decisions will either make your wedding-related biz a success or a failure.
  • The bottom line is you must embrace and jump on the wave that Gen Z is creating in this industry, or your business will not be able to serve the rising target market.

You will love this book if you are a wedding vendor wanting to stay relevant in this changing industry or are a bride to be looking for inspiration on how to plan your wedding differently.

Wedding Z is a non-fiction book that speaks to brides-to-be and wedding vendors who are looking at Generation Z’s influence on wedding trends and who truly want to approach weddings differently for the first time.

 

The Book - Wedding Z: Reimagine Weddings for the Next Generation

The book is written in 4 Parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction and two additional chapters. These chapters tell my personal history in the wedding industry, and explain my heart for starting on my journey to empower brides and vendors with connections and knowledge. I also walk you through the changing industry, which leads to Generation Z being in the spotlight.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-8. In these chapters, I introduce Generation Z and examine how they approach topics such as sustainability, technology, diversity, and culture and how these values impact their view on the wedding industry.

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-15. These chapters look at influential, cutting-edge companies and vendors within the wedding industry such as Zola, Hope Taylor Photography, Laurie Hartwell The Bridal Society, and more. These companies are aligning their missions and values with the new expectations and markets of a new generation, making them extremely successful industry leaders.

Part 4, Chapter 16-19, are reflections from my prospective as a wedding industry professional. This industry presents its own unique challenges, and these chapters examine opportunity cost, unforeseen struggles, and a behind-the-scenes look and reflections at what wedding professional could do differently, from someone who is in the day-in and day-out of the grind of the industry.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now: You will receive:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish in December 2019.
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Breanna Decker is an alumni of Liberty University where she earned her Bachelors of Science in Family & Consumer Sciences with a minor in business. With a heart for educating others, Breanna also received her teacher licensure at Liberty University, which she hopes to use in a non-conventional environment to teach others about her passions. She is also a Certified Wedding Planner through The Bridal Society, where she has access to unparalleled community, leadership, and professional development opportunities.

Breanna is passionate about the changing trends and developments within the wedding industry. As she developed into a wedding professional in her early 20s, she was intrigued about how her fellow generation Z members were making such an impact in the wedding world. Curious to examine the connection between the transforming trends of industry with the newest generation, Breanna started on her journey of researching and writing Wedding Z.

When Breanna isn’t writing blog posts about wedding trends or meeting with brides-to-be, you can find her thrift shopping with an iced latte in hand or exploring new restaurants with her fiance.

For more information, you can connect with Breanna at breedecker1@gmail.com. Her personal instagram handle is @bree_decker and wedding planning business account is @atlasandember

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #[WeddingGenZ] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Breanna Decker

story:
Stretch Goal! 

We've surpassed 100% funded! Although, the more funds we collect, means the more books we can print. We'd love to do a 1500 book print run at a cost of $6500+ with shipping. Therefore, we'd love to continue asking for your support of our project to try and reach $6500. As a bonus for hitting our original goal, I'll be including a special edition Nori magnet and bookmark with every perk! Thank you! -Jeff & Nori

 

My Story

Hi! I'm Jeff Chiba Stearns and I am a storyteller & illustrator. I am also an award-winning and Emmy nominated animation filmmaker best known for the films Yellow Sticky Notes and Mixed Match!

Since having kids, I've directed my attention to creating children's books that will inspire both my son and daughter. 

I created my first children's book Mixed Critters so that my mixed Japanese daughter could see herself reflected in animals like her, mixed! 

 

Nori and His Delicious Dreams - The Story

For my next children's book, Nori and His Delicious Dreams, I've combined two of my favourite things, eating and sleeping!

The main character, Nori, is a mixed Japanese toddler with an insatiable appetite who dreams of sleeping on beds made of delectable dishes. The book is an exploration of culinary delights from around the globe that is sure to excite the appetites of all your little ones through colourful illustrations and playful rhymes. 

 

The inspiration for the book came when I was in high school. A friend kept mentioning how comfortable it would be to sleep in a warm chicken sandwich. It sounded kind of weird but the visual of this never left my imagination. Now, 20 years later, Nori and His Delicious Dreams was born!  

 

 

Why Self-Publish...

Like Mixed Critters, I'm deciding to self-publish Nori and His Delicious Dreams to help realize my project without the interference of a publisher and get the book into your hands in only a few months, not years!  

This campaign will help me afford the initial printing of the first run of the 32 page hardcover book, Nori and His Delicious Dreams.

Nori and His Delicious Dreams is a fantastic way to introduce your children to the delicious foods from various cultures around the world!​

 

The Rewards!

On top of pre-ordering hardcover copies of the book, I also have combo perks with copies of Mixed Critters available, and even some of the original ink illustrations from Nori and His Delicious Dreams. 

 

ORIGINAL ART! For those that know me, they know that I never part with my original illustrations so this is a super rare opportunity to own an original hand drawn and inked illustration from the book! Includes Certificate of Authenticity and signed copy of the book. Please contact me if you'd like to see larger resolution photos of the drawings. If there’s an illustration that you like, act fast, as these are sure to go quickly!  ​

 

Also available are original ink drawings on 4x6 inch Post-it Notes from the October 2019 #Inktober series (1 of 31 drawings) on my Instagram @meditatingbunny. You'll receive one randomly selected original brush ink illustration featuring Nori. Includes Certificate of Authenticity and signed copy of the book. Please message me if you have a specific request (based on availability). 

I will also be offering school presentations where I'll come to your class or Skype in if you're outside of Vancouver/Kelowna, BC. I will talk to your students about making children's books, teach them animation, basically anything that I do creatively to help inspire your students' imaginations! 

 

All funds received will go towards book printing and shipping. The amount raised will determine how many books I'll be able to print...so every little bit helps!

 

The Impact!

I'm committed to creating stories that reflect representation! I, myself, am mixed Japanese-Canadian so it’s important to me that Nori is also mixed (he's kinda me as a kid). I firmly believe that our children need positive role models that reflect the diversity that exists in their world today!

To date, I've created 7 short animated films and 2 feature length documentaries that explore diversity and multiculturalism. After self-publishing my first children's book, I'm committed to creating more stories that reflect diverse voices and characters. 

Also, I love food and sleep! Who doesn't, right? For the book, I've showcased food and dishes from around the world to help introduce kids to the joys of exploring their culinary horizons.

 

Timeline

The book is finished and ready for printing. Once the campaign ends, I'll put in the order for the hardcover books. You will receive a digital copy a few days prior to receiving hardcover copies.

All perks will be ready to ship by spring 2020!  You will be guaranteed to receive any books and illustrations that you back because I have your back!

School presentations can be scheduled any time during the 2019/20 and 2020/21 school year.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word about my campaign to your family and friends. I really just want my books in the hands of little ones who will hopefully be entertained, inspired and excited about my stories and illustrations. 

Please share my Indiegogo link on all your social media platforms via the Indiegogo share tools and help me make some noise about my latest project. I'm doing my best to create quality stories that can be enjoyed by both young and old! 

Thank you so much for all your support, no matter how big or small!

- Jeff Chiba Stearns

I'm committed to creating stories that reflect representation! I, myself, am mixed Japanese-Canadian so it’s important to me that Nori is also mixed (he's kinda me as a kid). I firmly believe that our children need positive role models that reflect the diversity that exists in their world today!
To date, I've created 7 short animated films and 2 feature length documentaries that explore diversity and multiculturalism. After self-publishing my first children's book, I'm committed to creating more stories that reflect diverse voices and characters. 
Also, I love food and sleep! Who doesn't, right? For the book, I've showcased food and dishes from around the world to help introduce kids to the joys of exploring their culinary horizons.


 
Timeline
The book is finished and ready for printing. Once the campaign ends, I'll put in the order for the hardcover books. You will receive a digital copy a few days prior to receiving hardcover copies.
All perks will be ready to ship by spring 2020!  You will be guaranteed to receive any books and illustrations that you back because I have your back!
School presentations can be scheduled any time during the 2019/20 and 2020/21 school year.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us spread the word about my campaign to your family and friends. I really just want my books in the hands of little ones who will hopefully be entertained, inspired and excited about my stories and illustrations. 
Please share my Indiegogo link on all your social media platforms via the Indiegogo share tools and help me make some noise about my latest project. I'm doing my best to create quality stories that can be enjoyed by both young and old! 
Thank you so much for all your support, no matter how big or small!- Jeff Chiba Stearns

story:
Remember that story I wrote about semi-sentient tattoos? Well, it's time to bring it out to the world, and to do that I'd like your help. I'm crowdfunding so I can pay the costs of self-publishing, including (but not limited to) editing, copyediting, revisions, cover art, ISBNs, and formatting.


Awful things happen. Sometimes you’re left alive, but it leaves a Mark. They aren’t tattoos, and they express your hidden powers—and your hidden desires. They grow as you use them. And someone wants them very, very badly…

A winding road, a freak storm, and a lightning strike. Jude Altfall’s life, just beginning to coalesce after her divorce, is shattered afresh. Dazed with grief, she’s not sure if the weird things happening around her are hallucinations…or something more. And there’s the mark on her hip—a tattoo she can’t for the life of her remember getting.

Preston Marlock left a shadowy government agency two years ago, to hunt a killer. Each time the bastard strikes the trail goes cold, and not even Marlock’s more-than-natural abilities are helping. Now the killer’s taken one of his very few friends, and there’s a surviving witness. The Altfall woman is now that most precious and fragile of targets, newly Marked. All Marlock has to do is dangle her like bait, and the killer will eventually show up. 

The Skinner knows some people are different. Special. He has a collection of stretched skin and pretty pictures, each harvested with care. The trick is to take them while the victim is still struggling, still alive, otherwise their power is lost. He is careful, methodical, and precise, but chance robs him of a prize. Once he realizes Jude Altfall has what he covets, and has possibly seen his face, her fate is sealed. And just to be cautious, the Skinner might swat at the annoying fly who has buzzed along his trail for two years.

Sometimes you survive, and you bear a Mark.

And some things are worse than death.


Projected publishing date: October 2016

story:
The Words Matter project is bringing area writers, artists and performers together. Four groups of Mid-South creatives have been putting together four multimedia works that will be presented on Friday, October 4, at the Marshall Arts Gallery, 639 Marshall Ave.

This is an event where process and product will be on display. Each of the four projects began with words -- a literary contribution from a writer. From there, a combination of artists and performers extended that creation in their own media -- visual artists, musicians, dancers, actors and filmmakers found collective expression from the language. 

Memphis has been making some bold and unusual collaborations across artistic disciplines and we want to be part of and encourage that. 

Other than the project starting with the written word, there were no rules. The artists were free to do their art. 

On Oct. 4 at Marshall Arts, we'll have a party where you can see what the groups have done, visit with the artists, and experience what some of our town's top talent does when, as Neil Gaiman puts it, they make good art. 

We want you to support us as well. We're asking amazingly little for something that involves all these artists and assistants and muses. Click on an amount now to help us cover expenses, and if you can't, then please spread the word. And whatever you do, come on out on Oct. 4 and experience the creativity.

story:
Breve reseña

Después de 4 años enseñando herramientas y estrategias para encontrar trabajo, he decidido trasladar todo el conocimiento adquirido a un sencillo libro.

La idea es trasladar todo lo que pueda de lo que enseño en el taller, mis conferencias y los blogs; a una estructura fácil de leer y muy completa.

Usted puede hacer parte de esta iniciativa. Puede apoyar precomprando el libro.

Queremos que nos apoye en este emprendimiento, para poder hacer realidad este libro.

Los fondos son para auto-publicar el libro

Al mejor estilo de 48 Días. No busque que lo escojan, escójase a usted.

No quiero salir a buscar editoriales. Quiero que lo publiquemos nosotros (cuando digo nosotros, hablo de la comunidad de 48 Días en español).

La donación más pequeña recibirá el libro en primera edición autografiado. De ahí en adelante armaremos productos que esperamos les sea interesantes.

La meta está en 5.000USD. Creemos que con 10' de pesos (COP), tenemos para nuestra primera edición.

El impacto

Queremos poder llegar a más personas, sobre todo en las regiones y en otros países. 

Sabemos que tenemos un excelente mensaje que le cambia la vida a las personas.

Queremos ayudar y hacer de la vida de muchos una vida digna con un trabajo que dignifique y llene de propósito a la persona.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si por alguna razón quiere ayudar pero no puede, lo único que le pedimos es que le cuente a una amiga o amigo. Esa es la mayor ayuda que podemos recibir.

Índice del libro

1.  Por dónde empezar

a.  Percepción de trabajo

b.  Trabajo y el balance en nuestra vida

c.  ¿Qué trabajo debería buscar?

2.  Hoja de vida

a.  ¿Para qué es la hoja de vida?

b.  Preparar la hoja de vida

c.  Temas a tener en cuenta de forma

d.  El contenido

e.  Carta de presentación

f.  Otras herramientas

3.  Estrategias para encontrar trabajo

a.  Factores que afectan la búsqueda de trabajo

b.  ¿A que le estamos invirtiendo nuestro tiempo?

c.  Estrategias

4.  Entrevista

a.  ¿Por qué le tenemos miedo a la entrevista?

b.  ¿Qué es la entrevista?

c.  Mayores errores en la entrevista

d.  Preparación para la entrevista

e.  El día de la entrevista

f.  Preguntas comunes

g.  Preguntas difíciles

h.  Preguntas sin sentido

i.  La forma como hablamos

j.  Entrevista Individual

k.  Entrevista Grupal

l.  Assestment

m.  Entrevistas que no son entrevistas

5.  Detalles finales

a.  Pruebas Psicotécnicas

b.  Polígrafo

c.  Visita domiciliaria

6.  Negociación del contrato

7.  Como ser un buen Novato

8.  Crear su propio trabajo
