story:
Does This Sound Familiar?

For those who want to start working out but can’t find the courage to join a gym, So What Have You Got To Lose is for you. So What Have You Got To Lose is the name of a book I am writing to arm you with all you need to know before stepping foot into your local health center. Unlike the countless other "gym" books on the market this one is different. This is the book you want to read before picking up any of the others. I'm not trying to sell you on some new workout craze or weight loss method but rather providing you with a survival guide to get you through those first few steps, days or weeks at the gym. Imagine the first time you went grocery shopping on your own, how prepared were you. Did you have a list? Did you know the layout of the store? Or did you find yourself feeling overwhelmed with options and people from the second you walked through those sliding glass doors?

Now imagine that before you even left your house that day you'd read a guide explaining all that you'd need to know. This guide included information regarding what days and times are best to shop, what kinds of crowds you'd be running into and where to score the free samples. It also included a layout of the store and offered several strategies (which had been observed over time) as to how to make your visit as pleasurable, comfortable and efficient as possible. Would you have taken the time to read or even glance at this first? I sure would have.

Here's My Solution

I may not be able to tell you what to do but at least I'll be able to tell you what to expect. So What Have You Got To Lose is a project I have yet to begin as I will seek to learn everything there is to know about the gym. To provide the level of service and information I strive for I need to commit myself 100% but, unfortunately, I am unable to do so without your help. By contributing to my campaign you will be allowing me to leave my full time job while I make going to the gym my job, my office, my life. I plan to spend 9 months (equivalent to the time it takes to birth a child) immersing myself in this project as I study the atmosphere, people, trends and policies within four very different health club settings. My time will be divided between a basic $10 a month gym, LA Fitness (a middle of the line health center), Anytime Fitness (a 24 hour key card entry club) and Lifetime Fitness (a fully staffed 24 hour club). I will spend months visiting these clubs during every operating hour taking notes and making observations on everyone and everything that goes down. I will then use these notes and experiences (trust me some funny stuff happens at the gym) to put together my book So What Have You Got To Lose.

But I Can't Do It Alone

I plan on pouring my heart and soul into this book and hope to deliver something that is not only informative but greatly entertaining as well. If you've ever felt lost in your life or longed for an opportunity to follow your dreams then you know how I'm feeling right about now. I want, more than anything, to pull myself out of my 8-5 rut and fulfill not one but two of my lifelong goals. Number one is to get healthy and stay healthy! Number two is to write my own book. If I don't find the time to do these two things now, while I have the opportunity, I'm afraid I never will. Other than my student loans I am free of obligation (no kids, rent or car payments) and therefore I'm aware that its either now or never. Your support is not something that will be taken for granted. For every level of support I have offered to "pay it forward" in some manner. Whether that means donating homemade cards to Love Letters: Random Cards of Kindess, Inc. or donating a sheep via heifer.org. I know there is a market out there for this type of product (after all we are the second fattest country in the world) therefore I feel that with the right momentum I can reach my goal of $20,000. It may seem a bit ambitious but I have faith that it can be done. If, on the off chance I exceed this goal, I will take that extra money and it will be divided as such. 80% will go directly towards paying down my student debt while the remaining 20% will be split between two worthy, yet lesser known, charities. Feed My Starving Children which is a nonprofit organization that packages and ships food to starving countries. Effectively passing 92% of donations into the food program and helping millions worldwide. And Back On My Feet Chicago, a nonprofit organization which uses running to help those experiencing homelessness change the way they see themselves so they can make real changes in their lives.

How You Will Be Helping Me & Where Your Money Will Go

I won't leave my current job or start off on this venture (assuming I get fully funded) until after I have acquired a part time flexible hour job to support my personal expenses (ie food, entertainment, cell phone and misc). However, assuming I meet my goal, the money that I receive will be spent in the following manner:

Gym Memberships (Joining Fees $273 + $147 per month x 9) $1,596

Writing courses at ECC (4 online classes at $109 each) $$436

Book Expenses (estimated) $4,000  

Misc. (Charitable donations, postage, incentive gift card) $2,000   

Student Loans ($777 per month x 9 months) $7,000

Health Insurance $4,000   

A more detailed breakdown can be found here but that brings us to a grand total of $19,032.00 before any other fees incurred just for using IndieGoGo.

If I do not meet my full goal I will use the funds received to, at a minimum, join each of these four fitness centers and take the four online writing classes to hone my skills before putting out a smaller scale ebook based on whatever Intel I am able to collect. Without a completely free schedule I’m afraid I won’t be able to invest the time necessary to answer EVERY question but will try to search out answers to as many as humanly possible. To do so I may need to rely on witness accounts and interviews with others to collect information not available to me personally.

The Gift You Will Be Giving Me

While the goal of this project is to write a book answering every question you or I have ever had regarding the gym, the ultimate perk will be the gift you have given me. This is much more than a book or a project to me, this is the opportunity to change my life. I realize that it may be difficult for you to invest in someone you don't personally know but I promise you I will not let you down. I can't. Not after you have given me this renewed sense purpose in my life. Getting healthy and writing this book are the only two things that can save me from a life of unsatisfying and unfulfilling office work. It doesn't matter that I will most likely end up back in a 9-5 office job at the completion of this project, because, even if I do, I'll have accomplished something great. I will have fulfilled a lifelong dream and I'll have done it before the age of 30. It is an experience and an opportunity that will never again be available to me. It is now or never.

Share The Love

I appreciate anyone who has made it this far. While I hope you click on over and make a donation I understand if you can't. Just because you do not have the means to contribute to my project does not mean you can't help. If you know anybody that might find this book interesting or useful then the best thing you can do is LET THEM KNOW. Just by spreading the word you will have done so much. Just spread the word. If not for me then perhaps for one of the charities mentioned in this post or perks. Maybe you've never heard of Heifer, Food For The Poor, Save The Children, Outreach International, Heartland Alliance, World Vision, Food For The Poor, Alt Gifts, Mercy Corps, Love Letters: Random Cards of Kindness, Inc, Feed My Starving Children or Back on My Feet and now you have. If at some point in the future you find yourself in a position where you do have the means to donate to something, remember these organizations. You can also follow me on twitter @JessikaVWood and for each new follower I receive I create and donate a card to Love Letters: Random Cards of Kindness! You can also keep in touch via email at jessika.v.wood@gmail.com with any words of wisdom, questions you'd like to see answered, or stories you think might be worth sharing in a section of the book.

Final Thoughts

What do you want to know?! Here is an idea of my starting points but I am open to any and all suggestions. Feel free to contact me with any ideas. I'm serious. You want to know what happens if you let one rip in yoga? I'll give it a shot. I'm here to please you so don't be afraid to ask even the most ridiculous of questions!

A confirmation of all donations will be posted publicly on my blog and on this site for all to see.

Thank You, Thank You, Thank You

story:
Our Story

    I've been troubled for a very long time about the obsession our country has about being Number One.


    For politicians across the political spectrum making sure this country is Number One is a mantra that is hard-wired. Either because "God" divined it as so, or for some other reason, the U.S.  is hailed as "exceptional". It is a deep, article of faith across the nation--even if there is unease these days about where the country stands.


    This book that will argue that we don't need to be Number One--especially in the areas we traditionally strive to be the top-dog: economic might and military superiority.


    It's a book that will be used to start a movement to counter the "We're Number One" ethos.


    The pursuit to be Number One leads us into wasting a tremendous amount of money on poor economic decisions and unwise foreign adventurism. The “We’re Number One” chant alienates governments and people around the world.


    And the "We're Number One" ethos distracts us from confronting the real challenges we face: how the wealth of our country, and the wealth of the planet, is flowing into the hands of a few rich people, while our planet collapses environmentally.


    The  truth is that, by many measures, this country is not Number One. We rank far down the list in providing basic social services for our people, for example.


   And, in the places where the United States is Number One, we often have nothing to be proud of. For example, we have the largest prison population in the world and spend 7 times the amount of money on the military than any other country.


   I think focusing now on the question of being Number One is perfect timing. We are seeing an increase in the obsession over being Number One precisely at a time of increasing signs of the decline of the country. The 2012 election season is already filling up with political rhetoric about the need to remain Number One. China’s economy is growing and its influence is expanding, and other countries around the world are seizing the leadership over “green” technologies.


   Even the president, in a valiant effort to confront the jobs' crisis in America, fell back on to these themes in his most recent address to Congress:


“That's how America can be number one again. That's how America will be number one again.”

“And it has been the drive and initiative of our workers and entrepreneurs that has made this economy the engine and envy of the world.”

“Let's get to work, and show the world once again why the United States of America remains the greatest nation on Earth.”

    Last point: you cannot seriously deal with the question of climate change without acknowledging that the very pursuit of being Number One has hurt the planet because it requires using up even more scarce resources to maintain the top-dog billing.


  Why an E-Book?


   Two reasons. I want to get this out in time for the 2012 election season--which is faster than the traditional publishing industry is capable of doing. And I don't want to delay by trying to convince the traditional publishing industry that the book is worthwhile.


  Funds Will Be Used:


1. To pay for time for me to write the book, and related research costs.


2. Initially, the book will be published solely as an e-book. So, I will hire a designer and tech wiz (perhaps, the same person) to create a feel for the book and do all the technological work needed to make the work available on in all the e-formats—similar to the process I used for my first e-book, “It's Not Raining, We're Getting Peed On: the Scam of the Deficit Crisis”.


3. ORGANIZING. Once the public is published, it will be used to try to urge leaders and regular people to embrace a philosophy that being Number One should not be an obsession.


The Impact

I hope that the campaign will ignite a movement that encourages our country to downplay the idea of "winning" over other countries, in favor of a strategy that understands that our country can be a leader even if it isn't Number One.


What We Need & What You Get

3. ORGANIZING. Once the public is published, it will be used to try to urge leaders and regular people to embrace a philosophy that being Number One should not be an obsession.

You get: a better world and...Check out the perks for other great stuff!

Other Ways You Can Help

Definitely spread the word through your lists, tweets and other social media!

story:
"The Occupy Wall Street Poetry Anthology is the most important anthology of the 21st Century."
- Frank Sherlock, Poet

"THIS ANTHOLOGY IS ONE OF THE MOST IMPORTANT FUCKING DOCUMENTS AROUND!"

-CA Conrad, Poet

WHAT'S THE OWS POETRY ANTHOLOGY?!

The OWS Poetry Anthology was born the second week of the Occupy Wall Street Poetry Assembly. The anthology consists of 721 poems, 4 poetic introductions, 448 poets (140 women, 275 men, 34 androgynous) and poems in English, French, Spanish, Italian, Russian, Urdu, German, Japanese, Chinese and Dutch. I was so overwhelmed by the diversity and greatness of the poems presented during the first week of the Assembly, that I knew the assembly must be archived. So at the second Poetry Assembly I asked the poets gathered if I could archive it, then I gave out my email, expecting only a few poems to show up in my inbox. The response was overwhelming, and in the weeks that followed, I received a steady stream of poems from people all over the world. It seemed everyone that had been struck by the Occupy Movement had something to say, and an open Poetry Anthology, that was open to all voices and all types of "poetry" seemed like the appropriate way of archiving the inclusive spirit of Occupy Wall Street.

Many names have contributed to the anthology, some of which you may know: the visual artist Molly Crabapple did the cover art and some of the more prominent poets that contributed are Adrienne Rich, Eileen Myles, Ngoma Hill, the Allen Ginsberg Society on behalf of Allen, Wanda Coleman, CA Conrad, Dodie Bellamy, Kevin Killian, Charles Bernstein, Eliot Katz, Michael McClure, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Bob Holman, Lee Ann Brown, Anne Waldman, Puma Pearl, Danny Schechter, Stuart Leonard, Filip Marinovich, Ariana Reines, Frank Sherlock, and many many more...

The money donated to this project will allow for the OWS Poetry Anthology to be printed and given away to a lot of people. The more money the project receives, the more copies we will be able to print. The anthology has been open to anyone to send in poems of any size and definition since early October 2011. It's over a thousand Microsoft Word pages. It's probably the lengthiest, most inclusive text the Occupy Wall Street movement has yet produced and its a direct reflection of the SOUL of the movement. On April 14th, the Jefferson Market Library in Manhattan will be hosting the OWS Poetry Anthology community for an afternoon of open readings, where anyone can come and join and read a poem. To mark the occasion, we will be presenting the library with the first book print copy of the anthology for them to have on record. Also the money will go towards shipping and storage fees. Here's a basic example of the breakdown of the numbers: if we get forty about thirty will go to printing and then ten will go toward shipping/storage/getting them into the hands of people. If you want to see a more serious breakdown of the numbers, contact me and I can show you what I'm working with.

The Anthology is over a thousand pages, it's a very big book. It's like the predecessor to A People's History of the United States, it offers real voices, and an inclusivety unavailable in the publishing world... Originally I was going to ask for $50,000.00 as it's going to be expensive to print this book and ship it. But in the interest of just getting copies into the world, I figured it was safer to shoot for $30,000.00. However, if the goal is met, and more money comes in, that will mean more copies can be printed. The more copies printed, the more people will be able to own it and the more special collections we will be able to get it into. By the time this project is completed, the NY Public Library and Poet's House in NYC will already have copies in their collections. I'd like to get this important record into as many public collections as possible.

 

WHY A CAMPAIGN?!

For the past few months I've been trying to persuade publishers to print the book in its entirety but it seems the values of this book do not mesh with the values of a publishing company, as we would like for this book to be given out to people freely and we would prefer not exclude any poets nor poems from its pages. So it seems the only way to keep the book, in all its magick, is to print it ourselves and to bring it to the people ourselves, and to read from its pages ourselves. This book is a radical departure from the traditional structure of the "anthology", most anthologies are very selective, while this collection seeks to welcome all forms of poetry and engages in experiments like placing a famous poets poet next to a never before heard poet. What happens when you don't exclude an idea and you let everyone encounter the idea? What happens when you print thousands of copies of a book of poetry and GIVE IT AWAY FREE?!

The poems that have comprised this anthology are poems from the soul, poems demanding a new world, poems begging that the recession end, poems from hysterical and starving peers, even poems from the 1% ready to argue against Occupy Wall Street, there are poems from the world over that is standing up virtually naked at the feet of a corporate beast, a war of David versus Goliath scope, and the people that have assembled and added to the OWS Anthology are ready to speak out against the atrocities destroying our Earth, fight back and create a future that can beget a future.

Once the books are printed, they will regularly be available for pick up with the Peoples Library at UnOppressive NonImperialist Bargain Books. Copies of the anthology will also be shipped to Occupations all over the world, and it's my goal to get a copy of the anthology into every major library system in the world. In this way, by trying to get the anthology into as many individual hands as well as public collections, the anthology will have a safe place to continue to tell the tales of this movement and moment in time.

I read from and spoke about the Anthology on the progressive radio station WBAI a little while back, you can listen to that program here. The Anthology has received a lot of press, from independent press to the Nation to the Wall Street Journal. So if you're interested and unfamiliar with this project, search around the internet and you will find a lot of information about what we've been doing!

 

CAMPAIGN BREAKDOWN:

The anthology isn't finalized yet, so we aren't quite sure the cost of each book. Estimated costs are $12-40 depending on quality. Quality will be determined by the amount of money raised and will consider how many we can print. We want to put out a lasting, quality book... ideally.

$50 donations ensure 1 maybe 2 copies will be printed

 $100 donations ensures 2 or 3 or 4 copies are printed.

You get the idea.... Most importantly, we need everyone to spread the campaign to their community and social network. It's important not just to help raise funding, but also to raise awareness about this unique and amazing document. If 400 people donated $100 we'd reach our target, if 1600 people donated $25 we'd reach our target. To take this document and print it and distribute it, is totally worthwhile and reachable goal.

 

INTERVIEWS REGARDING THE CAMPAIGN:

Hyper Allergic

Huffington Post

Poetry Foundation

San Francisco Center for the Book

Poetry In Lotion

Reality Sandwich

 

CASH DONATIONS?!

A number of people have asked if they can make cash donations, to do so please contact me and we can arrange for that to happen. The reason we aren't using paypal: my account was shut down last fall when paypal somehow discovered I was working with the Occupy Movement. I've since learned they have a history of barring users that associate themselves with political action. To everyone that would like to make a cash donation: I will donate the money to the campaign through my bank account and link your name if you wish to be public about your donation. If not, it will go anonymously. Either way, I'd prefer to keep all printing donations lumped together to ensure it's used properly. And to get in contact with me, simply email: stephenjboyer@gmail(DOT)com.

 

IN CLOSING:

This campaign offers contributors the chance to take part in a historic publishing venture, as this project is open to you to contribute a poem or help print. And by raising funds to print the anthology, we will be able to distribute it freely. So we are creating a book open to all for all. All poems should be sent to stephenjboyer(AT)gmail.com Hear the rumbling in the street? Be the noise! Thank you!

story:
So, Your Contribution Will Support...

My trip to Texas! My name is Kayla. I'm a 20 year old poet from Middletown, New York. I'm a Sociology major at SUNY Orange working towards a Bachelor's Degree. I started slamming in December, 2012.
As a member of the Suffern Slam Society in Suffern,  I began participating in monthly slams held on the first Saturday of every month.
In January, I was selected by a majority audience vote to compete at the Women of the World Poetry Slam (WoWPS) in Austin, Texas from March 19-22!

However,  I'm in need of a little economic boost in helping to reach my goal and afford this opportunity...

Which Is Where You Come In!

I'm a poet and a college student...neither of those things pay too well...

Your donation will help get me to and from Austin, Texas, and put a pillow under my head for 4 nights.
The perks are cool, too! A donation of $5 gets you a personalized haiku card. $10 gets you a chapbook, $20 gets you both, and a donation of $35 or higher, I'll come to your house, your friend's house, your dog's house, your place of work, etc. and perform live poetry for you! Everything will help me reach my goal, but if you can't donate any money, there are...

...Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people can't spare the change. That's fine! Here's what you can do:

  • Get the word out! Share this on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, WHATEVER!
  • You can Copy and Paste the Link, OR share directly from Indiegogo!

And that’s all, lads, gents, peeps and lassies! Thank you!

Also, you can find a sample recording of my poems here:
https://soundcloud.com/koi-poems/missing-your-g...

story:
My Name is Rocky J. Dewyer, I grew up living all across the Americas from Alaska to Mexico, California, to Mi.  and in my travels have searched the keys of life and humanity.  I have dabbled in different religious groups and understandings of new age living, from the traditional organic nature experience to the more complex higher vibration of living and new age movements.  I was raised Christian and grew up with the bible and its beliefs. As an adult I have found religion a barrier in bringing humanity together. I have since been looking for the link that can unite all people and connect each other to a better way of life; free of biased religious titles and united by their common ground beliefs.

     The children's book series that I have written covers both spirituality, and science. Bringing together many different beliefs of religion and mythology through subtle informative text encompassing  the creation of life.  This series even though fantasy bases itself on science facts while pushing the imagination towards mystical ideas and fairytales.  Unifying all forms of existence in a place of peace and friendship through the aid of metaphysical concepts, scientific principals and basic hierarchies of life.

     Those who choose to contribute to this fund will have the chance of helping bringing our children's minds to a higher state of awareness, while not sacrificing their lifestyle through dogmatic religious beliefs.  As an investor you will be participating in the ground roots of creating a harmonic way of living and belief system by story telling, that will give children a chance to view the world through balance and unity without rival and competition.  Instead of Harry Potter and the battle of light and dark we have the unity and union of the two.  The complexity of this union is brought down to simplicity and uses examples of science that will be used throughout their life in school and career. With an imprint and understanding of how to utilize these principals and ideas from a place where all things come together through friendship.


     As a writer I am working through a publisher called Mascot Books.  The costs of publishing the first book are based off these hard facts.

Illustration cost of $2,000.00 per 24 pages.

Ebook cost of $390.00

Website Development of $1,000.00

Video Trailer cost of $390.00

Book Print/Publishing is $3.68 per book with a minimum order of 1,000 books.

Publishing the books program includes:

      1. Review manuscript and provide editorial evaluation.

      2. Per form customized layout and graphic design.

      3. After Client approval received, print number of books indicated above and convert to eBook format (if selected).

      4. Complete copyright registration form and deliver to Client for submission.

      5. Obtain Book’s ISBN number, barcode, and Library of Congress Control Number.

      6. Create standard book page on www.mascotbooks.com and set up social media presence (Facebook and Twitter, if requested).

      7. Draft press release, create electronic promotional flyer, and book order form.

      8. Register book with R.R. Bowker, Ingram, Baker & Taylor, American Wholesale Book Company (Books-a-Million), Follett, and Partners Book Distributing, and online at www.bn.com,

        www.booksamillion.com, and www.amazon.com.

      9. Ship printed copies to Mascot’s distribution center and to Client.

      10. Fulfill online orders received on www.mascotbooks.com.

      11. Fulfill orders received from distributors/retailers and invoice customers.

     Any funds received will go towards the illustration and book print and publishing.  Should the funds not reach my specified goal I will personally be supplementing these costs with my own income. 


     Through your help as an investor you will be participating in the creation of a story of friendship that can reach the masses. A NEW, REVOLUTIONARY BOOK ON SPANISH GUITAR STRUMMING TECHNIQUES

Have you ever wanted to learn the secrets of playing Spanish style guitar? Do you have the urge to play the guitar in a fast, rhythmic, and percussive way that excites and ignites an audience? Have you ever wanted to master the rumba, the flamenco triplet or the rasgueado? Now you can!

The SpanishStrumBook contains 19 different lessons with over 150 exercises and illustrations to teach you different Spanish guitar strumming styles.

Each technique is described with easy, step-by-step explanations, tips and exercises to enable you to master and play it at the ideal tempo. All of the musical examples are transcribed in both standard musical notation and tablature, with accompanying chord diagrams.

The GuitarPro files will also be available for you if you prefer to learn the music with that music sheet/tablature software.

The book is suitable for beginners or more advanced guitarists who wish to improve their rhythm skills or learn more about the Spanish guitar strumming techniques.

You will learn some music theory during the first six lessons, such as how to read guitar tablature (TAB), how to notate rhythm, and the construction of the basic chords, including the major, minor and seventh chords. Each of these lessons contains a quiz to challenge your new-found knowledge and to ensure that you absorb the material as you proceed through the book.

 You can also learn the following techniques from the SpanishStrumBook:

  • Basic rumba technique
  • Rumba technique variations
  • Pulgar
  • Flamenco triplet
  • Adding the hit to the flamenco triplet
  • Golpe strumming
  • Rasgueado
  • Muted rasgueado
  • Rasgueado variations
  • Hammer-on and Pull-off
  • Tango with rasgueado
  • Alzapua as a strumming technique
  • Drumming techniques

This book is a collaboration between Edina Balczo (HU, author) and two other guitarists: Ron Celano (USA, editor) and Mark Wheeler (CAN, editor). The idea was conceived in February 2017, and the finished manuscript was produced collaboratively over the following 10 months, ending in December 2017.

Edina Balczo is an UK based guitarist who hosts a popular YouTube channel, The Spanish Guitar Hub, with 9 million views and 37,000 subscribers. She is endorsed by GuitarPro, the originator of the GuitarPro tablature editor software, and has performed in major festivals and events in the UK and internationally, including the Glastonbury festival, Sziget festival (HU), and at events for Green Peace, Google, the Commonwealth Nations Ceremony awards among others.

A wide variety of guitar instruction books are available which describe different styles of playing, music theory, soloing, jazz and improvisation, flamenco, fingerpicking and strumming techniques on steel string guitar. However, there are not many (or any) dedicated to Spanish guitar strumming techniques, so this book will be unique, revolutionary and a PIONEER of its kind!

Edina Balczo has been producing YouTube guitar lesson videos since 2007. Some of these videos have gone viral and have attracted world-wide attention among guitar students eager to learn the techniques she demonstrates. This book and the accompanying video lessons, which will include clear textual descriptions and professionally-produced video demonstrations of each technique, will be an invaluable resource for anyone interested in mastering the Spanish guitar style.

Some of her guitar lessons:

Preorder your copy of the Spanish Guitar Strumming Techniques now, so we can have a budget to release it worldwide, film the video lessons professionally and overall spread awareness of Spanish guitar music.

story:
Story for your book:

Striking Gold: How Gen Z's are set to thrive in the changing entrepreneurial environment.

My name is Carson Schutter and I am the author of Striking Gold. I wrote this book because as a Gen Z, I wanted a specific resource to help my peers and me succeed.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how the world of entrepreneurship is changing, why Gen Z's will succeed, and how they will do it. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover your passion and work towards achieving it.

In this book, you'll learn about Gen Z's and the new, shifting world of entrepreneurs:
  • Gen Z - How the generation born after 1995 is different than those before it, why they are set to be the least entrepreneurial group on record, and what must happen to change that.
  • Changing Climate - How the business world is changing through technologies, methodologies, and the new way of working.
  • Practical Skills - I want to give you practical skills to help you succeed in the world of entrepreneurship. Regardless of whether or not you are a Gen Z yourself, these skills will help you be able to follow your passion.
You will love this book if you are hoping to change your career path, young and unsure what to do, or interested in reading about future trends in the business world.

Striking Gold is a non-fiction book that speaks to Gen Z's and entrepreneurial-minded people who are looking to pursue their passions through entrepreneurship and learn new, useful skills for the first time.

The Book - Striking Gold


The book is written in 3 Parts....
  • Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-3. You will learn about who Gen Z's are and how the world is changing around them. You will see why this generation is going to be the least entrepreneurial, how technology and the business world are changing, and why Gen Z's might be in a perfect spot to pounce on these new opportunities. I also want to tell you why I call this book Striking Gold and elaborate on just how powerful following your passions can be in transforming your life.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 4-6. In this part, I reveal my three key skills you need to learn to be successful in the entrepreneurial world or to follow your passion. I interviewed several famous and successful entrepreneurs and boiled down their advice to three easy-to-follow instructions that you can begin today.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 7 & 8. In the last part of the book I will teach you how to succeed and what's next for Gen Z's and entrepreneurship in general, and inspire you to pursue your passion. In essence, this last part is all about a call to action, and giving you specific ways you can implement the skills I taught.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2019

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book: Physical Copy, Ebook Formats

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

A personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author


Carson Schutter is the founder of SleepSurf LLC, an award-winning student run startup that provides short-term accommodations for students spending the night at different colleges. He also serves as the Director of the Georgetown Ventures LaunchPad program, a student-run incubator that helps students take their businesses from the idea-stage to a Minimum Viable Product. He has also worked with the Creator Institute and New Degree Press as a growth strategist and product manager, and has personally worked with over 75 published authors.

Carson is passionate about entrepreneurship and has gotten his hands on as much over the course of his life. He wanted to write this book to inspire other Gen Z's to pursue a career in entrepreneurship, as Gen Z's are the least entrepreneurial generation. Carson provides specific skills and tools that he has gathered to inspire the next generation of entrepreneurs.

Outside of entrepreneurship, Carson enjoys sock collecting, having personally built a collection of over 150 pairs.

For more information you can connect with Carson at cms436@georgetown.edu and @carsonschutter.


Risks & Challenges


The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #StrikingGold and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Carson Schutter

story:
Short Summary

Alie has both Complex PTSD and acute PTSD from ongoing and situational trauma that occurred throughout her formative years and in young adulthood. Despite flashbacks, night terrors, dissociation, and paralyzing fear, Alie managed to graduate from college and earn a Master's and PhD, and is currently working as a research scientist. She has spent the last six years in therapy working on reintegrating the trauma that caused PTSD. She currently struggles with flashbacks, night terrors, and high levels of fear. A PTSD service dog will help Alie to stay grounded in the present moment, calm down after night terrors, and feel more at ease entering social situations and new environments. 

What We Need & What You Get

Training a PTSD service dog from the organization chosen costs $8500, with an additional cost of the dog ($3000), traveling to meet and train with the dog, and care for the service dog, totaling $12,000. All money, no matter how much is raised, will be put towards paying for training of the service dog. 

The Impact

Alie works incredibly hard every day to fight the effects of PTSD. The challenges arise daily. Because of this, Alie's life is often filled with fear and hesitance about going places (even the grocery store), going to sleep, and sometimes, even leaving her curled up position on her kitchen floor. A PTSD service dog will allow Alie to live a freer, fuller life; one that is not dictated by the fears and flashbacks of her PTSD. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Words of support, prayers, good vibes, and spreading the word are all greatly appreciated.

story:
El libro presenta un profundo análisis personal y académico, resultado de décadas de investigación y docencia en la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén y en Yad Vashem, sobre diversos temas esenciales referentes a la Shoá, que raramente son tratados en libros en castellano. Por ejemplo: la Shoá en la perspectiva de otros genocidios, el lugar de la mujer en la Shoá, análisis de las interpretaciones en el Pensamiento Judío, la Shoá y el establecimiento del Estado de Israel.

Títulos de algunos capítulos:
¿Qué es el Holocausto?; ¿Es posible explicar el Holocausto?; Comparación con otros genocidios; Resistencia judía: ¿Mito o realidad?; Resistencia sin armas y otras respuestas; La cuestión del género: el caso de Gisi Fleischman; Teología, o Dios el cirujano; Intentos de salvamento: el caso de los Protocolos de Auschwitz; Del Holocausto al Estado de Israel. APÉNDICE: discurso dado por el Prof. Yehuda Bauer ante el Bundestag – Parlamento Alemán, el 27 de enero de 1998, Día Internacional de Conmemoración del Holocausto.

Estos aspectos pueden ser de gran interés para un amplio público que se siente atraído por esta diversidad de temas con trascendencia también en el presente.

PUBLICACIÓN:
Fin de octubre de 2013; edición con tapa dura.

 PATROCINIO INSTITUCIONAL:
Yad Vashem, Jerusalén.
y
Centro Internacional para la Ensañanza Universitaria de la Civilización Judía de la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén.

 NECESIDAD:
Vuestra colaboración para cubrir el último tramo en los gastos de producción:
11.000 shk (3.000 dólares).

 CÓMO:
- una compra anticipada de Reflexiones sobre el Holocausto o compra junto con            otro de mis libros, con un descuento en el precio del 30%,
o
- un aporte en dinero.

RETRIBUCIÓN POR LA COLABORACIÓN:
Envío de los libros por correo a domicilio según la tabla adjunta. Para
colaboraciones del exterior  (fuera de Israel) los gastos de envío por correo aéreo están incluídos.
Los libros se enviarán aun si no se llega a la meta prefijada.
Conferencia (Solamente en Israel).

 TRAYECTORIA PERSONAL:
El Prof. Yehuda Bauer es uno de los principales investigadores sobre el Holocausto en el mundo. En más de medio siglo de fructífera labor como investigador y educador en la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén y en diversas universidades del mundo como
Brandeis, Jewish Thelogical Seminary, Yale, Hawai y UCLA, tuvo una prolífica
producción de decenas de libros y centenas de artículos académicos, y formó
generaciones de educadores e investigadores. Fue director del Instituto de
Investigación del Holocausto en Yad Vashem y continúa siendo asesor académico
de esta institución. Asimismo fue galardonado con el Premio Israel y es miembro
de la Academia Nacional de Ciencias de Israel.

Efraim Zadoff es Doctor en Historia de la Educación Judía, Universidad de Tel Aviv. Investigador asociado del Centro Liwerant de la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén. Fundador de E.D.Z. Nativ Ediciones, para la edición de libros en castellano sobre temas de la cultura y la historia del pueblo judío.
Escritor, traductor y editor.
Rabino laico humanista.

story_txt:
El libro presenta un profundo análisis personal y académico, resultado de décadas de investigación y docencia en la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén y en Yad Vashem, sobre diversos temas esenciales referentes a la Shoá, que raramente son tratados en libros en castellano. Por ejemplo: la Shoá en la perspectiva de otros genocidios, el lugar de la mujer en la Shoá, análisis de las interpretaciones en el Pensamiento Judío, la Shoá y el establecimiento del Estado de Israel. Títulos de algunos capítulos:¿Qué es el Holocausto?; ¿Es posible explicar el Holocausto?; Comparación con otros genocidios; Resistencia judía: ¿Mito o realidad?; Resistencia sin armas y otras respuestas; La cuestión del género: el caso de Gisi Fleischman; Teología, o Dios el cirujano; Intentos de salvamento: el caso de los Protocolos de Auschwitz; Del Holocausto al Estado de Israel. APÉNDICE: discurso dado por el Prof. Yehuda Bauer ante el Bundestag – Parlamento Alemán, el 27 de enero de 1998, Día Internacional de Conmemoración del Holocausto.
Estos aspectos pueden ser de gran interés para un amplio público que se siente atraído por esta diversidad de temas con trascendencia también en el presente.
PUBLICACIÓN:Fin de octubre de 2013; edición con tapa dura. 
 PATROCINIO INSTITUCIONAL:Yad Vashem, Jerusalén.yCentro Internacional para la Ensañanza Universitaria de la Civilización Judía de la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén.
 NECESIDAD:Vuestra colaboración para cubrir el último tramo en los gastos de producción:11.000 shk (3.000 dólares).
 CÓMO:- una compra anticipada de Reflexiones sobre el Holocausto o compra junto con            otro de mis libros, con un descuento en el precio del 30%,o- un aporte en dinero. 
RETRIBUCIÓN POR LA COLABORACIÓN:Envío de los libros por correo a domicilio según la tabla adjunta. Paracolaboraciones del exterior  (fuera de Israel) los gastos de envío por correo aéreo están incluídos.Los libros se enviarán aun si no se llega a la meta prefijada.Conferencia (Solamente en Israel).
 TRAYECTORIA PERSONAL: El Prof. Yehuda Bauer es uno de los principales investigadores sobre el Holocausto en el mundo. En más de medio siglo de fructífera labor como investigador y educador en la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén y en diversas universidades del mundo comoBrandeis, Jewish Thelogical Seminary, Yale, Hawai y UCLA, tuvo una prolíficaproducción de decenas de libros y centenas de artículos académicos, y formógeneraciones de educadores e investigadores. Fue director del Instituto deInvestigación del Holocausto en Yad Vashem y continúa siendo asesor académicode esta institución. Asimismo fue galardonado con el Premio Israel y es miembrode la Academia Nacional de Ciencias de Israel.
Efraim Zadoff es Doctor en Historia de la Educación Judía, Universidad de Tel Aviv. Investigador asociado del Centro Liwerant de la Universidad Hebrea de Jerusalén. Fundador de E.D.Z. Nativ Ediciones, para la edición de libros en castellano sobre temas de la cultura y la historia del pueblo judío.Escritor, traductor y editor.Rabino laico humanista.e-mail: zadoff@zahav.net.il  ;  tel.: 972 50 7393887

story:
Short Summary

As I mentioned in the above video, there is a very personal association to Romania that has permeated my family. Being presented with this opportunity to really tell a story and to put that story against the backdrop of music is so mind blowing. I have played the cello for 18 years, and I have had so many wonderful opportunities, but none compare to this. I want to create art, and I want to be able to experience facets of my life that were previously closed to me.

What I Need & What You Get

I need $2000 in 2 weeks. I know it seems insane! But I like to think that all good things are at least a little bit insane. This will specifically go toward funding all of my travel expenses. I am only asking for this because this is what I need immediately, and when it comes to producing my work, I will accomplish it no matter what. So really this is the bare minimum! 

What I will be giving you in return is writing, photography, letters, music, a glimpse into another person's perspective, and hopefully a little dash of beauty. It will take me 9 months to put together all of the content as well as bind all of the books, just to be up front about time frame from the get go. Be sure to check out the perks!

The Impact

First and foremost, you will change my life forever! That is pretty cool, right?! You have so much power right now! Second, I will be given the opportunity to really contribute something tangible to my community and the world. I personally believe that my craft, in whatever iteration it happens to take, is the best way for me to impact the world around me. It is so much a part of me that I believe it is the only thing I can do. You would be helping me not only in this one instance, but also in bolstering me for my life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not all of you can contribute, but that is okay! Please share this on facebook, twitter, Google+, etc. and get the word out! You can also use the indiegogo tools to share this campaign with your followers. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at my campaign. I appreciate you!

story:
My name is Debra Pays-Welburn and I have just finished writing my debut novel (yay!). Most of you reading this already know the story, and I am relaunching the project after the first attempt fell short of my demanding goal.  So I am now going for the money to complete the first edit of the manuscript (I've found a wonderful editor to work with) as well as a custom cover design and production costs to fulfill my pledges. 

I am still going to set up Posh Totty Publications, a support network for women of a certain age! Website, distribution etc. will all come later, but this is the first and most crucial step.

I have joined a writing support group whom I hope will be able to guide me through the second edit, ensuring I get the book into shape enough for my first publication. 

How do you know I will complete this project? 

Well, the book is written and just needs the final polish. And this is the first of many. I hope to write one book a year for the next 10 years and this is the start I need to help me on my way. With your help, I really can complete this project.

The money I raise here will go towards:

Initial editing and proof-reading of the manuscript to get it print ready and eBook formatted

Custom designing cover and interior

Print paperback and hardback copies of book for rewards 

Establishing Posh Totty Publications

Destination Forgiveness:  An Excerpt:

My birthday morning offered sunshine and some early spring warmth and I had a bounce in my step.  Tomorrow I was going to celebrate with Molly, Grace and the family.  Pop was doing one of his legendary legs of lamb.  But today Sophie was taking me to The Dining Room and I was excited.  From the glass of champagne and canapés upon arrival to the 5 courses, each one a surprise and always exquisite, it was a rare treat and my outfit for the evening was painstakingly chosen and already laid out.  My little black dress, the mainstay of every woman’s wardrobe, had been spiced up with a bright red cinch belt and my converse sneakers had been replaced by a pair of brand new, bright red court shoes with a 2 inch heel.   No androgynous looking grunge fashion for me tonight.

Sophie arrived at seven and came in to see the girls while we waited for our taxi. She had organised everything.

When she saw Molly and Grace, I saw her eyes mist up, the year since their last meeting measured by their natural changes.

“My how you’ve grown.” She shook her head in disbelief. “ Hug me, now.”  They ran to their godmother and threw their arms around her.  “My god you both get more beautiful every time I see you.  Are we sure I’m not your real mother?” An old joke, we all laughed anyway.

Pop arrived to get the girls.  They would sleep there tonight as we weren’t sure what time we’d be home – Sophie had hinted at a mysteriously late night so we were prepared for any eventuality.

I kissed Pop and the girls goodbye when we heard the cab slowly making its way up the gravel drive.

Sophie was very animated on the way to The Dining Room, telling me about the next assignment she’d committed to for the following week.

“I’m going to cover the ongoing siege at Waco, Texas.  You’ve heard about David Koresh, the loony leader of a Branch Davidian Sect? He thinks he’s a prophet.  It will be eye-opening I’m sure.”

I no longer watched the news, hadn’t for years.  I found I was too affected by all the bad stuff going on around the world, couldn’t compartmentalise.  Now I was happier being ignorant although possibly rather dull around a dinner table.  It was worth it. But I had heard about Waco, Kate talked about it during our last phone call.

“Kate told me that he’s a very screwed up individual which is not surprising considering his awful childhood. She said he dropped out of high school, has a penchant for teenage girls, and became a born again Christian before deciding he was the final prophet of the Branch Davidians.”

“I’m impressed” Sophie said before going on to describe the gruelling details of the siege in Texas, and before she finished the taxi pulled up outside the large front door of The Dining Room.

I got out of the cab tentatively. A short black dress and high (for me) heels are not every-day attire.  As the cab pulled away, Sophie took my arm and escorted me up the 4 stone steps to the rather grand, double front door banked by vintage stone sculptures of whippets, standing tall and proud either side of the steps. I smiled musing that whippets would be the last dog I would ever choose to guard my front door, except perhaps for shitsu’s and chiwouwous.

The front of the house was covered in a Daphne Odora, its pink and white star-shaped flowers smelling incredibly sweet. It was like walking through a thick veil of perfume and it’s aura of luxury settled around my shoulders like an alpaca shawl.

Within seconds of pulling the big, old fashioned bell pull and hearing the deep dong resonating inside, the door was opened by Rory, Maitre d’, proprietor, husband of the chef, and wine connoisseur.

“Ladies, welcome.  And Happy Birthday Alice.”  I had only met him a couple of times and was flattered he remembered my name.

“Thank you kindly.”  The crowd of people in the spacious entrance hall behind Rory suddenly went quiet.  Rory stood aside to let us into the room and as one, everybody in the hallway turned.  I stood still, couldn’t believe my eyes.  The room was full of friends, my friends, every last one.

I looked from one face to another.  Kate, my gorgeous sister, whom I’d spoken to days before in Los Angeles.  Polly, Elinor, Eric. I couldn’t see everyone, tried to take it all in, felt overwhelmed.

And suddenly everybody was rushing over throwing arms around me, happy birthday being shouted out in surround sound.  Tears started to flow as I hugged each one back, and as I tried to stop the tears from ruining my mascara, it was impossible to stem the emotional tidal wave I was feeling.  All my friends in one place, just for me.

story:
12/14/14 - A Special Note:
The situation with The Neal Cassady "Joan Anderson Letter" has changed dramatically since we launched this campaign a few weeks go. Legal action taken by the estates of both Jack Kerouac & Neal Cassady has halted the auction originally scheduled for December 17th and the document is being turned over to a court of law to allow a judge to decide on ownership and copyright issues. To the best of our knowledge a court date has not yet been set.

The legal action halting the auction leaves our Indiegogo campaign in limbo. According to Indiegogo we can not suspend or cancel a campaign once it has started. Because of these circumstances, we are committing to the following:
1). All funds eventually realized from this campaign will go into a special account that will be used for no other purpose until the disposition of the auction is determined.
2). If there is an auction in the future, we will renew our efforts to raise additional money to place a bid on and hopefully win The Joan Anderson Letter. We are still working with private funders toward this end.
3). If the court determines the legitimate ownership of the letter in a fashion that does not lead to a public auction, all funds raised in this campaign will revert to the secondary purpose originally articulated at the beginning of this campaign, i.e. to fund a future Beat Generation Conference in San Francisco.
Jerry Cimino, The Beat Museum (jerry at kerouac . com)

  • What Is the Joan Anderson Letter?
  • Why Is It Important the Beat Museum Wins This Auction?
  • Our Commitment to the Cassady Estate & to the Public at Large
  • Does the Beat Museum Really Have a Chance to Win the Auction?
  • Why Should I Participate?
  • Why Are Your Award Levels So High?
  • When Should I Expect My Rewards?
  • Will You Be Raising Money from Any Other Sources?
  • Will I Get a Refund if You Don't Win the Auction?
  • What Makes You Think You Can Raise Enough Money to Bid?
  • What if You Do Not Raise Enough Money to Bid?
  • What if the Beat Museum Does Not Win the Auction?
  • What Is the Beat Generation Annual Conference Program?
  • If the Auction Occurs on December 17th, Why Are You Running This Campaign Until January?
  • Beat Scholars Endorsing the Beat Museum Lost Letter Campaign
  • Media Coverage

What Is the Joan Anderson Letter?

Considered lost for 60 years, this is the famous letter by Neal Cassady that inspired a generation of Beat writers. It was recently found and we want to preserve it for posterity by bidding on the letter at auction in 2 weeks (Dec 17th, 2014).

These Beat Generation Scholars & Authors want to see The Joan Anderson Letter protected, exhibited to the public and published so everyone can read it. So do we. With your help we have a chance!

~"It obviously belongs in The Beat Museum." ~ Gerd Stern
~"I can't think of anywhere better... than the Beat Museum." ~ Dave Moore

~"The Joan Anderson Letter should be (at) The Beat Museum." ~ Byron Spooner

~"I encourage you to consider aiding The Beat Museum in its quest." ~ Dennis McNally
~"I fervently believe this precious resource belongs at The Beat Museum." ~ Brenda Knight
~"The Beat Museum would assure its availability and its publication as well." ~ Steve Edington
~"This artifact deserves to be shared. I hope it will become available to all.” ~ Bill Morgan
~"This letter needs a good steward. The best place is the Beat Museum." ~ Melanie Samay
~"The letter should stay in San Francisco. The Beat Museum is the place." ~ Matt Theado

* Full quotes can be seen at the bottom of the page.


Why Is It Important the Beat Museum Wins This Auction?

The world wants to read this letter. That may never happen, however, because the copyright holder may never get the opportunity to publish it. The reason is because whomever buys this letter will have sole access to the "words" on the letter and, whomever that person or organization turns out to be, they may deem it in their best interest to never allow the copyright holder access to the words! This is a very real possibility. Knowing the letter is out there, and knowing only a small handful of people have ever read the letter may have just enough allure for some potential bidders to buy it and lock it away as that might possibly make the letter appear more valuable to some people. If that were to happen it would be a great loss to the world at large, and to Beat fans and scholars specifically.


Our Commitment to the Cassady Estate & to the Public at Large

Our commitment is if The Beat Museum is the successful bidder of the Profiles in History auction for the Joan Anderson Letter, we will make the contents of the entire letter available to the copyright holder (presumably Neal & Carolyn Cassady's three children, aka The Neal Cassady Estate) free and without charge so they may exercise their copyright. The decision to publish the letter, when, and in what form, will belong to the copyright holder. The Beat Museum has already been contacted by several major publishers interested in publishing this important document and we will work with the copyright holder to whatever level they desire to ensure publication of this important document.

Jerry Cimino & John Allen Cassady during 2005 Performance

In addition, The Beat Museum commits to the Beat Generation and the scholarly community: we will make the original letter available for study and examination (as appropriate, and after it has been examined by a preservationist), as well as allowable facsimile versions to scholars, biographers and other writers in the field of Beat Literature.

Lastly, we commit we will do everything in our power to allow the public and the world at large to view and see The Neal Cassady Letter. The world deserves to see this important document.

"I got the idea for the spontaneous style of On the Road from seeing how good old Neal Cassady wrote his letters to me, all first person, fast, mad, confessional, completely serious, all detailed … The letter, the main letter I mean, was forty thousand words long, mind you, a whole short novel. It was the greatest piece of writing I ever saw, better’n anybody in America, or at least enough to make Melville, Twain, Dreiser, Wolfe, I dunno who, spin in their graves … Neal and I called it, for convenience, the Joan Anderson Letter."

-Jack Kerouac, The Paris Review

The Beat Museum Really Have a Chance to Win the Auction?

We have a saying around The Beat Museum: “You never make the shot you don’t take.” This is a once in a lifetime opportunity, and we feel we at least have to try. Yes, we are doing it on very short notice. Yes, this entire campaign is evolving and changing every day. Yes, we may very well be bidding in the company of some extremely wealthy people. But yes, we have a chance.

There is always a chance! Someone or some organization is going to win this auction on December 17th. That’s a given. And it's possible someone, who most people believe is going to win, may for whatever reason, decide to take a pass. You never know how events may transpire. All you can do is take your shot when you have it.


Why Should I Participate?

Because it’s fun!

You’re buying an experience by supporting us in this campaign. All of us here at The Beat Museum have been having the time of our lives these past two weeks. Since the day it was announced that the letter had been found it’s been electric around here. You can feel it in the air as you walk in the door. There is an excitement that is contagious. Because of this news we've seen a sharp increase in foot traffic at The Beat Museum and everyone who comes by, even people here for the first time whom we’ve never met before, pick up on the excitement quickly. It’s like the energy and spirit of Neal Cassady himself is making the rounds, transferring from person to person.

Yes, it is possible all you'll walk away with is a T-shirt or whatever perk you select, but you’ll also walk away with memories, and knowing that for a brief period of time you were a part of something bigger than yourself. You became part of a collective, you’ve joined a cadre of Beat Generation fans from around the globe who want to see this spirit live on. 


Why Are Your Award Levels So High?

We’re trying to raise an awful lot of money in a very short period of time to be competitive in this auction and this entire plan came together so fast we want to err on the side of caution. Plus, some of our perks will need to be manufactured and they will need to be packed and shipped all over the world. The Beats have a very broad appeal worldwide and while shipping a T-shirt or a book here in the United States may only cost $5, shipping that same item to other countries might cost $25 or even $35. For that reason we elected to go with the higher pricepoint to ensure all shipping costs are covered. After all, it would do us little good in trying to attain our goal of bidding on and winning the Neal Cassady Joan Anderson Letter if too high a proportion of the monies raised had to go to shipping and handling.


When Should I Expect My Rewards?

You should not expect any reward to be shipped until some time in January, possibly even February for certain items. We’ll need to coordinate book signings, get T-shirts and other perks made, packed, and shipped. There will be a lot of work on the back end to complete our commitments and obligations, but we will complete them. Just don’t tell Grandma she should be expecting her Neal Cassady shirt for Christmas!


Will You Be Raising Money from Any Other Sources?

Yes, we hope to raise other monies from private sources and donations that we will be able to add to the funds pledged through this campaign.

We also expect a significant amount to be pledged to a separate, private fund by philanthropists, celebrities and other lovers of Neal Cassady, Jack Kerouac and the Beat Generation.


Will I get a refund if you don't win the auction?

No. We're going all out to win this auction, but there is no guarantee that we'll succeed. You're purchasing an item of value, and you will receive that item whether or not we are able to bid on the auction, and whether we win the auction or not.


What Makes You Think You Can Raise Enough Money to Bid?

In 2011, the white dress Marilyn Monroe wore in the movie The Seven Year Itch was put up for auction. A group came forward to create a crowd funding campaign of Marilyn Monroe fans who raised enough money to actually bid $3,100,000 on the dress. Their bid was unsuccessful as the winning bid for the dress topped $4,600,000, but their efforts proved the model can work toward its ultimate goal.


What if You Do Not Raise Enough Money to Bid?

If we do not raise enough money to bid, then we simply cannot bid. The opening bid is $300,000 and our goal amount of $500,000 would allow us to do that, even after we factor in the buyer’s premium (commission charged by the auction house) insurance, legal fees and accounting fees.


What if the Beat Museum Does Not Win the Auction?

Even if we don't win the auction or are unable to bid for any reason out of our control, your donation will still make great things happen! We’ll put the money you and others have contributed toward launching our Beat Generation Annual Conference Program, starting in the Summer of 2015. You will still collect the prize you signed up for, and you'll know that no matter what happens, you will have contributed in helping to spread the spirit of The Beat Generation.


What Is the Beat Generation Annual Conference Program?

Some of the best times many of us have ever had relating to The Beats has been at conferences:

  • The Beat Generation Conferences at NYU in 1994 and 1995 could be called a "last gathering of the Beats," which included Allen Ginsberg, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Anne Waldman, Harold Norse, Michael McClure, Gregory Corso, and Hunter S. Thompson.
  • Lowell Celebrates Kerouac is an annual event in Lowell, Massachusetts, and includes readings, musical performances, tours of Kerouac's hometown, and appearances by Beat personalities such as David Amram.

The Beat Generation Annual Conference Program will establish a similar Beat conference in San Francisco, and will feature appearances by remaining Beats, readings, symposia, movies, music, and more! 


If the auction occurs on December 17th, why are you running this campaign until January?

From what we understand, Indiegogo does not release any funds for use until a few weeks after a campaign has ended. For this reason, it really doesn't matter when we end our 'Lost Letter' campaign on Indiegogo because the monies will not be in our hands until after the auction has completed.

On the morning of December 17th we will know exactly how much money has been pledged and this will give us an indication of how much we'll be able to bid the day of the auction. Before we actually bid one of the two following possibilities will have been prearranged so we can bid to win the auction. Either an arrangement with Profiles in History for a later payment based upon the funds that are showing in the Indiegogo account or we will have made an arrangement with one of our wealthy patrons or celebrity friends to guarantee our bid.

12/14/14 - A Special Note:The situation with The Neal Cassady "Joan Anderson Letter" has changed dramatically since we launched this campaign a few weeks go. Legal action taken by the estates of both Jack Kerouac & Neal Cassady has halted the auction originally scheduled for December 17th and the document is being turned over to a court of law to allow a judge to decide on ownership and copyright issues. To the best of our knowledge a court date has not yet been set.The legal action halting the auction leaves our Indiegogo campaign in limbo. According to Indiegogo we can not suspend or cancel a campaign once it has started. Because of these circumstances, we are committing to the following:1). All funds eventually realized from this campaign will go into a special account that will be used for no other purpose until the disposition of the auction is determined.2). If there is an auction in the future, we will renew our efforts to raise additional money to place a bid on and hopefully win The Joan Anderson Letter. We are still working with private funders toward this end.3). If the court determines the legitimate ownership of the letter in a fashion that does not lead to a public auction, all funds raised in this campaign will revert to the secondary purpose originally articulated at the beginning of this campaign, i.e. to fund a future Beat Generation Conference in San Francisco.Jerry Cimino, The Beat Museum (jerry at kerouac . com)
What Is the Joan Anderson Letter?
Why Is It Important the Beat Museum Wins This Auction?
Our Commitment to the Cassady Estate & to the Public at Large
Does the Beat Museum Really Have a Chance to Win the Auction?
Why Should I Participate?
Why Are Your Award Levels So High?

What Is the Joan Anderson Letter?
Considered lost for 60 years, this is the famous letter by Neal Cassady that inspired a generation of Beat writers. It was recently found and we want to preserve it for posterity by bidding on the letter at auction in 2 weeks (Dec 17th, 2014).These Beat Generation Scholars & Authors want to see The Joan Anderson Letter protected, exhibited to the public and published so everyone can read it. So do we. With your help we have a chance!

~"It obviously belongs in The Beat Museum." ~ Gerd Stern
~"I can't think of anywhere better... than the Beat Museum." ~ Dave Moore~"The Joan Anderson Letter should be (at) The Beat Museum." ~ Byron Spooner
~"I encourage you to consider aiding The Beat Museum in its quest." ~ Dennis McNally
~"I fervently believe this precious resource belongs at The Beat Museum." ~ Brenda Knight
~"The Beat Museum would assure its availability and its publication as well." ~ Steve Edington
~"This artifact deserves to be shared. I hope it will become available to all.” ~ Bill Morgan
~"This letter needs a good steward. The best place is the Beat Museum." ~ Melanie Samay
~"The letter should stay in San Francisco. The Beat Museum is the place." ~ Matt Theado
* Full quotes can be seen at the bottom of the page.


Why Is It Important the Beat Museum Wins This Auction?
The world wants to read this letter. That may never happen, however, because the copyright holder may never get the opportunity to publish it. The reason is because whomever buys this letter will have sole access to the "words" on the letter and, whomever that person or organization turns out to be, they may deem it in their best interest to never allow the copyright holder access to the words! This is a very real possibility. Knowing the letter is out there, and knowing only a small handful of people have ever read the letter may have just enough allure for some potential bidders to buy it and lock it away as that might possibly make the letter appear more valuable to some people. If that were to happen it would be a great loss to the world at large, and to Beat fans and scholars specifically.


Our Commitment to the Cassady Estate & to the Public at Large
Our commitment is if The Beat Museum is the successful bidder of the Profiles in History auction for the Joan Anderson Letter, we will make the contents of the entire letter available to the copyright holder (presumably Neal & Carolyn Cassady's three children, aka The Neal Cassady Estate) free and without charge so they may exercise their copyright. The decision to publish the letter, when, and in what form, will belong to the copyright holder. The Beat Museum has already been contacted by several major publishers interested in publishing this important document and we will work with the copyright holder to whatever level they desire to ensure publication of this important document.Jerry Cimino & John Allen Cassady during 2005 PerformanceIn addition, The Beat Museum commits to the Beat Generation and the scholarly community: we will make the original letter available for study and examination (as appropriate, and after it has been examined by a preservationist), as well as allowable facsimile versions to scholars, biographers and other writers in the field of Beat Literature.Lastly, we commit we will do everything in our power to allow the public and the world at large to view and see The Neal Cassady Letter. The world deserves to see this important document.

"I got the idea for the spontaneous style of On the Road from seeing how good old Neal Cassady wrote his letters to me, all first person, fast, mad, confessional, completely serious, all detailed … The letter, the main letter I mean, was forty thousand words long, mind you, a whole short novel. It was the greatest piece of writing I ever saw, better’n anybody in America, or at least enough to make Melville, Twain, Dreiser, Wolfe, I dunno who, spin in their graves … Neal and I called it, for convenience, the Joan Anderson Letter."
-Jack Kerouac, The Paris Review




The Beat Museum Really Have a Chance to Win the Auction?
We have a saying around The Beat Museum: “You never make the shot you don’t take.” This is a once in a lifetime opportunity, and we feel we at least have to try. Yes, we are doing it on very short notice. Yes, this entire campaign is evolving and changing every day. Yes, we may very well be bidding in the company of some extremely wealthy people. But yes, we have a chance.There is always a chance! Someone or some organization is going to win this auction on December 17th. That’s a given. And it's possible someone, who most people believe is going to win, may for whatever reason, decide to take a pass. You never know how events may transpire. All you can do is take your shot when you have it.


Why Should I Participate?
Because it’s fun!
You’re buying an experience by supporting us in this campaign. All of us here at The Beat Museum have been having the time of our lives these past two weeks. Since the day it was announced that the letter had been found it’s been electric around here. You can feel it in the air as you walk in the door. There is an excitement that is contagious. Because of this news we've seen a sharp increase in foot traffic at The Beat Museum and everyone who comes by, even people here for the first time whom we’ve never met before, pick up on the excitement quickly. It’s like the energy and spirit of Neal Cassady himself is making the rounds, transferring from person to person.
Yes, it is possible all you'll walk away with is a T-shirt or whatever perk you select, but you’ll also walk away with memories, and knowing that for a brief period of time you were a part of something bigger than yourself. You became part of a collective, you’ve joined a cadre of Beat Generation fans from around the globe who want to see this spirit live on. 


Why Are Your Award Levels So High?
We’re trying to raise an awful lot of money in a very short period of time to be competitive in this auction and this entire plan came together so fast we want to err on the side of caution. Plus, some of our perks will need to be manufactured and they will need to be packed and shipped all over the world. The Beats have a very broad appeal worldwide and while shipping a T-shirt or a book here in the United States may only cost $5, shipping that same item to other countries might cost $25 or even $35. For that reason we elected to go with the higher pricepoint to ensure all shipping costs are covered. After all, it would do us little good in trying to attain our goal of bidding on and winning the Neal Cassady Joan Anderson Letter if too high a proportion of the monies raised had to go to shipping and handling.


When Should I Expect My Rewards?
You should not expect any reward to be shipped until some time in January, possibly even February for certain items. We’ll need to coordinate book signings, get T-shirts and other perks made, packed, and shipped. There will be a lot of work on the back end to complete our commitments and obligations, but we will complete them. Just don’t tell Grandma she should be expecting her Neal Cassady shirt for Christmas!


Will You Be Raising Money from Any Other Sources?
Yes, we hope to raise other monies from private sources and donations that we will be able to add to the funds pledged through this campaign.
We also expect a significant amount to be pledged to a separate, private fund by philanthropists, celebrities and other lovers of Neal Cassady, Jack Kerouac and the Beat Generation.


Will I get a refund if you don't win the auction?
No. We're going all out to win this auction, but there is no guarantee that we'll succeed. You're purchasing an item of value, and you will receive that item whether or not we are able to bid on the auction, and whether we win the auction or not.


What Makes You Think You Can Raise Enough Money to Bid?
In 2011, the white dress Marilyn Monroe wore in the movie The Seven Year Itch was put up for auction. A group came forward to create a crowd funding campaign of Marilyn Monroe fans who raised enough money to actually bid $3,100,000 on the dress. Their bid was unsuccessful as the winning bid for the dress topped $4,600,000, but their efforts proved the model can work toward its ultimate goal.


What if You Do Not Raise Enough Money to Bid?
If we do not raise enough money to bid, then we simply cannot bid. The opening bid is $300,000 and our goal amount of $500,000 would allow us to do that, even after we factor in the buyer’s premium (commission charged by the auction house) insurance, legal fees and accounting fees.


What if the Beat Museum Does Not Win the Auction?
Even if we don't win the auction or are unable to bid for any reason out of our control, your donation will still make great things happen! We’ll put the money you and others have contributed toward launching our Beat Generation Annual Conference Program, starting in the Summer of 2015. You will still collect the prize you signed up for, and you'll know that no matter what happens, you will have contributed in helping to spread the spirit of The Beat Generation.


What Is the Beat Generation Annual Conference Program?
Some of the best times many of us have ever had relating to The Beats has been at conferences:

The Beat Generation Conferences at NYU in 1994 and 1995 could be called a "last gathering of the Beats," which included Allen Ginsberg, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Anne Waldman, Harold Norse, Michael McClure, Gregory Corso, and Hunter S. Thompson.
Lowell Celebrates Kerouac is an annual event in Lowell, Massachusetts, and includes readings, musical performances, tours of Kerouac's hometown, and appearances by Beat personalities such as David Amram.
