story:
"Are You There Craigslist? It's Me, Pearl" A Book

(The Shit I've Done For Money)

WHAT:

Are You There Craigslist? It's Me, Pearl" is a book of Craigslist emails that reveal my search for work to survive as an artist in San Francisco. This intimate compilation of emails is ridiculous, mundane, comical, desperate, repetitive, sad, and vulnerable. It is a book for your coffee table, bedside table, toilet-side table, and beach towel for that easy to read poolside book. With the influence of the popular Found books, and the honesty of Amy Shumer, these email exchanges highlight my search for work on Craigslist. From my attempt to get hired as a cupcake decorator, to my success at getting my ass painted as a Rutabaga, to my rejection of a creepy man looking for a blues dancing partner, this book lets you see all the crazy bullshit I thought about, attempted, and succeeded in, while hustling to SURVIVE. 

SO?

So, my next step in this process--I need your help to get this manuscript turned into a book, complete with selected pictures I sent accompanying some of these emails! 

WHO ARE YOU?? Why is this exciting?

My name is Pearl Marill and I'm a San Francisco based choreographer, actress, and writer. I've been living in the Bay Area for a decade. In these 10 years, I've been performing, producing, directing, and creating original work in the form of live theater, short films, music videos, and sketch comedy.  My passion lies in the fusion of theater improvisation, modern dance, and comedy. Craigslist has always been a rich source of inquiry for me, and I won an Isadora Duncan Dance Award in 2012 for a piece based off the Missed Connections section of Craigslist, called  Missed Connection.

To survive as an artist anywhere is a challenge. To stay eating as an artist or just anyone that isn't involved in Tech in San Francisco is a HUGE challenge. I've compiled my decade long collection of email threads that document my consistent hustle for work and put it into a manuscript. I wanted to publish these emails for a few reasons.

1) I've received the Theater Bay Area and Dancer's Group Ca$h Fund that I'm using to select 5 artists to create new works using text from the manuscript. The dates for that show are SET! These artists will be presenting work at Pianofight in San Francisco on May 27 and 28 and the performances are to hopefully accompany the book release of "Are You There Craigslist? It's Me, Pearl." 

2) The catharsis of purging your inbox and sent box to produce a creative project is great. 

3) Like many artists, I fall under the category of being depressed when I'm not engaged in a creative endeavor. This project was a way for me to avoid depression, and make lemonade from lemons. 

4) Survival mode is real. It's funny to be a voyeur and be privvy to all the crazy shit people do for money. 

5) This is a path to broadening my channels and realizing the great world that exists outside of Craigslist. To create this book helps to hold myself accountable for changing my patterns which may not serve me any longer.

I'm asking for help from YOU to self-publish this book.

I'm excited about this project for many reasons!

1) Like I mentioned above, I've already received a grant for this project, to give to other artists to create new work. Now I'm asking for help in the publishing portion of the project. I'm halfway there!

2) Getting to compile these emails into a book has been eye-opening.  The sometimes desperate, occasionally funny, often repetitive, and frequently honest exchanges show how I/we continually shape-shift ourselves to fit into the molds we so desire.  

3)This struggle to create and look for ways to become an artistic entrepreneur is extremely relevant in San Francisco right now.   I never thought that all the emails I sent out desperately, hoping to find connection on the other side would be fader for work. I'm excited to recycle the desperation and struggle of years of my life into a creative project, to share with the world beyond myself.

4) The most exciting part! By helping me, you will help me publish my FIRST BOOK! You can read it with coffee, while you are on the toilet, or when you are depressed and need a good laugh or dose of perspective. 

What I need & What You Get

I'm asking for $1,999 because that is EXACTLY how much it costs for the black and white Debut package on Lulu's Self-Publishing packaging bundle. With this bundle, I will get one-on-one help with marketing, promotional materials, editing, book design and layout, and more. Because time is of the essence for me, it's really important that I have a solid product by the end of May, to accompany the "Are You There Craigslist? It's Me, Pearl" show.  

BREAKDOWN:

  • I am asking for exactly how much I need to pay for the specific Black and White Debut Package which is $1,999.  Any money received over this amount will go towards compensating the selected artists more money and covering marketing expenses to advertise the shows at Pianofight.
  • If I don't reach my desired goal, all the acquired funds will still go towards this publishing fee, I will fundraise in different venues and platforms to make up the difference.

The Impact

*You will be contributing and conserving the weird and wonderful artistic landscape of San Francisco.

*You will bring more laughter to the world.The world needs more laughter. Let's laugh at ourselves, and one another, with gentle compassion, and support for change.

*You might have greater appreciation for your job.

*You might want to try a new job.

*You could realize anyone can self-publish a book, with support from their people, and you can get that idea out, no matter what.

*You will be supporting artists hustling to survive in the Bay Area.

*You will receive that much more love and gratitude from me. ;)

*You will be helping me publish my first book, and if I'm honest, I have more lurking in the back corners of my Word Files. This is just the beginning.

*You are helping me to publish my FIRST book! Did I mention? It's raw. and awkward. And it's all from CRAIGSLIST! How fun and exciting.

*There will be a party to accompany this book at Pianofight to celebrate all the crazy, shitty, and wonderful things we do to survive, with performances from some super talented Bay Area artists on May 27 and 28. You're invited!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help share this campaign to anyone who may want to help move and shake this project.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! The power of social media is huge. Just a re-share with a small blurb makes a world of difference. 
  • If you do decide maybe you can help a little, remember every dollar counts. No amount is too small or too large. :) Any way you can help would be so appreciated. 

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for reading, helping, and sharing. XOXO

story:
Short Summary

Have you ever wanted to know what it’s like to be a psychic? Or maybe you think you have some abilities yourself and would like some insight? Perhaps you are just curious what it might be like to know who you were in past lives, or what it’s like to see demons, ghosts, and fallen angels? There is something for everyone in this book! Hear crazy stories and gets tips on topics like diet recommendations for sensitive people, psychic attacks (and how to protect yourself from them), and how to access your own psychic gifts. Laura also talks about what a narcissist is and why empaths and psychics can be so attracted to them and how to break this unhealthy cycle. After reading this book, you will never look at the world in the same way again!

Who is Laura Powers?

Laura is one of the top psychics in the City of Angels and has clients all over the world.  She is a psychic medium, angel communicator, actress, singer, and host. She is also an avid writer and adventurer who travels as much as her imagination allows.  She received her bachelor’s degree in theatre and her master’s degree in political science from the University of Colorado. In addition to seeing clients, Laura teaches classes on the psychic realm and writes about her experiences.  This is her 6th book on the psychic and spiritual realm and she is already working on her 7th and 8th books.  When she is not writing or traveling, you may find her exploring the unknown.  You can find more information on her work in the spiritual and metaphysical realms at www.healingpowers.net and more on her acting, singing, hosting, and creative work at www.laurapowers.net

What the Book is About

This book is about the psychic realm and features chapters on empathy, health for intuitive people, past lives, narcissists, psychic attack, and maintaining healthy boundaries.  This book will include tools and exercises for recognizing and tapping into your own psychic abilities.

How the Funds Will Be Used

Funds generated through the Indiegogo campaign will be used for professional editing of the manuscript, cover photo and design by Penny O photography, printing by Create Space, and formatting of the book in ebook formats for the kindle and other ereaders (mobi and epub format).  This budget covers getting the book print-ready, printing, and epublishing only.  Every dollar we raise above the $2,000 budget will be used for marketing and traveling to promote the book. 

*Proposed budget of what your money will be used for:

· Library of Congress registration - $50

· Cover design and layout - $150

· Editing and formatting services - $350

· Printing and shipping - $200

Any additional funds raised will be used for marketing. Here are proposed budget items:

·Audio book production - $500 or more

· Author promo shots - $150

· Marketing and promotion on Facebook and other marketing platforms - $150

Note: These are all projected expenses

The Impact

This will help me get this book out faster and with specific funds for marketing and production.  My other five books Life and the After-Life: Notes from a Medium and Angel Communicator and Angels: How to Understand, Recognize, and Receive Their Guidance,andDiary of a Ghost Whisperer, and The Angel Book of Goodness have been successfully self-published and are selling well on Amazon.  This book will help people better understand the psychic world and how to handle it. For those who are just curious about the psychic realm, this will provide a fun and entertaining read.

You can find my other books on amazon here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help me get the word out, share on Facebook etc!  Ask the angels to help me (really it works!).

Thanks in advance to everyone for their support!

story:
Story of My Book

Passion With Purpose: The Fire Within is a book that dives deeper into what it means to build a life of fulfillment, destiny, and impact by uncovering the relationship between passion and purpose. This book addresses the age-old cliche “Follow Your Passion” and replaces it with the fact that we should instead “Experience Passion.”

My name is Steven Mezzacappa and I am the author of Passion With Purpose: The Fire Within. I wrote this book because there are over 60,000 search results on Amazon for purpose, yet we still find ourselves searching for truth, significance, and ways to make social and societal impacts. After wrestling through a battle with severe depression during my final year of college and as I began my career, I uncovered a deeper relationship with God and in that relationship, my eyes were opened to God’s divine blueprints for building a life of fulfillment, destiny, and impact. This book is about these blueprints.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover you do not need anything else other than a healthy relationship with God and others in order to build a life of fulfillment, destiny, and impact. It’s my hope that, in reading this book, society’s definition of success for you fades into the distance as you for yourself uncover the blueprints to building a life that is enjoyable, meaningful, and impactful. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for “passion” itself and hope that after reading this book, you’ll never look at the word passion again. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you build passion in every season of your life whether it be a season of joy or a season of adversity.

In this book, you'll uncover a new perspective about passion and its relationship to living out a life that is fulfilling, significant, and impactful. You'll hear stories such as:

  • How embracing suffering can lead to fulfillment, destiny, & impact
  • My journey through depression and into healing
  • My experiences in Panama throughout college that served as another major inspiration for this book

You will love this book if you are passionate about self-improvement, desiring to grow deeper in your faith, and uncovering more ways to make an impact in the lives of others around you.

Passion With Purpose: The Fire Within is a nonfiction book that speaks to those looking for more passion in life and those who are looking to understand God in a deeper way.

 

The Book - Passion With Purpose: The Fire Within


Part 1 - Fulfillment - Living a Life Inspired by the Great Architect
Part 1 inspires us to look at an alternative definition of passion. It defines passion as not something we follow, but something we experience and can build within ourselves. When it comes to having a fulfilling life, it’s now so much about what we have, but truly it is about who we have and understanding what is building up or tearing down the passion within our hearts, in spite of any season we find ourselves in.

Part 2 - Destiny - Living a Life Encouraged by the Great Physician
Part 2 encourages us to learn how our passion can be driven by fear or lead by love. Throughout our lives, we will be dealt emotional wounds and if left unhealed can serve as the engine for the actions and dreams we set up for our lives. By being lead into love by the Great Physician, it is a passion that is fostered and cultivated by Jesus that not only sustains our passion, but also leads us into the destiny for our lives.

Part 3 - Impact - Living a Life Empowered by the Great Life Coach
Part 3 empowers us to make a difference in the lives of others around us by learning how to be lead and guided by the Great Life Coach, the Holy Spirit. We are equipped with the tools to not only build the fire up within ourselves, but also build up the fire and passion within those around us so that in spite of any adversity or challenge, we and others around us can walk out the callings and purpose on our lives with a passion that never burns out.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now dependent upon the pre-order tier you select:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Graduating from The Pennsylvania State University in 2017 with a B.A.E. in Architectural Engineering, Steven Mezzacappa is a Business Development Engineer for Turner Construction Company, one of the country’s largest commercial construction management firms. Before joining the workforce, Steven was recognized as the New Face of Civil Engineering in the United States in 2016. Having a passion to build buildings since he was a child, Steven has grown to develop a passion for people and is on a personal mission to inspire, encourage, and empower others around him. This book is one of the first steps in making this mission a reality.

After living out a lifelong dream the summer before his final year of college, Steven found himself battling depression when his lifelong dream was met with an unexpected dose of reality and with that disappointment. Continuing into his final year of college, despite being on Penn State’s Homecoming Court, experiencing first hand PSU Football’s B10 Championship win, and being surrounded by some of PSU’s top Student Leaders, Steven found himself in a daily battle with depression struggling to find hope and a future for himself. It was in this journey that Steven returned back to his Christian roots and in this encounter uncovered a deeper, more significant relationship with God that not only put him on a path to heal from depression, but also uncover a new vision for his life.

This book brings forward some of the most significant lessons from Steven’s experience and sheds light on a new way to look at passion and your relationship with God. Steven firmly believes that we all have inherent worth, value, and a call to love others and make a profound difference in our social circles and world; but in order to build a life like this we so desperately seek to live, it is important that we humble ourselves and continually be inspired by the Great Architect, encouraged by the Great Physician, and empowered by the Holy Spirit.

For more information, you can connect with Steven Mezzacappa at steven@passionwithpurpose.life and on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, & YouTube: @StevenMezzacappa

#PassionWithPurpose

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #PassionWithPurpose and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

With Love & Passion,
Steven F. Mezzacappa

story:
It's been just over a year since the release of the ebook version of "Downriver: A Tale of Moving Pictures Before Hollywood."  The reviews are in: 

“Downriver is compelling, entertaining reading, and for anyone with an interest in the history of film, particularly women in film, it’s essential...”

“Downriver” is an historical novel, but its themes speak very much to today... From fake news stories... to crowds rioting for contact with celebrities, the novel is rife with events echoing our present times.” and “The story serves as a resonant counterpoint to today’s #MeToo movement.”  – Amazon Kindle reviews

I've also been asked, “Is there a printed book? When it is it coming out?” A few reviewers said they'd be happy to review it – once it was in print. They looked forward to reading it, but didn't have a Kindle or other ebook reader, and didn't want to fuss with the technology. Just give me a good old-fashioned book, please!

I got the message. Now it makes sense, given a year's trial, to satisfy not only those readers and reviewers, but myself, the author, as well. I've looked into other publication options, but the signs keep returning to the place I started from, which is to self publish.

But even a self-published book can't manifest overnight. There's a new cover, formatting and many other new angles to figure out.  That's why I'm requesting your help. For a minimum $25 donation, you'll receive an autographed first edition print copy of “Downriver: A Tale of Moving Pictures Before Hollywood.”

There is a renewed interest in the role of women in early moving pictures, as seen by the high visibility of the nonfiction book and accompanying documentary “Without Lying Down” by Carrie Beauchamp and books and documentaries on the first renowned female director, Alice Guy Blache, who plays a prominent part in “Downriver.” There's even a recent children's book about her, “Lights! Camera! Alice!” by Mara Rockliff. On the current scene, there is the close attention paid to female directors Kathryn Bigelow (“The Hurt Locker,”) Greta Gerwig (“Ladybird”) and, of course, the scandals surrounding Harvey Weinstein and other male power brokers in the industry.

The origins of all these forces are there in “Downriver,” as it is mainly about the origins of American film itself.

Arrived late for the Kickstarter campaign? We raised 28.855 € and will continue adding your pledges here, to try to reach the final stretch goal!

**Stretch goals**

  • Final stretch goal: If we reach 33.333 €, every backer who pledged for the Hardcover edition will receive this stunning print. Are you ready to answer her questions? Which virtue will you pursue the most? (UNDER WAY)
  • The first stretch goal will be reached at 25.000€: a bonus chapter about Wing Commander 2 development with lots of new and unpublished content. All backers with 15€ + pledge will receive it in digital format. (COMPLETED)

Choose your virtue Avatar

Attraverso il Mongate è anche in italiano. Clicca sulla bandiera per vedere la pagina in lingua italiana.

About the Author

My name is Andrea Contato, the author of Through the Moongate. While Ultima was born at the dawn of the computer role-playing game genre, my first encounter with it was quite late: in 1994 in fact, thirteen years after its first official release. As an avid video game player and having played Wing Commander, Origin Systems Inc. was not new to me, but Ultima was.

As I began to delve into the history of Origin Systems Inc. and its co-founder Richard Garriott, I realized how closely intertwined it was with the genre of role-playing games in general. The careers of many of the most influential people in the industry of video games and computing were inspired by Richard, Origin Systems, and Ultima, and I took it upon myself to learn all that I could.

It is a story that deserves to be told.

New Insight

Through the Moongate aims to be a more complete account of Origin's history than has ever been presented before. Parts of Origin's and Richard Garriott's story have been included in other works such as The Official Book of Ultima by Shay Addams and Garriott's own memoir Explore/Create, but this book is a work of new research. In the process, I've interviewed dozens of people who were crucial to Origin's success, many of whom have worked for Origin, NCSoft, and Portalarium, and given them a voice. These developers and artists have helped to shed new light on Origin's fascinating story.

Beyond Ultima

As I traced the paths of the Ultima games and those who worked for Origin Systems, I began to realize the multitude of games that would not be possible without the influence of Richard Garriott, Origin Systems, and Ultima series upon the industry. To ensure their place in history, I've included special coverage of the Wing Commander and Ultima Underworld series, plus significant CRPGs and video games of the era such as Star Trek (PDP), Empire and other PLATO games, Escape! and RobotWar by Silas Warner, Temple of Apshai, Wizardry: Proving Grounds of the Mad Overlord, Wizardry II: The Knight of Diamonds, Escape from Mt. Drash, Moebius: The Orb of Celestial Harmony, Autoduel, Ogre, 2400 A.D., Questron, Tales of the Unknown: Volume I, Wizadore, Dungeon Master, Times of Lore, The Black Onyx, Dragon Quest, and Xanadu.

Through the Moongate is in good company

From Enrico Ricciardi to Lord British

Writing this book was an exciting and unforgettable experience with a lot of ups and downs. It was always wonderful when I found someone to interview and learn an important bit of information. Sometimes, despite my best efforts, I wasn't able to track down a key member of Origin Systems Inc. or a friend of Richard Garriott for an interview. Fortunately, through the generosity of those I could contact, I was able to fill in the gaps in nearly all cases.

Some of the rarest Akalabeth and Ultima releases, from Enrico Ricciardi collection

It's been a long road from writing and researching to publishing this volume. I wouldn't have been able to organize the translation and editing without Andreas Przygienda and Ellouise McGeachie. Enrico Ricciardi provided indispensable help in printing the books and making the video and the trailer. Enrico was also instrumental to putting me in contact with Richard Garriott and Denis Loubet and gaining their direct involvement in the project. Enrico also created the art cover of the book (with the help of Ramon Cipressi for the 3D rendering).

Rewards

This first of two volumes will be published in three different editions:

  • Digital edition: Epub and Kindle. English and Italian version available;
  • Softcover edition: 6x9" (15x23cm), approx. 250 pages, black-and-white. English and Italian version available;
  • Hardcover edition: 6.5x9.4" (16.5x24cm), approximately 240 black-and-white pages, plus 16 coated pages of color images and pictures from Richard Garriott's personal archive and Enrico Ricciardi's collection of Ultima games. The retro cover will feature an artwork by the legendary Origin artist Denis Loubet. Only English version available.

Here you can find the complete index for both volumes and more information on the project.

Perks

We worked hard to create backer perks for everyone. With just 15 € you can have your copy of Through the Moongate digital edition (Epub or Kindle). The softcover edition (English version) will be printed in the US by Blurb and directly shipped. For this option, select Softcover Edition and the shipping cost will be automatically added to your pledge.

For European citizens only, the Softcover Edition (Italian or English version) will be printed in Italy and then shipped to you. When creating and supporting a crowdfunding campaign, the shipping cost takes a large part of the overall budget. This is especially true of international shipping. So, to cut down the costs, we are using a print-on-demand service and we will organize the orders on geographical basis. 

The Hardcover Edition will be printed only in English. We decided to print it here in Italy to ensure the overall quality of the print process would be easy for us to control directly. We really care about the Special Collector's Edition and we want it to be of the very highest, impeccable quality. 

* about shipping: International shipping of books is quite expensive and tracking globally is available at different levels of detail. Some tracking services give information until the package reaches the international drop point and don't follow the package all the way to its destination. When not explicitly stated, tracked shipping may not be available. 

Enrico Ricciardi and Richard Garriott with Through the Moongate mockup

Sources

To write this book, I had the opportunity to interview the programmers, artists, designers, managers, and musicians that took part in the story of Origin Systems and worked with Richard Garriott in creating his ambitious games. 

Many of them agreed to help me, giving me permission to quote them, while others decided to tell me their story, but requested that I keep things off the record. Here is a list of those who decided to be named and directly quoted in my book (in alphabetical order):

  • Al Nelson 
  • Bill Johnson
  • Dave Albert 
  • David Ladyman 
  • David 'Iolo' Watson
  • Denis Loubet
  • Dr. Cat 
  • Edmond Meinfelder 
  • Gallara Dragon 
  • Herman Miller 
  • Ian Frazier 
  • Ken Arnold 
  • James Parkman 
  • Jeff Dee 
  • Jeff George 
  • Jeff Johannigman 
  • Jeffery Wilson 
  • John Miles 
  • John Romero
  • Mac Senour
  • Manda 
  • Matthew Walker 
  • Michael Sims
  • Mike McShaffry 
  • Paul Neurath 
  • Philip Brogden 
  • Raph Koster 
  • Raymond Benson 
  • Richard Garriott 
  • Richard 'Diko' Mather 
  • Rob Corell 
  • Robert White 
  • Siobhan Beeman 
  • Starr Long 
  • Stuart Marks 
  • Todd Porter 
  • Warren Spector

Need more info?

Follow our Facebook page, explore the official homepage for the full index and information on the book, cool trivia and more, or feel free to contact me on Facebook, Twitter or directly through IndieGoGo.

Time to read - Preview Chapter

For a sneak peek, we decided to share the chapter "Change of Guards". It's about the difficult development of Ultima VI, the first game in the series natively programmed for PC platform. I hope you enjoy reading it, and please leave feedback and let me know what you think!

Click on the first page to download the PDF file. Remember: it's only for evaluation purposes. 

Change of guards - Page 1

Risks and challenges

The risk is very low. The "Through the Moongate" book is already completed, and the editing and the translation are underway. All that's left is to complete the editing and translations, print the book, and ship it to backers.

As proof of the quality of my work, I decided to show a full chapter as a preview, so that you can evaluate yourself if it's worth your time and money.

Sometimes, despite my best efforts, I wasn't able to track down a key member of Origin Systems Inc. or a friend of Richard Garriott for an interview. Fortunately, through the generosity of those I could contact, I was able to fill in the gaps in nearly all cases.Some of the rarest Akalabeth and Ultima releases, from Enrico Ricciardi collectionIt's been a long road from writing and researching to publishing this volume. I wouldn't have been able to organize the translation and editing without Andreas Przygienda and Ellouise McGeachie. Enrico Ricciardi provided indispensable help in printing the books and making the video and the trailer. Enrico was also instrumental to putting me in contact with Richard Garriott and Denis Loubet and gaining their direct involvement in the project. Enrico also created the art cover of the book (with the help of Ramon Cipressi for the 3D rendering).RewardsThis first of two volumes will be published in three different editions:

Digital edition: Epub and Kindle. English and Italian version available;

Softcover edition: 6x9" (15x23cm), approx. 250 pages, black-and-white. English and Italian version available;

Hardcover edition: 6.5x9.4" (16.5x24cm), approximately 240 black-and-white pages, plus 16 coated pages of color images and pictures from Richard Garriott's personal archive and Enrico Ricciardi's collection of Ultima games. The retro cover will feature an artwork by the legendary Origin artist Denis Loubet. Only English version available.
Here you can find the complete index for both volumes and more information on the project.PerksWe worked hard to create backer perks for everyone. With just 15 € you can have your copy of Through the Moongate digital edition (Epub or Kindle). The softcover edition (English version) will be printed in the US by Blurb and directly shipped. For this option, select Softcover Edition and the shipping cost will be automatically added to your pledge.For European citizens only, the Softcover Edition (Italian or English version) will be printed in Italy and then shipped to you. When creating and supporting a crowdfunding campaign, the shipping cost takes a large part of the overall budget. This is especially true of international shipping. So, to cut down the costs, we are using a print-on-demand service and we will organize the orders on geographical basis. The Hardcover Edition will be printed only in English. We decided to print it here in Italy to ensure the overall quality of the print process would be easy for us to control directly. We really care about the Special Collector's Edition and we want it to be of the very highest, impeccable quality. * about shipping: International shipping of books is quite expensive and tracking globally is available at different levels of detail. Some tracking services give information until the package reaches the international drop point and don't follow the package all the way to its destination. When not explicitly stated, tracked shipping may not be available. Enrico Ricciardi and Richard Garriott with Through the Moongate mockupSourcesTo write this book, I had the opportunity to interview the programmers, artists, designers, managers, and musicians that took part in the story of Origin Systems and worked with Richard Garriott in creating his ambitious games. Many of them agreed to help me, giving me permission to quote them, while others decided to tell me their story, but requested that I keep things off the record. Here is a list of those who decided to be named and directly quoted in my book (in alphabetical order):

Need more info?Follow our Facebook page, explore the official homepage for the full index and information on the book, cool trivia and more, or feel free to contact me on Facebook, Twitter or directly through IndieGoGo.Time to read - Preview ChapterFor a sneak peek, we decided to share the chapter "Change of Guards". It's about the difficult development of Ultima VI, the first game in the series natively programmed for PC platform. I hope you enjoy reading it, and please leave feedback and let me know what you think!Click on the first page to download the PDF file. Remember: it's only for evaluation purposes.  Change of guards - Page 1Risks and challengesThe risk is very low. The "Through the Moongate" book is already completed, and the editing and the translation are underway. All that's left is to complete the editing and translations, print the book, and ship it to backers.As proof of the quality of my work, I decided to show a full chapter as a preview, so that you can evaluate yourself if it's worth your time and money.

story:
Story of My Book

Isolated in a Globalized World: Lessons from a 60,000 Year-Old Tribe is a book at the intersection of anthropological study and human geography.

My name is Dax Emerson, and I am the Author of Isolated in a Globalized World: Lessons from a 60,000 year-old tribe. I wrote this book because I wanted to take a deeper look at the future of isolation, using the Sentinelese people as an anthropological case study.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that groups such as the Sentinelese can help remind us how we value privacy, interconnectedness, and interpersonal connections. Differences in how we value these intangible traits will promote critical analysis into how we view other cultures, as well as how we view “helping” other people. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for anthropology, in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you come to your own conclusions about what the future of isolation should look like, if that isolation should be present at all. I allow readers like you the opportunity to develop your personal opinions, in lieu of “telling” readers what to believe.

In this book, you'll learn about the Sentinelese people, the role they play, how they articulate and why extremely isolated tribal groups subsist into the 21st Century:

How geography and culture intersect to create an environment where isolation from the outside world is expected.

Why we should remain cautious and thoughtful in wanting to help people groups who are isolated, even if our intentions are well-placed

Insights on the future of isolation from anthropologists, journalists, and academics.

You will love this book if you’re an individual who’s eager to learn more about the intersections of human geography, anthropology, culture, and the human condition. One does not need to be an “expert” or have prior expertise in anthropology to enjoy this book.

Isolated in a Globalized World: Lessons from a 60,000 Year-Old Tribe is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults and academic professional who are looking at the Sentinelese and isolated tribal groups for the first time.

 

The Book - Isolated in a Globalized World: Lessons from a 60,000 Year-Old Tribe

The book is written in 4 Parts:

Part 1 Contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-4. Here, the reader begins with an introduction to the author’s interest in anthropology. The idea of an “isolated people group,” is explored, as well as how such groups continue to survive in a landscape often described as “increasingly interconnected.”

Part 2 Contains Chapters 5-7 In this section, we discover the history of how the Sentinelese have been studied and observed. Here, the “Sentinelese” are described as a people group living on North Sentinel Island, located in the Andaman and Nicobar Island chain. This territory, though geographically closer to Myanmar, is administered by India. These insights include moments from Anthropologists who’ve visited North Sentinel Island, and encompass a greater sphere than traditional media coverage on the Sentinelese. We look at the lives of Dr. Triloknath Pandit & Dr. Madhumala Chattopadhyay.

Part 3 Contains Chapters 8-10, which highlight the ideological debate surrounding the Sentinelese and isolated tribal groups more broadly. In the year 2019; two competing points of view in regards to the Sentinelese are prevalent: One, that they are a human zoo whom should be assimilated into society at-large, or adversely, that they should be free to continue on with their traditional ways despite common societal expectations These opinions are diametrically opposed, and represent two distinct ways in which people outside of isolated tribal groups think about those within. We look at influencers such as blogger Matt Walsh, as well as Ed Liebow, Executive Director of the American Anthropological Association.

Part 4 Contains Chapters 11-12. Chapter 12: The concluding Chapter- Here, I use a friend’s anthropological research story to describe why I remain cautiously optimistic about anthropology’s future in solving problems related to isolation. We join Angela Benson, a fellow undergraduate researcher at the University of Rochester.


.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

Dax Emerson studied anthropology at the University of Rochester. He is majoring in anthropology. Anthropology can be described as the study of human cultures and their development.

While Dax isn’t in Rochester, he’s living with his parents, younger brother (AJ), and pet dog (Coco). In his free time, Dax likes to watch football, study maps, and go for a run. Having been born in Indiana, he is a fan of the Indianapolis Colts.

Dax wrote this book because he wanted to take a deeper look at the future of isolation, using the Sentinelese people as an anthropological case study. Although he’d heard about the Sentinelese prior to the death of American missionary John Allen Chau, the events which followed his passing prompted further investigation.

Dax lived most of his life in Round Rock, TX before heading to school in Upstate New York. His dream job is to become the director of the Library of Congress. He would also love to conduct ethnographic fieldwork in regions all across the world. However, in all honesty, Dax is not sure where he’ll go next!

For more information you can connect with Dax at demerso3@u.rochester.edu, or via LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/dax-emerson/ and Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dax.emerson.75

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use my book title, Isolated in a Globalized World and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you very much for all of your love and support.

I greatly appreciate it, and it means a lot!

Meliora [Ever Better],

Dax Emerson

story:
HAVE YOU EVER HAD AN EPIPHANY?

In 2011, while driving home one evening, the traffic slowed and my attention was drawn to a crumbling house by the side of the road. The paint was the colour of the sea and there were peeled patches exposing the Bermuda stone beneath. The louvered window was filthy but the glow of a lamp from within revealed just enough to ignite my curiosity. Framing the rows of glass was a luxurious brocade curtain that looked more like it belonged in a Venetian palazzo than an old Bermuda cottage.

At that moment I began contemplating a collection of photographs showing people at home. Beautiful, authentic portraits, shot with natural light that would reveal the essence of each subject. I could immediately visualise the exhibition; the paper I would use for the images and precisely how they would be displayed. Then, once the project was underway, I realised that a book would be a wonderful complement to the exhibition and a more complete and permanent way to share the stories. And so began my Tapestry of Tales.

   ~    ~    ~ 

I am a story-teller and for the last twenty-four years, as a fine art photographer, I have captured images of people and places around the world, not just to document them, but to evoke an emotional response. 

A few years ago I read a book in which the protagonist said that he believed that words are inherently more interesting than pictures. As an image-maker, I am not sure I agree. I believe that there is a symbiotic relationship between the two that creates a clearer and more potent message. As such, my goal with this project has been to pair powerful imagery with ardent text.

Originally I just planned to knock on the doors that called to me and hope that I would be invited in. But, after deciding to publish a book as well as having an exhibition, I felt that the inclusion of a selection of curated portraits would weave a more interesting tapestry. They say that you should write what you know, so sprinkled throughout are portraits of people I know - a few by accident and some by design.

This has been one of the most enriching experiences of my life. The extraordinary people I encountered have moved me in a way I had never expected and I will forever be grateful for their kindness. I was nervous about appearing on doorsteps uninvited, but people were receptive and gracious and surprisingly open about their lives. They not only gave me their time, sometimes they gave me their hearts. 

THE THREAD

I was asked why I had chosen the heart for the book cover and realised that at the time it had been purely because I was fond of this particular image. As my journey progressed, however, the heart became the perfect symbol for the project as it became clear that this book was not really about people's homes. While spending time with people, regardless of age, nationality, family dynamic or socio-economic status, I found that the common thread was love. Everyone was nostalgic, treasures their memories and their family history. Often, their most cherished objects were not valuable, they were sentimental. Home really is where the heart is.

 

 
 
THE TAPESTRY
I have decided to self-publish in order to retain complete creative control. I have agonised over every image and every word and am now working on finalising the book design and working with a printer to create an absolutely stunning book to house this incredible constellation of characters.
I am hoping that you would like to help me weave the last threads of the Tapestry together by contributing to this campaign. 
 
BOOK DETAILS
Hardback with foil stamped fabric cover
230-240 pages   |   9x12"   |   partially recycled matte paper 
First Edition of 2000
(As we are still in the design process, the final cover design may differ slightly from this image)
 
FINE ART PRINTS
The images in the book will be a combination of colour, black and white with some edited more creatively than others. This series of eight prints are a few of my favourites. I have edited these in a similar manner for cohesiveness, however, these exact images may not end up in either the book or at the exhibition in April. 
Image size 6x8"  |  Printed on 8.5x11" Hahnemuhle Photo Rag paper with deckled edges.  Larger sizes may be ordered, contact me for details.
 
NOTECARDS
Box of eight note cards with different images | 4x6
 
PORTRAIT SESSION
A one hour portrait session in your own home.  
Twenty edited images
One 8.5x11" print
(In Bermuda, or elsewhere, but travel expenses will be added)
 
[If using a Bermuda card, if your post code does not work, please try 00000 for the card zip code] 
 
 
 ~    ~    ~ 
 

THANK YOU

The moral support I have received for this endeavour has been amazing and I am incredibly grateful to all those that invited me into their homes, and to my loved ones for the countless hours they have spent listening and guiding me.

The last  thread, and possibly the most important, is the funding needed to turn this five year endeavour into a beautiful, tangible book. I do hope you'd like to contribute and have your own copy of Tapestry of Tales.

I understand that you may not be able to contribute funding, but if you would like to help in another way, I'd be over the moon if you could share this page with anyone you think might be interested.
